member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionSpec.Group
member.summary: group is the API group of the defined custom resource. The custom resources are served under `/apis/<group>/...`. Must match the name of the CustomResourceDefinition (in the form `<names.plural>.<group>`).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionSpec.Names
member.summary: names specify the resource and kind names for the custom resource.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionSpec.Scope
member.summary: scope indicates whether the defined custom resource is cluster- or namespace-scoped. Allowed values are `Cluster` and `Namespaced`. Default is `Namespaced`.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionSpec.AdditionalPrinterColumns
member.summary: additionalPrinterColumns specifies additional columns returned in Table output. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/using-api/api-concepts/#receiving-resources-as-tables for details. If present, this field configures columns for all versions. Top-level and per-version columns are mutually exclusive. If no top-level or per-version columns are specified, a single column displaying the age of the custom resource is used.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionSpec.Conversion
member.summary: conversion defines conversion settings for the CRD.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionSpec.PreserveUnknownFields
member.summary: preserveUnknownFields indicates that object fields which are not specified in the OpenAPI schema should be preserved when persisting to storage. apiVersion, kind, metadata and known fields inside metadata are always preserved. If false, schemas must be defined for all versions. Defaults to true in v1beta for backwards compatibility. Deprecated: will be required to be false in v1. Preservation of unknown fields can be specified in the validation schema using the `x-kubernetes-preserve-unknown-fields: true` extension. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/access-kubernetes-api/custom-resources/custom-resource-definitions/#pruning-versus-preserving-unknown-fields for details.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionSpec.Subresources
member.summary: subresources specify what subresources the defined custom resource has. If present, this field configures subresources for all versions. Top-level and per-version subresources are mutually exclusive.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionSpec.Validation
member.summary: validation describes the schema used for validation and pruning of the custom resource. If present, this validation schema is used to validate all versions. Top-level and per-version schemas are mutually exclusive.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionSpec.Version
member.summary: version is the API version of the defined custom resource. The custom resources are served under `/apis/<group>/<version>/...`. Must match the name of the first item in the `versions` list if `version` and `versions` are both specified. Optional if `versions` is specified. Deprecated: use `versions` instead.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionSpec.Versions
member.summary: versions is the list of all API versions of the defined custom resource. Optional if `version` is specified. The name of the first item in the `versions` list must match the `version` field if `version` and `versions` are both specified. Version names are used to compute the order in which served versions are listed in API discovery. If the version string is "kube-like", it will sort above non "kube-like" version strings, which are ordered lexicographically. "Kube-like" versions start with a "v", then are followed by a number (the major version), then optionally the string "alpha" or "beta" and another number (the minor version). These are sorted first by GA > beta > alpha (where GA is a version with no suffix such as beta or alpha), and then by comparing major version, then minor version. An example sorted list of versions: v10, v2, v1, v11beta2, v10beta3, v3beta1, v12alpha1, v11alpha2, foo1, foo10.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionStatus
member.summary: CustomResourceDefinitionStatus indicates the state of the CustomResourceDefinition

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionStatus.AcceptedNames
member.summary: acceptedNames are the names that are actually being used to serve discovery. They may be different than the names in spec.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionStatus.StoredVersions
member.summary: storedVersions lists all versions of CustomResources that were ever persisted. Tracking these versions allows a migration path for stored versions in etcd. The field is mutable so a migration controller can finish a migration to another version (ensuring no old objects are left in storage), and then remove the rest of the versions from this list. Versions may not be removed from `spec.versions` while they exist in this list.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionStatus.Conditions
member.summary: conditions indicate state for particular aspects of a CustomResourceDefinition

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionVersion
member.summary: CustomResourceDefinitionVersion describes a version for CRD.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionVersion.Name
member.summary: name is the version name, e.g. v1, v2beta1, etc. The custom resources are served under this version at `/apis/<group>/<version>/...` if `served` is true.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionVersion.Served

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionVersion.Storage
member.summary: storage indicates this version should be used when persisting custom resources to storage. There must be exactly one version with storage=true.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionVersion.AdditionalPrinterColumns
member.summary: additionalPrinterColumns specifies additional columns returned in Table output. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/using-api/api-concepts/#receiving-resources-as-tables for details. Top-level and per-version columns are mutually exclusive. Per-version columns must not all be set to identical values (top-level columns should be used instead). If no top-level or per-version columns are specified, a single column displaying the age of the custom resource is used.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionVersion.Schema
member.summary: schema describes the schema used for validation and pruning of this version of the custom resource. Top-level and per-version schemas are mutually exclusive. Per-version schemas must not all be set to identical values (top-level validation schema should be used instead).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceDefinitionVersion.Subresources
member.summary: subresources specify what subresources this version of the defined custom resource have. Top-level and per-version subresources are mutually exclusive. Per-version subresources must not all be set to identical values (top-level subresources should be used instead).

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceSubresourceScale
member.summary: CustomResourceSubresourceScale defines how to serve the scale subresource for CustomResources.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceSubresourceScale.SpecReplicasPath
member.summary: specReplicasPath defines the JSON path inside of a custom resource that corresponds to Scale `spec.replicas`. Only JSON paths without the array notation are allowed. Must be a JSON Path under `.spec`. If there is no value under the given path in the custom resource, the `/scale` subresource will return an error on GET.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceSubresourceScale.StatusReplicasPath
member.summary: statusReplicasPath defines the JSON path inside of a custom resource that corresponds to Scale `status.replicas`. Only JSON paths without the array notation are allowed. Must be a JSON Path under `.status`. If there is no value under the given path in the custom resource, the `status.replicas` value in the `/scale` subresource will default to 0.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.CustomResourceSubresourceScale.LabelSelectorPath
member.summary: labelSelectorPath defines the JSON path inside of a custom resource that corresponds to Scale `status.selector`. Only JSON paths without the array notation are allowed. Must be a JSON Path under `.status` or `.spec`. Must be set to work with HorizontalPodAutoscaler. The field pointed by this JSON path must be a string field (not a complex selector struct) which contains a serialized label selector in string form. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/access-kubernetes-api/custom-resources/custom-resource-definitions#scale-subresource If there is no value under the given path in the custom resource, the `status.selector` value in the `/scale` subresource will default to the empty string.

member.summary: JSONSchemaProps is a JSON-Schema following Specification Draft 4 (http://json-schema.org/).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.JSONSchemaProps.Default
member.summary: default is a default value for undefined object fields. Defaulting is a beta feature under the CustomResourceDefaulting feature gate. CustomResourceDefinitions with defaults must be created using the v1 (or newer) CustomResourceDefinition API.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.JSONSchemaProps.X_kubernetes_embedded_resource
member.summary: x-kubernetes-embedded-resource defines that the value is an embedded Kubernetes runtime.Object, with TypeMeta and ObjectMeta. The type must be object. It is allowed to further restrict the embedded object. kind, apiVersion and metadata are validated automatically. x-kubernetes-preserve-unknown-fields is allowed to be true, but does not have to be if the object is fully specified (up to kind, apiVersion, metadata).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.JSONSchemaProps.X_kubernetes_int_or_string
member.summary:
x-kubernetes-int-or-string specifies that this value is either an integer or a string. If this is true, an empty type is allowed and type as child of anyOf is permitted if following one of the following patterns:
1) anyOf: - type: integer - type: string 2) allOf: - anyOf: - type: integer - type: string - ... zero or more

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.JSONSchemaProps.X_kubernetes_list_map_keys
member.summary:
x-kubernetes-list-map-keys annotates an array with the x-kubernetes-list-type `map` by specifying the keys used as the index of the map.
This tag MUST only be used on lists that have the "x-kubernetes-list-type" extension set to "map". Also, the values specified for this attribute must be a scalar typed field of the child structure (no nesting is supported).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.JSONSchemaProps.X_kubernetes_list_type
member.summary:
x-kubernetes-list-type annotates an array to further describe its topology. This extension must only be used on lists and may have 3 possible values:
1) `atomic`: the list is treated as a single entity, like a scalar. Atomic lists will be entirely replaced when updated. This extension may be used on any type of list (struct, scalar, ...). 2) `set`: Sets are lists that must not have multiple items with the same value. Each value must be a scalar (or another atomic type). 3) `map`: These lists are like maps in that their elements have a non-index key used to identify them. Order is preserved upon merge. The map tag must only be used on a list with elements of type object. Defaults to atomic for arrays.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiExtensions.V1Beta1.JSONSchemaProps.X_kubernetes_preserve_unknown_fields
member.summary: x-kubernetes-preserve-unknown-fields stops the API server decoding step from pruning fields which are not specified in the validation schema. This affects fields recursively, but switches back to normal pruning behaviour if nested properties or additionalProperties are specified in the schema. This can either be true or undefined. False is forbidden.

url gives the location of the webhook, in standard URL form (`scheme://host:port/path`). Exactly one of `url` or `service` must be specified.
The `host` should not refer to a service running in the cluster; use the `service` field instead. The host might be resolved via external DNS in some apiservers (e.g., `kube-apiserver` cannot resolve in-cluster DNS as that would be a layering violation). `host` may also be an IP address.
Please note that using `localhost` or `127.0.0.1` as a `host` is risky unless you take great care to run this webhook on all hosts which run an apiserver which might need to make calls to this webhook. Such installs are likely to be non-portable, i.e., not easy to turn up in a new cluster.
The scheme must be "https"; the URL must begin with "https://".
A path is optional, and if present may be any string permissible in a URL. You may use the path to pass an arbitrary string to the webhook, for example, a cluster identifier.
Attempting to use a user or basic auth e.g. "user:password@" is not allowed. Fragments ("#...") and query parameters ("?...") are not allowed, either.

member.summary: GroupPriorityMininum is the priority this group should have at least. Higher priority means that the group is preferred by clients over lower priority ones. Note that other versions of this group might specify even higher GroupPriorityMininum values such that the whole group gets a higher priority. The primary sort is based on GroupPriorityMinimum, ordered highest number to lowest (20 before 10). The secondary sort is based on the alphabetical comparison of the name of the object. (v1.bar before v1.foo) We'd recommend something like: *.k8s.io (except extensions) at 18000 and PaaSes (OpenShift, Deis) are recommended to be in the 2000s

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiRegistration.V1.APIServiceSpec.Service
member.summary: Service is a reference to the service for this API server. It must communicate on port 443 If the Service is nil, that means the handling for the API groupversion is handled locally on this server. The call will simply delegate to the normal handler chain to be fulfilled.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiRegistration.V1.APIServiceSpec.VersionPriority
member.summary: VersionPriority controls the ordering of this API version inside of its group. Must be greater than zero. The primary sort is based on VersionPriority, ordered highest to lowest (20 before 10). Since it's inside of a group, the number can be small, probably in the 10s. In case of equal version priorities, the version string will be used to compute the order inside a group. If the version string is "kube-like", it will sort above non "kube-like" version strings, which are ordered lexicographically. "Kube-like" versions start with a "v", then are followed by a number (the major version), then optionally the string "alpha" or "beta" and another number (the minor version). These are sorted first by GA > beta > alpha (where GA is a version with no suffix such as beta or alpha), and then by comparing major version, then minor version. An example sorted list of versions: v10, v2, v1, v11beta2, v10beta3, v3beta1, v12alpha1, v11alpha2, foo1, foo10.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiRegistration.V1.APIServiceSpec.CaBundle
member.summary: CABundle is a PEM encoded CA bundle which will be used to validate an API server's serving certificate. If unspecified, system trust roots on the apiserver are used.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiRegistration.V1.APIServiceSpec.Group
member.summary: Group is the API group name this server hosts

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiRegistration.V1.APIServiceSpec.InsecureSkipTLSVerify
member.summary: InsecureSkipTLSVerify disables TLS certificate verification when communicating with this server. This is strongly discouraged. You should use the CABundle instead.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.ApiRegistration.V1.APIServiceSpec.Version
member.summary: Version is the API version this server hosts. For example, "v1"

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.ControllerRevision
member.summary: ControllerRevision implements an immutable snapshot of state data. Clients are responsible for serializing and deserializing the objects that contain their internal state. Once a ControllerRevision has been successfully created, it can not be updated. The API Server will fail validation of all requests that attempt to mutate the Data field. ControllerRevisions may, however, be deleted. Note that, due to its use by both the DaemonSet and StatefulSet controllers for update and rollback, this object is beta. However, it may be subject to name and representation changes in future releases, and clients should not depend on its stability. It is primarily for internal use by controllers.

member.summary: Revision indicates the revision of the state represented by Data.

member.summary: Data is the serialized representation of the state.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.DaemonSetSpec.Selector
member.summary: A label query over pods that are managed by the daemon set. Must match in order to be controlled. It must match the pod template's labels. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.DaemonSetSpec.Template
member.summary: An object that describes the pod that will be created. The DaemonSet will create exactly one copy of this pod on every node that matches the template's node selector (or on every node if no node selector is specified). More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/replicationcontroller#pod-template

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.DaemonSetSpec.MinReadySeconds
member.summary: The minimum number of seconds for which a newly created DaemonSet pod should be ready without any of its container crashing, for it to be considered available. Defaults to 0 (pod will be considered available as soon as it is ready).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.DaemonSetSpec.RevisionHistoryLimit
member.summary: The number of old history to retain to allow rollback. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 10.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.DaemonSetSpec.UpdateStrategy
member.summary: An update strategy to replace existing DaemonSet pods with new pods.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.DaemonSetStatus
member.summary: DaemonSetStatus represents the current status of a daemon set.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.DaemonSetStatus.CurrentNumberScheduled
member.summary: The number of nodes that are running at least 1 daemon pod and are supposed to run the daemon pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/daemonset/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.DaemonSetStatus.DesiredNumberScheduled
member.summary: The total number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod (including nodes correctly running the daemon pod). More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/daemonset/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.DaemonSetStatus.NumberMisscheduled
member.summary: The number of nodes that are running the daemon pod, but are not supposed to run the daemon pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/daemonset/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.DaemonSetStatus.NumberReady
member.summary: The number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod and have one or more of the daemon pod running and ready.

member.summary: Count of hash collisions for the DaemonSet. The DaemonSet controller uses this field as a collision avoidance mechanism when it needs to create the name for the newest ControllerRevision.

member.summary: The number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod and have one or more of the daemon pod running and available (ready for at least spec.minReadySeconds)

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.DeploymentSpec.ProgressDeadlineSeconds
member.summary: The maximum time in seconds for a deployment to make progress before it is considered to be failed. The deployment controller will continue to process failed deployments and a condition with a ProgressDeadlineExceeded reason will be surfaced in the deployment status. Note that progress will not be estimated during the time a deployment is paused. Defaults to 600s.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.ReplicaSetSpec.Selector
member.summary: Selector is a label query over pods that should match the replica count. Label keys and values that must match in order to be controlled by this replica set. It must match the pod template's labels. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.ReplicaSetSpec.MinReadySeconds
member.summary: Minimum number of seconds for which a newly created pod should be ready without any of its container crashing, for it to be considered available. Defaults to 0 (pod will be considered available as soon as it is ready)

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.ReplicaSetSpec.Replicas
member.summary: Replicas is the number of desired replicas. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and unspecified. Defaults to 1. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/replicationcontroller/#what-is-a-replicationcontroller

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.ReplicaSetSpec.Template
member.summary: Template is the object that describes the pod that will be created if insufficient replicas are detected. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/replicationcontroller#pod-template

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.ReplicaSetStatus
member.summary: ReplicaSetStatus represents the current status of a ReplicaSet.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.ReplicaSetStatus.Replicas
member.summary: Replicas is the most recently oberved number of replicas. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/replicationcontroller/#what-is-a-replicationcontroller

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.ReplicaSetStatus.AvailableReplicas
member.summary: The number of available replicas (ready for at least minReadySeconds) for this replica set.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.ReplicaSetStatus.Conditions
member.summary: Represents the latest available observations of a replica set's current state.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.ReplicaSetStatus.FullyLabeledReplicas
member.summary: The number of pods that have labels matching the labels of the pod template of the replicaset.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.ReplicaSetStatus.ObservedGeneration
member.summary: ObservedGeneration reflects the generation of the most recently observed ReplicaSet.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.ReplicaSetStatus.ReadyReplicas
member.summary: The number of ready replicas for this replica set.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.RollingUpdateDaemonSet
member.summary: Spec to control the desired behavior of daemon set rolling update.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.RollingUpdateDaemonSet.MaxUnavailable
member.summary: The maximum number of DaemonSet pods that can be unavailable during the update. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of total number of DaemonSet pods at the start of the update (ex: 10%). Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding up. This cannot be 0. Default value is 1. Example: when this is set to 30%, at most 30% of the total number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod (i.e. status.desiredNumberScheduled) can have their pods stopped for an update at any given time. The update starts by stopping at most 30% of those DaemonSet pods and then brings up new DaemonSet pods in their place. Once the new pods are available, it then proceeds onto other DaemonSet pods, thus ensuring that at least 70% of original number of DaemonSet pods are available at all times during the update.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.RollingUpdateDeployment
member.summary: Spec to control the desired behavior of rolling update.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.RollingUpdateDeployment.MaxSurge
member.summary: The maximum number of pods that can be scheduled above the desired number of pods. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of desired pods (ex: 10%). This can not be 0 if MaxUnavailable is 0. Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding up. Defaults to 25%. Example: when this is set to 30%, the new ReplicaSet can be scaled up immediately when the rolling update starts, such that the total number of old and new pods do not exceed 130% of desired pods. Once old pods have been killed, new ReplicaSet can be scaled up further, ensuring that total number of pods running at any time during the update is at most 130% of desired pods.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.RollingUpdateDeployment.MaxUnavailable
member.summary: The maximum number of pods that can be unavailable during the update. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of desired pods (ex: 10%). Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding down. This can not be 0 if MaxSurge is 0. Defaults to 25%. Example: when this is set to 30%, the old ReplicaSet can be scaled down to 70% of desired pods immediately when the rolling update starts. Once new pods are ready, old ReplicaSet can be scaled down further, followed by scaling up the new ReplicaSet, ensuring that the total number of pods available at all times during the update is at least 70% of desired pods.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategy
member.summary: RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategy is used to communicate parameter for RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategyType.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategy.Partition
member.summary: Partition indicates the ordinal at which the StatefulSet should be partitioned. Default value is 0.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSet
member.summary: StatefulSet represents a set of pods with consistent identities. Identities are defined as: - Network: A single stable DNS and hostname. - Storage: As many VolumeClaims as requested. The StatefulSet guarantees that a given network identity will always map to the same storage identity.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSet.Spec
member.summary: Spec defines the desired identities of pods in this set.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetCondition
member.summary: StatefulSetCondition describes the state of a statefulset at a certain point.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetCondition.Status
member.summary: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetCondition.Type
member.summary: Type of statefulset condition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetCondition.LastTransitionTime
member.summary: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetCondition.Message
member.summary: A human readable message indicating details about the transition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetCondition.Reason
member.summary: The reason for the condition's last transition.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetList
member.summary: StatefulSetList is a collection of StatefulSets.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec
member.summary: A StatefulSetSpec is the specification of a StatefulSet.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.Selector
member.summary: selector is a label query over pods that should match the replica count. It must match the pod template's labels. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.ServiceName
member.summary: serviceName is the name of the service that governs this StatefulSet. This service must exist before the StatefulSet, and is responsible for the network identity of the set. Pods get DNS/hostnames that follow the pattern: pod-specific-string.serviceName.default.svc.cluster.local where "pod-specific-string" is managed by the StatefulSet controller.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.Template
member.summary: template is the object that describes the pod that will be created if insufficient replicas are detected. Each pod stamped out by the StatefulSet will fulfill this Template, but have a unique identity from the rest of the StatefulSet.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.PodManagementPolicy
member.summary: podManagementPolicy controls how pods are created during initial scale up, when replacing pods on nodes, or when scaling down. The default policy is `OrderedReady`, where pods are created in increasing order (pod-0, then pod-1, etc) and the controller will wait until each pod is ready before continuing. When scaling down, the pods are removed in the opposite order. The alternative policy is `Parallel` which will create pods in parallel to match the desired scale without waiting, and on scale down will delete all pods at once.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.Replicas
member.summary: replicas is the desired number of replicas of the given Template. These are replicas in the sense that they are instantiations of the same Template, but individual replicas also have a consistent identity. If unspecified, defaults to 1.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.RevisionHistoryLimit
member.summary: revisionHistoryLimit is the maximum number of revisions that will be maintained in the StatefulSet's revision history. The revision history consists of all revisions not represented by a currently applied StatefulSetSpec version. The default value is 10.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.UpdateStrategy
member.summary: updateStrategy indicates the StatefulSetUpdateStrategy that will be employed to update Pods in the StatefulSet when a revision is made to Template.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.VolumeClaimTemplates
member.summary: volumeClaimTemplates is a list of claims that pods are allowed to reference. The StatefulSet controller is responsible for mapping network identities to claims in a way that maintains the identity of a pod. Every claim in this list must have at least one matching (by name) volumeMount in one container in the template. A claim in this list takes precedence over any volumes in the template, with the same name.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus
member.summary: StatefulSetStatus represents the current state of a StatefulSet.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.Replicas
member.summary: replicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.CollisionCount
member.summary: collisionCount is the count of hash collisions for the StatefulSet. The StatefulSet controller uses this field as a collision avoidance mechanism when it needs to create the name for the newest ControllerRevision.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.Conditions
member.summary: Represents the latest available observations of a statefulset's current state.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.CurrentReplicas
member.summary: currentReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller from the StatefulSet version indicated by currentRevision.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.CurrentRevision
member.summary: currentRevision, if not empty, indicates the version of the StatefulSet used to generate Pods in the sequence [0,currentReplicas).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.ObservedGeneration
member.summary: observedGeneration is the most recent generation observed for this StatefulSet. It corresponds to the StatefulSet's generation, which is updated on mutation by the API Server.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.ReadyReplicas
member.summary: readyReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller that have a Ready Condition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.UpdateRevision
member.summary: updateRevision, if not empty, indicates the version of the StatefulSet used to generate Pods in the sequence [replicas-updatedReplicas,replicas)

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.UpdatedReplicas
member.summary: updatedReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller from the StatefulSet version indicated by updateRevision.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetUpdateStrategy
member.summary: StatefulSetUpdateStrategy indicates the strategy that the StatefulSet controller will use to perform updates. It includes any additional parameters necessary to perform the update for the indicated strategy.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetUpdateStrategy.RollingUpdate
member.summary: RollingUpdate is used to communicate parameters when Type is RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategyType.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetUpdateStrategy.Type
member.summary: Type indicates the type of the StatefulSetUpdateStrategy. Default is RollingUpdate.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.ControllerRevision
member.summary:
DEPRECATED - apps/v1beta1/ControllerRevision is not supported by Kubernetes 1.16+ clusters. Use apps/v1/ControllerRevision instead.
ControllerRevision implements an immutable snapshot of state data. Clients are responsible for serializing and deserializing the objects that contain their internal state. Once a ControllerRevision has been successfully created, it can not be updated. The API Server will fail validation of all requests that attempt to mutate the Data field. ControllerRevisions may, however, be deleted. Note that, due to its use by both the DaemonSet and StatefulSet controllers for update and rollback, this object is beta. However, it may be subject to name and representation changes in future releases, and clients should not depend on its stability. It is primarily for internal use by controllers.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.ControllerRevision.Revision
member.summary: Revision indicates the revision of the state represented by Data.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.ControllerRevision.Data
member.summary: Data is the serialized representation of the state.

member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.summary: Minimum number of seconds for which a newly created pod should be ready without any of its container crashing, for it to be considered available. Defaults to 0 (pod will be considered available as soon as it is ready)

member.summary: Indicates that the deployment is paused.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentSpec.ProgressDeadlineSeconds
member.summary: The maximum time in seconds for a deployment to make progress before it is considered to be failed. The deployment controller will continue to process failed deployments and a condition with a ProgressDeadlineExceeded reason will be surfaced in the deployment status. Note that progress will not be estimated during the time a deployment is paused. Defaults to 600s.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentSpec.Replicas
member.summary: Number of desired pods. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentSpec.RevisionHistoryLimit
member.summary: The number of old ReplicaSets to retain to allow rollback. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 2.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentSpec.RollbackTo
member.summary: DEPRECATED. The config this deployment is rolling back to. Will be cleared after rollback is done.

member.summary:
DEPRECATED - apps/v1beta1/StatefulSet is not supported by Kubernetes 1.16+ clusters. Use apps/v1/StatefulSet instead.
StatefulSet represents a set of pods with consistent identities. Identities are defined as: - Network: A single stable DNS and hostname. - Storage: As many VolumeClaims as requested. The StatefulSet guarantees that a given network identity will always map to the same storage identity.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSet.Spec
member.summary: Spec defines the desired identities of pods in this set.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetCondition
member.summary: StatefulSetCondition describes the state of a statefulset at a certain point.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetCondition.Status
member.summary: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetCondition.Type
member.summary: Type of statefulset condition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetCondition.LastTransitionTime
member.summary: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetCondition.Message
member.summary: A human readable message indicating details about the transition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetCondition.Reason
member.summary: The reason for the condition's last transition.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetList
member.summary: StatefulSetList is a collection of StatefulSets.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetSpec
member.summary: A StatefulSetSpec is the specification of a StatefulSet.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetSpec.ServiceName
member.summary: serviceName is the name of the service that governs this StatefulSet. This service must exist before the StatefulSet, and is responsible for the network identity of the set. Pods get DNS/hostnames that follow the pattern: pod-specific-string.serviceName.default.svc.cluster.local where "pod-specific-string" is managed by the StatefulSet controller.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetSpec.Template
member.summary: template is the object that describes the pod that will be created if insufficient replicas are detected. Each pod stamped out by the StatefulSet will fulfill this Template, but have a unique identity from the rest of the StatefulSet.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetSpec.PodManagementPolicy
member.summary: podManagementPolicy controls how pods are created during initial scale up, when replacing pods on nodes, or when scaling down. The default policy is `OrderedReady`, where pods are created in increasing order (pod-0, then pod-1, etc) and the controller will wait until each pod is ready before continuing. When scaling down, the pods are removed in the opposite order. The alternative policy is `Parallel` which will create pods in parallel to match the desired scale without waiting, and on scale down will delete all pods at once.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetSpec.Replicas
member.summary: replicas is the desired number of replicas of the given Template. These are replicas in the sense that they are instantiations of the same Template, but individual replicas also have a consistent identity. If unspecified, defaults to 1.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetSpec.RevisionHistoryLimit
member.summary: revisionHistoryLimit is the maximum number of revisions that will be maintained in the StatefulSet's revision history. The revision history consists of all revisions not represented by a currently applied StatefulSetSpec version. The default value is 10.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetSpec.Selector
member.summary: selector is a label query over pods that should match the replica count. If empty, defaulted to labels on the pod template. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetSpec.UpdateStrategy
member.summary: updateStrategy indicates the StatefulSetUpdateStrategy that will be employed to update Pods in the StatefulSet when a revision is made to Template.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetSpec.VolumeClaimTemplates
member.summary: volumeClaimTemplates is a list of claims that pods are allowed to reference. The StatefulSet controller is responsible for mapping network identities to claims in a way that maintains the identity of a pod. Every claim in this list must have at least one matching (by name) volumeMount in one container in the template. A claim in this list takes precedence over any volumes in the template, with the same name.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetStatus
member.summary: StatefulSetStatus represents the current state of a StatefulSet.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetStatus.Replicas
member.summary: replicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetStatus.CollisionCount
member.summary: collisionCount is the count of hash collisions for the StatefulSet. The StatefulSet controller uses this field as a collision avoidance mechanism when it needs to create the name for the newest ControllerRevision.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetStatus.Conditions
member.summary: Represents the latest available observations of a statefulset's current state.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetStatus.CurrentReplicas
member.summary: currentReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller from the StatefulSet version indicated by currentRevision.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetStatus.CurrentRevision
member.summary: currentRevision, if not empty, indicates the version of the StatefulSet used to generate Pods in the sequence [0,currentReplicas).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetStatus.ObservedGeneration
member.summary: observedGeneration is the most recent generation observed for this StatefulSet. It corresponds to the StatefulSet's generation, which is updated on mutation by the API Server.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetStatus.ReadyReplicas
member.summary: readyReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller that have a Ready Condition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetStatus.UpdateRevision
member.summary: updateRevision, if not empty, indicates the version of the StatefulSet used to generate Pods in the sequence [replicas-updatedReplicas,replicas)

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetStatus.UpdatedReplicas
member.summary: updatedReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller from the StatefulSet version indicated by updateRevision.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetUpdateStrategy
member.summary: StatefulSetUpdateStrategy indicates the strategy that the StatefulSet controller will use to perform updates. It includes any additional parameters necessary to perform the update for the indicated strategy.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetUpdateStrategy.RollingUpdate
member.summary: RollingUpdate is used to communicate parameters when Type is RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategyType.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta1.StatefulSetUpdateStrategy.Type
member.summary: Type indicates the type of the StatefulSetUpdateStrategy.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.ControllerRevision
member.summary:
DEPRECATED - apps/v1beta2/ControllerRevision is not supported by Kubernetes 1.16+ clusters. Use apps/v1/ControllerRevision instead.
ControllerRevision implements an immutable snapshot of state data. Clients are responsible for serializing and deserializing the objects that contain their internal state. Once a ControllerRevision has been successfully created, it can not be updated. The API Server will fail validation of all requests that attempt to mutate the Data field. ControllerRevisions may, however, be deleted. Note that, due to its use by both the DaemonSet and StatefulSet controllers for update and rollback, this object is beta. However, it may be subject to name and representation changes in future releases, and clients should not depend on its stability. It is primarily for internal use by controllers.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.ControllerRevision.Revision
member.summary: Revision indicates the revision of the state represented by Data.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.ControllerRevision.Data
member.summary: Data is the serialized representation of the state.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.ControllerRevision.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.summary: DaemonSetSpec is the specification of a daemon set.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.DaemonSetSpec.Selector
member.summary: A label query over pods that are managed by the daemon set. Must match in order to be controlled. It must match the pod template's labels. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.DaemonSetSpec.Template
member.summary: An object that describes the pod that will be created. The DaemonSet will create exactly one copy of this pod on every node that matches the template's node selector (or on every node if no node selector is specified). More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/replicationcontroller#pod-template

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.DaemonSetSpec.MinReadySeconds
member.summary: The minimum number of seconds for which a newly created DaemonSet pod should be ready without any of its container crashing, for it to be considered available. Defaults to 0 (pod will be considered available as soon as it is ready).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.DaemonSetSpec.RevisionHistoryLimit
member.summary: The number of old history to retain to allow rollback. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 10.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.DaemonSetSpec.UpdateStrategy
member.summary: An update strategy to replace existing DaemonSet pods with new pods.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.DaemonSetStatus
member.summary: DaemonSetStatus represents the current status of a daemon set.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.DaemonSetStatus.CurrentNumberScheduled
member.summary: The number of nodes that are running at least 1 daemon pod and are supposed to run the daemon pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/daemonset/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.DaemonSetStatus.DesiredNumberScheduled
member.summary: The total number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod (including nodes correctly running the daemon pod). More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/daemonset/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.DaemonSetStatus.NumberMisscheduled

member.summary: The number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod and have one or more of the daemon pod running and ready.

member.summary: Count of hash collisions for the DaemonSet. The DaemonSet controller uses this field as a collision avoidance mechanism when it needs to create the name for the newest ControllerRevision.

member.summary: The number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod and have one or more of the daemon pod running and available (ready for at least spec.minReadySeconds)

member.summary: The number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod and have none of the daemon pod running and available (ready for at least spec.minReadySeconds)

member.summary: The most recent generation observed by the daemon set controller.

member.summary: Minimum number of seconds for which a newly created pod should be ready without any of its container crashing, for it to be considered available. Defaults to 0 (pod will be considered available as soon as it is ready)

member.summary: Indicates that the deployment is paused.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.DeploymentSpec.ProgressDeadlineSeconds
member.summary: The maximum time in seconds for a deployment to make progress before it is considered to be failed. The deployment controller will continue to process failed deployments and a condition with a ProgressDeadlineExceeded reason will be surfaced in the deployment status. Note that progress will not be estimated during the time a deployment is paused. Defaults to 600s.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.DeploymentSpec.Replicas
member.summary: Number of desired pods. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 1.

member.summary: The number of old ReplicaSets to retain to allow rollback. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 10.

member.summary: Minimum number of seconds for which a newly created pod should be ready without any of its container crashing, for it to be considered available. Defaults to 0 (pod will be considered available as soon as it is ready)

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.ReplicaSetSpec.Replicas
member.summary: Replicas is the number of desired replicas. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and unspecified. Defaults to 1. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/replicationcontroller/#what-is-a-replicationcontroller

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.ReplicaSetSpec.Template
member.summary: Template is the object that describes the pod that will be created if insufficient replicas are detected. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/replicationcontroller#pod-template

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.RollingUpdateDaemonSet
member.summary: Spec to control the desired behavior of daemon set rolling update.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.RollingUpdateDaemonSet.MaxUnavailable
member.summary: The maximum number of DaemonSet pods that can be unavailable during the update. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of total number of DaemonSet pods at the start of the update (ex: 10%). Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding up. This cannot be 0. Default value is 1. Example: when this is set to 30%, at most 30% of the total number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod (i.e. status.desiredNumberScheduled) can have their pods stopped for an update at any given time. The update starts by stopping at most 30% of those DaemonSet pods and then brings up new DaemonSet pods in their place. Once the new pods are available, it then proceeds onto other DaemonSet pods, thus ensuring that at least 70% of original number of DaemonSet pods are available at all times during the update.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.RollingUpdateDeployment
member.summary: Spec to control the desired behavior of rolling update.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.RollingUpdateDeployment.MaxSurge
member.summary: The maximum number of pods that can be scheduled above the desired number of pods. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of desired pods (ex: 10%). This can not be 0 if MaxUnavailable is 0. Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding up. Defaults to 25%. Example: when this is set to 30%, the new ReplicaSet can be scaled up immediately when the rolling update starts, such that the total number of old and new pods do not exceed 130% of desired pods. Once old pods have been killed, new ReplicaSet can be scaled up further, ensuring that total number of pods running at any time during the update is at most 130% of desired pods.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.RollingUpdateDeployment.MaxUnavailable
member.summary: The maximum number of pods that can be unavailable during the update. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of desired pods (ex: 10%). Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding down. This can not be 0 if MaxSurge is 0. Defaults to 25%. Example: when this is set to 30%, the old ReplicaSet can be scaled down to 70% of desired pods immediately when the rolling update starts. Once new pods are ready, old ReplicaSet can be scaled down further, followed by scaling up the new ReplicaSet, ensuring that the total number of pods available at all times during the update is at least 70% of desired pods.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategy
member.summary: RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategy is used to communicate parameter for RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategyType.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategy.Partition

member.summary: label selector for pods that should match the replicas count. This is a serializated version of both map-based and more expressive set-based selectors. This is done to avoid introspection in the clients. The string will be in the same format as the query-param syntax. If the target type only supports map-based selectors, both this field and map-based selector field are populated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSet
member.summary:
DEPRECATED - apps/v1beta2/StatefulSet is not supported by Kubernetes 1.16+ clusters. Use apps/v1/StatefulSet instead.
StatefulSet represents a set of pods with consistent identities. Identities are defined as: - Network: A single stable DNS and hostname. - Storage: As many VolumeClaims as requested. The StatefulSet guarantees that a given network identity will always map to the same storage identity.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSet.Spec
member.summary: Spec defines the desired identities of pods in this set.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetCondition
member.summary: StatefulSetCondition describes the state of a statefulset at a certain point.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetCondition.Status
member.summary: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetCondition.Type
member.summary: Type of statefulset condition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetCondition.LastTransitionTime
member.summary: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetCondition.Message
member.summary: A human readable message indicating details about the transition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetCondition.Reason
member.summary: The reason for the condition's last transition.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetList
member.summary: StatefulSetList is a collection of StatefulSets.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec
member.summary: A StatefulSetSpec is the specification of a StatefulSet.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.Selector
member.summary: selector is a label query over pods that should match the replica count. It must match the pod template's labels. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.ServiceName
member.summary: serviceName is the name of the service that governs this StatefulSet. This service must exist before the StatefulSet, and is responsible for the network identity of the set. Pods get DNS/hostnames that follow the pattern: pod-specific-string.serviceName.default.svc.cluster.local where "pod-specific-string" is managed by the StatefulSet controller.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.Template
member.summary: template is the object that describes the pod that will be created if insufficient replicas are detected. Each pod stamped out by the StatefulSet will fulfill this Template, but have a unique identity from the rest of the StatefulSet.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.PodManagementPolicy
member.summary: podManagementPolicy controls how pods are created during initial scale up, when replacing pods on nodes, or when scaling down. The default policy is `OrderedReady`, where pods are created in increasing order (pod-0, then pod-1, etc) and the controller will wait until each pod is ready before continuing. When scaling down, the pods are removed in the opposite order. The alternative policy is `Parallel` which will create pods in parallel to match the desired scale without waiting, and on scale down will delete all pods at once.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.Replicas
member.summary: replicas is the desired number of replicas of the given Template. These are replicas in the sense that they are instantiations of the same Template, but individual replicas also have a consistent identity. If unspecified, defaults to 1.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.RevisionHistoryLimit
member.summary: revisionHistoryLimit is the maximum number of revisions that will be maintained in the StatefulSet's revision history. The revision history consists of all revisions not represented by a currently applied StatefulSetSpec version. The default value is 10.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.UpdateStrategy
member.summary: updateStrategy indicates the StatefulSetUpdateStrategy that will be employed to update Pods in the StatefulSet when a revision is made to Template.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.VolumeClaimTemplates
member.summary: volumeClaimTemplates is a list of claims that pods are allowed to reference. The StatefulSet controller is responsible for mapping network identities to claims in a way that maintains the identity of a pod. Every claim in this list must have at least one matching (by name) volumeMount in one container in the template. A claim in this list takes precedence over any volumes in the template, with the same name.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus
member.summary: StatefulSetStatus represents the current state of a StatefulSet.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.Replicas
member.summary: replicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.CollisionCount
member.summary: collisionCount is the count of hash collisions for the StatefulSet. The StatefulSet controller uses this field as a collision avoidance mechanism when it needs to create the name for the newest ControllerRevision.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.Conditions
member.summary: Represents the latest available observations of a statefulset's current state.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.CurrentReplicas
member.summary: currentReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller from the StatefulSet version indicated by currentRevision.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.CurrentRevision
member.summary: currentRevision, if not empty, indicates the version of the StatefulSet used to generate Pods in the sequence [0,currentReplicas).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.ObservedGeneration
member.summary: observedGeneration is the most recent generation observed for this StatefulSet. It corresponds to the StatefulSet's generation, which is updated on mutation by the API Server.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.ReadyReplicas
member.summary: readyReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller that have a Ready Condition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.UpdateRevision
member.summary: updateRevision, if not empty, indicates the version of the StatefulSet used to generate Pods in the sequence [replicas-updatedReplicas,replicas)

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.UpdatedReplicas
member.summary: updatedReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller from the StatefulSet version indicated by updateRevision.

member.summary: StatefulSetUpdateStrategy indicates the strategy that the StatefulSet controller will use to perform updates. It includes any additional parameters necessary to perform the update for the indicated strategy.

member.summary: `name` is the name of the service. Required

member.summary: `path` is an optional URL path which will be sent in any request to this service.

member.summary: If specified, the port on the service that hosting webhook. Default to 443 for backward compatibility. `port` should be a valid port number (1-65535, inclusive).

member.summary: Webhook holds the configuration of the webhook

member.summary: ClientConfig holds the connection parameters for the webhook required

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.AuditRegistraion.V1Alpha1.Webhook.Throttle
member.summary: Throttle holds the options for throttling the webhook

member.summary: WebhookClientConfig contains the information to make a connection with the webhook

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.AuditRegistraion.V1Alpha1.WebhookClientConfig.CaBundle
member.summary: `caBundle` is a PEM encoded CA bundle which will be used to validate the webhook's server certificate. If unspecified, system trust roots on the apiserver are used.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.AuditRegistraion.V1Alpha1.WebhookClientConfig.Service
member.summary:
`service` is a reference to the service for this webhook. Either `service` or `url` must be specified.
If the webhook is running within the cluster, then you should use `service`.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.AuditRegistraion.V1Alpha1.WebhookClientConfig.Url
member.summary:
`url` gives the location of the webhook, in standard URL form (`scheme://host:port/path`). Exactly one of `url` or `service` must be specified.
The `host` should not refer to a service running in the cluster; use the `service` field instead. The host might be resolved via external DNS in some apiservers (e.g., `kube-apiserver` cannot resolve in-cluster DNS as that would be a layering violation). `host` may also be an IP address.
Please note that using `localhost` or `127.0.0.1` as a `host` is risky unless you take great care to run this webhook on all hosts which run an apiserver which might need to make calls to this webhook. Such installs are likely to be non-portable, i.e., not easy to turn up in a new cluster.
The scheme must be "https"; the URL must begin with "https://".
A path is optional, and if present may be any string permissible in a URL. You may use the path to pass an arbitrary string to the webhook, for example, a cluster identifier.
Attempting to use a user or basic auth e.g. "user:password@" is not allowed. Fragments ("#...") and query parameters ("?...") are not allowed, either.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.AuditRegistraion.V1Alpha1.WebhookThrottleConfig
member.summary: WebhookThrottleConfig holds the configuration for throttling events

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.AuditRegistraion.V1Alpha1.WebhookThrottleConfig.Burst
member.summary: ThrottleBurst is the maximum number of events sent at the same moment default 15 QPS

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.AuditRegistraion.V1Alpha1.WebhookThrottleConfig.Qps
member.summary: ThrottleQPS maximum number of batches per second default 10 QPS

member.summary: Name of the referent.

member.summary: TokenRequest requests a token for a given service account.

member.summary: TokenRequestSpec contains client provided parameters of a token request.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenRequestSpec.Audiences
member.summary: Audiences are the intendend audiences of the token. A recipient of a token must identitfy themself with an identifier in the list of audiences of the token, and otherwise should reject the token. A token issued for multiple audiences may be used to authenticate against any of the audiences listed but implies a high degree of trust between the target audiences.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenRequestSpec.BoundObjectRef
member.summary: BoundObjectRef is a reference to an object that the token will be bound to. The token will only be valid for as long as the bound object exists. NOTE: The API server's TokenReview endpoint will validate the BoundObjectRef, but other audiences may not. Keep ExpirationSeconds small if you want prompt revocation.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenRequestSpec.ExpirationSeconds
member.summary: ExpirationSeconds is the requested duration of validity of the request. The token issuer may return a token with a different validity duration so a client needs to check the 'expiration' field in a response.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenRequestStatus
member.summary: TokenRequestStatus is the result of a token request.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenRequestStatus.ExpirationTimestamp
member.summary: ExpirationTimestamp is the time of expiration of the returned token.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenRequestStatus.Token
member.summary: Token is the opaque bearer token.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReview
member.summary: TokenReview attempts to authenticate a token to a known user. Note: TokenReview requests may be cached by the webhook token authenticator plugin in the kube-apiserver.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReview.Spec
member.summary: Spec holds information about the request being evaluated

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewSpec
member.summary: TokenReviewSpec is a description of the token authentication request.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewSpec.Audiences
member.summary: Audiences is a list of the identifiers that the resource server presented with the token identifies as. Audience-aware token authenticators will verify that the token was intended for at least one of the audiences in this list. If no audiences are provided, the audience will default to the audience of the Kubernetes apiserver.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewSpec.Token
member.summary: Token is the opaque bearer token.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewStatus
member.summary: TokenReviewStatus is the result of the token authentication request.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewStatus.Audiences
member.summary: Audiences are audience identifiers chosen by the authenticator that are compatible with both the TokenReview and token. An identifier is any identifier in the intersection of the TokenReviewSpec audiences and the token's audiences. A client of the TokenReview API that sets the spec.audiences field should validate that a compatible audience identifier is returned in the status.audiences field to ensure that the TokenReview server is audience aware. If a TokenReview returns an empty status.audience field where status.authenticated is "true", the token is valid against the audience of the Kubernetes API server.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewStatus.Authenticated
member.summary: Authenticated indicates that the token was associated with a known user.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewStatus.Error
member.summary: Error indicates that the token couldn't be checked

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewStatus.User
member.summary: User is the UserInfo associated with the provided token.

member.summary: TokenReviewSpec is a description of the token authentication request.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1Beta1.TokenReviewSpec.Audiences
member.summary: Audiences is a list of the identifiers that the resource server presented with the token identifies as. Audience-aware token authenticators will verify that the token was intended for at least one of the audiences in this list. If no audiences are provided, the audience will default to the audience of the Kubernetes apiserver.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1Beta1.TokenReviewSpec.Token
member.summary: Token is the opaque bearer token.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1Beta1.TokenReviewStatus
member.summary: TokenReviewStatus is the result of the token authentication request.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1Beta1.TokenReviewStatus.Audiences
member.summary: Audiences are audience identifiers chosen by the authenticator that are compatible with both the TokenReview and token. An identifier is any identifier in the intersection of the TokenReviewSpec audiences and the token's audiences. A client of the TokenReview API that sets the spec.audiences field should validate that a compatible audience identifier is returned in the status.audiences field to ensure that the TokenReview server is audience aware. If a TokenReview returns an empty status.audience field where status.authenticated is "true", the token is valid against the audience of the Kubernetes API server.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1Beta1.TokenReviewStatus.Authenticated
member.summary: Authenticated indicates that the token was associated with a known user.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1Beta1.TokenReviewStatus.Error
member.summary: Error indicates that the token couldn't be checked

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1Beta1.TokenReviewStatus.User
member.summary: User is the UserInfo associated with the provided token.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1Beta1.UserInfo
member.summary: UserInfo holds the information about the user needed to implement the user.Info interface.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1Beta1.UserInfo.Extra
member.summary: Any additional information provided by the authenticator.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1Beta1.UserInfo.Groups
member.summary: The names of groups this user is a part of.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1Beta1.UserInfo.Uid
member.summary: A unique value that identifies this user across time. If this user is deleted and another user by the same name is added, they will have different UIDs.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authentication.V1Beta1.UserInfo.Username
member.summary: The name that uniquely identifies this user among all active users.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.LocalSubjectAccessReview
member.summary: LocalSubjectAccessReview checks whether or not a user or group can perform an action in a given namespace. Having a namespace scoped resource makes it much easier to grant namespace scoped policy that includes permissions checking.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.LocalSubjectAccessReview.Spec
member.summary: Spec holds information about the request being evaluated. spec.namespace must be equal to the namespace you made the request against. If empty, it is defaulted.

member.summary: NonResourceAttributes includes the authorization attributes available for non-resource requests to the Authorizer interface
