member.summary: Path is the URL path of the request

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.NonResourceAttributes.Verb
member.summary: Verb is the standard HTTP verb

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.NonResourceRule
member.summary: NonResourceRule holds information that describes a rule for the non-resource

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.NonResourceRule.Verbs
member.summary: Verb is a list of kubernetes non-resource API verbs, like: get, post, put, delete, patch, head, options. "*" means all.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.NonResourceRule.NonResourceURLs
member.summary: NonResourceURLs is a set of partial urls that a user should have access to. *s are allowed, but only as the full, final step in the path. "*" means all.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.ResourceAttributes
member.summary: ResourceAttributes includes the authorization attributes available for resource requests to the Authorizer interface

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.ResourceAttributes.Group
member.summary: Group is the API Group of the Resource. "*" means all.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.ResourceAttributes.Name
member.summary: Name is the name of the resource being requested for a "get" or deleted for a "delete". "" (empty) means all.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.ResourceAttributes.Namespace
member.summary: Namespace is the namespace of the action being requested. Currently, there is no distinction between no namespace and all namespaces "" (empty) is defaulted for LocalSubjectAccessReviews "" (empty) is empty for cluster-scoped resources "" (empty) means "all" for namespace scoped resources from a SubjectAccessReview or SelfSubjectAccessReview

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.ResourceAttributes.Resource
member.summary: Resource is one of the existing resource types. "*" means all.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.ResourceAttributes.Subresource
member.summary: Subresource is one of the existing resource types. "" means none.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.ResourceAttributes.Verb
member.summary: Verb is a kubernetes resource API verb, like: get, list, watch, create, update, delete, proxy. "*" means all.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.ResourceAttributes.Version
member.summary: Version is the API Version of the Resource. "*" means all.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.ResourceRule
member.summary: ResourceRule is the list of actions the subject is allowed to perform on resources. The list ordering isn't significant, may contain duplicates, and possibly be incomplete.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.ResourceRule.Verbs
member.summary: Verb is a list of kubernetes resource API verbs, like: get, list, watch, create, update, delete, proxy. "*" means all.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.ResourceRule.ApiGroups
member.summary: APIGroups is the name of the APIGroup that contains the resources. If multiple API groups are specified, any action requested against one of the enumerated resources in any API group will be allowed. "*" means all.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.ResourceRule.ResourceNames
member.summary: ResourceNames is an optional white list of names that the rule applies to. An empty set means that everything is allowed. "*" means all.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.ResourceRule.Resources
member.summary: Resources is a list of resources this rule applies to. "*" means all in the specified apiGroups. "*/foo" represents the subresource 'foo' for all resources in the specified apiGroups.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SelfSubjectAccessReview
member.summary: SelfSubjectAccessReview checks whether or the current user can perform an action. Not filling in a spec.namespace means "in all namespaces". Self is a special case, because users should always be able to check whether they can perform an action

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SelfSubjectAccessReview.Spec
member.summary: Spec holds information about the request being evaluated. user and groups must be empty

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SelfSubjectAccessReviewSpec
member.summary: SelfSubjectAccessReviewSpec is a description of the access request. Exactly one of ResourceAuthorizationAttributes and NonResourceAuthorizationAttributes must be set

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SelfSubjectAccessReviewSpec.NonResourceAttributes
member.summary: NonResourceAttributes describes information for a non-resource access request

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SelfSubjectAccessReviewSpec.ResourceAttributes
member.summary: ResourceAuthorizationAttributes describes information for a resource access request

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SelfSubjectRulesReview
member.summary: SelfSubjectRulesReview enumerates the set of actions the current user can perform within a namespace. The returned list of actions may be incomplete depending on the server's authorization mode, and any errors experienced during the evaluation. SelfSubjectRulesReview should be used by UIs to show/hide actions, or to quickly let an end user reason about their permissions. It should NOT Be used by external systems to drive authorization decisions as this raises confused deputy, cache lifetime/revocation, and correctness concerns. SubjectAccessReview, and LocalAccessReview are the correct way to defer authorization decisions to the API server.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SelfSubjectRulesReview.Spec
member.summary: Spec holds information about the request being evaluated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SelfSubjectRulesReviewSpec.Namespace
member.summary: Namespace to evaluate rules for. Required.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReview
member.summary: SubjectAccessReview checks whether or not a user or group can perform an action.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReview.Spec
member.summary: Spec holds information about the request being evaluated

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewSpec
member.summary: SubjectAccessReviewSpec is a description of the access request. Exactly one of ResourceAuthorizationAttributes and NonResourceAuthorizationAttributes must be set

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewSpec.Extra
member.summary: Extra corresponds to the user.Info.GetExtra() method from the authenticator. Since that is input to the authorizer it needs a reflection here.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewSpec.Groups
member.summary: Groups is the groups you're testing for.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewSpec.NonResourceAttributes
member.summary: NonResourceAttributes describes information for a non-resource access request

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewSpec.ResourceAttributes
member.summary: ResourceAuthorizationAttributes describes information for a resource access request

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewSpec.Uid
member.summary: UID information about the requesting user.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewSpec.User
member.summary: User is the user you're testing for. If you specify "User" but not "Groups", then is it interpreted as "What if User were not a member of any groups

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewStatus
member.summary: SubjectAccessReviewStatus

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewStatus.Allowed
member.summary: Allowed is required. True if the action would be allowed, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewStatus.Denied
member.summary: Denied is optional. True if the action would be denied, otherwise false. If both allowed is false and denied is false, then the authorizer has no opinion on whether to authorize the action. Denied may not be true if Allowed is true.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewStatus.EvaluationError
member.summary: EvaluationError is an indication that some error occurred during the authorization check. It is entirely possible to get an error and be able to continue determine authorization status in spite of it. For instance, RBAC can be missing a role, but enough roles are still present and bound to reason about the request.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewStatus.Reason
member.summary: Reason is optional. It indicates why a request was allowed or denied.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectRulesReviewStatus
member.summary: SubjectRulesReviewStatus contains the result of a rules check. This check can be incomplete depending on the set of authorizers the server is configured with and any errors experienced during evaluation. Because authorization rules are additive, if a rule appears in a list it's safe to assume the subject has that permission, even if that list is incomplete.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectRulesReviewStatus.Incomplete
member.summary: Incomplete is true when the rules returned by this call are incomplete. This is most commonly encountered when an authorizer, such as an external authorizer, doesn't support rules evaluation.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectRulesReviewStatus.NonResourceRules
member.summary: NonResourceRules is the list of actions the subject is allowed to perform on non-resources. The list ordering isn't significant, may contain duplicates, and possibly be incomplete.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectRulesReviewStatus.ResourceRules
member.summary: ResourceRules is the list of actions the subject is allowed to perform on resources. The list ordering isn't significant, may contain duplicates, and possibly be incomplete.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectRulesReviewStatus.EvaluationError
member.summary: EvaluationError can appear in combination with Rules. It indicates an error occurred during rule evaluation, such as an authorizer that doesn't support rule evaluation, and that ResourceRules and/or NonResourceRules may be incomplete.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.MaxReplicas
member.summary: upper limit for the number of pods that can be set by the autoscaler; cannot be smaller than MinReplicas.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.ScaleTargetRef
member.summary: reference to scaled resource; horizontal pod autoscaler will learn the current resource consumption and will set the desired number of pods by using its Scale subresource.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.MinReplicas
member.summary: minReplicas is the lower limit for the number of replicas to which the autoscaler can scale down. It defaults to 1 pod. minReplicas is allowed to be 0 if the alpha feature gate HPAScaleToZero is enabled and at least one Object or External metric is configured. Scaling is active as long as at least one metric value is available.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.TargetCPUUtilizationPercentage
member.summary: target average CPU utilization (represented as a percentage of requested CPU) over all the pods; if not specified the default autoscaling policy will be used.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.MaxReplicas
member.summary: maxReplicas is the upper limit for the number of replicas to which the autoscaler can scale up. It cannot be less that minReplicas.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.ScaleTargetRef
member.summary: scaleTargetRef points to the target resource to scale, and is used to the pods for which metrics should be collected, as well as to actually change the replica count.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.Metrics
member.summary: metrics contains the specifications for which to use to calculate the desired replica count (the maximum replica count across all metrics will be used). The desired replica count is calculated multiplying the ratio between the target value and the current value by the current number of pods. Ergo, metrics used must decrease as the pod count is increased, and vice-versa. See the individual metric source types for more information about how each type of metric must respond.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.MinReplicas
member.summary: minReplicas is the lower limit for the number of replicas to which the autoscaler can scale down. It defaults to 1 pod. minReplicas is allowed to be 0 if the alpha feature gate HPAScaleToZero is enabled and at least one Object or External metric is configured. Scaling is active as long as at least one metric value is available.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus
member.summary: HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus describes the current status of a horizontal pod autoscaler.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.Conditions
member.summary: conditions is the set of conditions required for this autoscaler to scale its target, and indicates whether or not those conditions are met.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.CurrentReplicas
member.summary: currentReplicas is current number of replicas of pods managed by this autoscaler, as last seen by the autoscaler.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.DesiredReplicas
member.summary: desiredReplicas is the desired number of replicas of pods managed by this autoscaler, as last calculated by the autoscaler.

member.summary: currentMetrics is the last read state of the metrics used by this autoscaler.

member.summary: lastScaleTime is the last time the HorizontalPodAutoscaler scaled the number of pods, used by the autoscaler to control how often the number of pods is changed.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.ObservedGeneration
member.summary: observedGeneration is the most recent generation observed by this autoscaler.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricSpec
member.summary: MetricSpec specifies how to scale based on a single metric (only `type` and one other matching field should be set at once).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricSpec.Type
member.summary: type is the type of metric source. It should be one of "Object", "Pods" or "Resource", each mapping to a matching field in the object.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricSpec.External
member.summary: external refers to a global metric that is not associated with any Kubernetes object. It allows autoscaling based on information coming from components running outside of cluster (for example length of queue in cloud messaging service, or QPS from loadbalancer running outside of cluster).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricSpec.Object
member.summary: object refers to a metric describing a single kubernetes object (for example, hits-per-second on an Ingress object).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricSpec.Pods
member.summary: pods refers to a metric describing each pod in the current scale target (for example, transactions-processed-per-second). The values will be averaged together before being compared to the target value.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricSpec.Resource
member.summary: resource refers to a resource metric (such as those specified in requests and limits) known to Kubernetes describing each pod in the current scale target (e.g. CPU or memory). Such metrics are built in to Kubernetes, and have special scaling options on top of those available to normal per-pod metrics using the "pods" source.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricStatus
member.summary: MetricStatus describes the last-read state of a single metric.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricStatus.Type
member.summary: type is the type of metric source. It will be one of "Object", "Pods" or "Resource", each corresponds to a matching field in the object.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricStatus.External
member.summary: external refers to a global metric that is not associated with any Kubernetes object. It allows autoscaling based on information coming from components running outside of cluster (for example length of queue in cloud messaging service, or QPS from loadbalancer running outside of cluster).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricStatus.Pods
member.summary: pods refers to a metric describing each pod in the current scale target (for example, transactions-processed-per-second). The values will be averaged together before being compared to the target value.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricStatus.Resource

member.summary: metricName is the name of the metric in question.

member.summary: target is the described Kubernetes object.

member.summary: selector is the string-encoded form of a standard kubernetes label selector for the given metric When set, it is passed as an additional parameter to the metrics server for more specific metrics scoping When unset, just the metricName will be used to gather metrics.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ObjectMetricStatus
member.summary: ObjectMetricStatus indicates the current value of a metric describing a kubernetes object (for example, hits-per-second on an Ingress object).

member.summary: target is the described Kubernetes object.

member.summary: averageValue is the current value of the average of the metric across all relevant pods (as a quantity)

When unset, just the metricName will be used to gather metrics.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricSource
member.summary: ResourceMetricSource indicates how to scale on a resource metric known to Kubernetes, as specified in requests and limits, describing each pod in the current scale target (e.g. CPU or memory). The values will be averaged together before being compared to the target. Such metrics are built in to Kubernetes, and have special scaling options on top of those available to normal per-pod metrics using the "pods" source. Only one "target" type should be set.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricSource.Name
member.summary: name is the name of the resource in question.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricSource.TargetAverageUtilization
member.summary: targetAverageUtilization is the target value of the average of the resource metric across all relevant pods, represented as a percentage of the requested value of the resource for the pods.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricSource.TargetAverageValue
member.summary: targetAverageValue is the target value of the average of the resource metric across all relevant pods, as a raw value (instead of as a percentage of the request), similar to the "pods" metric source type.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricStatus
member.summary: ResourceMetricStatus indicates the current value of a resource metric known to Kubernetes, as specified in requests and limits, describing each pod in the current scale target (e.g. CPU or memory). Such metrics are built in to Kubernetes, and have special scaling options on top of those available to normal per-pod metrics using the "pods" source.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricStatus.CurrentAverageValue
member.summary: currentAverageValue is the current value of the average of the resource metric across all relevant pods, as a raw value (instead of as a percentage of the request), similar to the "pods" metric source type. It will always be set, regardless of the corresponding metric specification.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricStatus.Name
member.summary: name is the name of the resource in question.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricStatus.CurrentAverageUtilization
member.summary: currentAverageUtilization is the current value of the average of the resource metric across all relevant pods, represented as a percentage of the requested value of the resource for the pods. It will only be present if `targetAverageValue` was set in the corresponding metric specification.

Scaling is active as long as at least one metric value is available.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus
member.summary: HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus describes the current status of a horizontal pod autoscaler.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.Conditions
member.summary: conditions is the set of conditions required for this autoscaler to scale its target, and indicates whether or not those conditions are met.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.CurrentReplicas
member.summary: currentReplicas is current number of replicas of pods managed by this autoscaler, as last seen by the autoscaler.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.DesiredReplicas
member.summary: desiredReplicas is the desired number of replicas of pods managed by this autoscaler, as last calculated by the autoscaler.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.CurrentMetrics
member.summary: currentMetrics is the last read state of the metrics used by this autoscaler.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.LastScaleTime
member.summary: lastScaleTime is the last time the HorizontalPodAutoscaler scaled the number of pods, used by the autoscaler to control how often the number of pods is changed.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.ObservedGeneration
member.summary: observedGeneration is the most recent generation observed by this autoscaler.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricIdentifier
member.summary: MetricIdentifier defines the name and optionally selector for a metric

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricIdentifier.Name
member.summary: name is the name of the given metric

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricIdentifier.Selector
member.summary: selector is the string-encoded form of a standard kubernetes label selector for the given metric When set, it is passed as an additional parameter to the metrics server for more specific metrics scoping. When unset, just the metricName will be used to gather metrics.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricSpec
member.summary: MetricSpec specifies how to scale based on a single metric (only `type` and one other matching field should be set at once).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricSpec.Type
member.summary: type is the type of metric source. It should be one of "Object", "Pods" or "Resource", each mapping to a matching field in the object.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricSpec.External
member.summary: external refers to a global metric that is not associated with any Kubernetes object. It allows autoscaling based on information coming from components running outside of cluster (for example length of queue in cloud messaging service, or QPS from loadbalancer running outside of cluster).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricSpec.Object
member.summary: object refers to a metric describing a single kubernetes object (for example, hits-per-second on an Ingress object).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricSpec.Pods
member.summary: pods refers to a metric describing each pod in the current scale target (for example, transactions-processed-per-second). The values will be averaged together before being compared to the target value.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricSpec.Resource
member.summary: resource refers to a resource metric (such as those specified in requests and limits) known to Kubernetes describing each pod in the current scale target (e.g. CPU or memory). Such metrics are built in to Kubernetes, and have special scaling options on top of those available to normal per-pod metrics using the "pods" source.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricStatus
member.summary: MetricStatus describes the last-read state of a single metric.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricStatus.Type
member.summary: type is the type of metric source. It will be one of "Object", "Pods" or "Resource", each corresponds to a matching field in the object.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricStatus.External
member.summary: external refers to a global metric that is not associated with any Kubernetes object. It allows autoscaling based on information coming from components running outside of cluster (for example length of queue in cloud messaging service, or QPS from loadbalancer running outside of cluster).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricStatus.Object
member.summary: object refers to a metric describing a single kubernetes object (for example, hits-per-second on an Ingress object).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricStatus.Pods
member.summary: pods refers to a metric describing each pod in the current scale target (for example, transactions-processed-per-second). The values will be averaged together before being compared to the target value.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricStatus.Resource
member.summary: resource refers to a resource metric (such as those specified in requests and limits) known to Kubernetes describing each pod in the current scale target (e.g. CPU or memory). Such metrics are built in to Kubernetes, and have special scaling options on top of those available to normal per-pod metrics using the "pods" source.

member.summary: MetricTarget defines the target value, average value, or average utilization of a specific metric

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricTarget.Type
member.summary: type represents whether the metric type is Utilization, Value, or AverageValue

member.summary: averageUtilization is the target value of the average of the resource metric across all relevant pods, represented as a percentage of the requested value of the resource for the pods. Currently only valid for Resource metric source type

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricTarget.AverageValue
member.summary: averageValue is the target value of the average of the metric across all relevant pods (as a quantity)

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricTarget.Value
member.summary: value is the target value of the metric (as a quantity).

member.summary: MetricValueStatus holds the current value for a metric

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricValueStatus.AverageUtilization
member.summary: currentAverageUtilization is the current value of the average of the resource metric across all relevant pods, represented as a percentage of the requested value of the resource for the pods.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricValueStatus.AverageValue
member.summary: averageValue is the current value of the average of the metric across all relevant pods (as a quantity)

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricValueStatus.Value
member.summary: value is the current value of the metric (as a quantity).

member.summary: ObjectMetricSource indicates how to scale on a metric describing a kubernetes object (for example, hits-per-second on an Ingress object).

member.summary: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobCondition.Type
member.summary: Type of job condition, Complete or Failed.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobCondition.LastProbeTime
member.summary: Last time the condition was checked.

member.summary: Last time the condition transit from one status to another.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobCondition.Message
member.summary: Human readable message indicating details about last transition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobCondition.Reason
member.summary: (brief) reason for the condition's last transition.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobList
member.summary: JobList is a collection of jobs.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobList.Items
member.summary: items is the list of Jobs.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec
member.summary: JobSpec describes how the job execution will look like.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.Template
member.summary: Describes the pod that will be created when executing a job. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.ActiveDeadlineSeconds
member.summary: Specifies the duration in seconds relative to the startTime that the job may be active before the system tries to terminate it; value must be positive integer

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.BackoffLimit
member.summary: Specifies the number of retries before marking this job failed. Defaults to 6

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.Completions
member.summary: Specifies the desired number of successfully finished pods the job should be run with. Setting to nil means that the success of any pod signals the success of all pods, and allows parallelism to have any positive value. Setting to 1 means that parallelism is limited to 1 and the success of that pod signals the success of the job. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.ManualSelector
member.summary: manualSelector controls generation of pod labels and pod selectors. Leave `manualSelector` unset unless you are certain what you are doing. When false or unset, the system pick labels unique to this job and appends those labels to the pod template. When true, the user is responsible for picking unique labels and specifying the selector. Failure to pick a unique label may cause this and other jobs to not function correctly. However, You may see `manualSelector=true` in jobs that were created with the old `extensions/v1beta1` API. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/#specifying-your-own-pod-selector

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.Parallelism
member.summary: Specifies the maximum desired number of pods the job should run at any given time. The actual number of pods running in steady state will be less than this number when ((.spec.completions - .status.successful) < .spec.parallelism), i.e. when the work left to do is less than max parallelism. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.Selector
member.summary: A label query over pods that should match the pod count. Normally, the system sets this field for you. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.TtlSecondsAfterFinished
member.summary: ttlSecondsAfterFinished limits the lifetime of a Job that has finished execution (either Complete or Failed). If this field is set, ttlSecondsAfterFinished after the Job finishes, it is eligible to be automatically deleted. When the Job is being deleted, its lifecycle guarantees (e.g. finalizers) will be honored. If this field is unset, the Job won't be automatically deleted. If this field is set to zero, the Job becomes eligible to be deleted immediately after it finishes. This field is alpha-level and is only honored by servers that enable the TTLAfterFinished feature.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobStatus
member.summary: JobStatus represents the current state of a Job.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobStatus.Active
member.summary: The number of actively running pods.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobStatus.CompletionTime
member.summary: Represents time when the job was completed. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobStatus.Conditions
member.summary: The latest available observations of an object's current state. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobStatus.Failed
member.summary: The number of pods which reached phase Failed.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobStatus.StartTime
member.summary: Represents time when the job was acknowledged by the job controller. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1.JobStatus.Succeeded
member.summary: The number of pods which reached phase Succeeded.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1Beta1.CronJobSpec.ConcurrencyPolicy
member.summary: Specifies how to treat concurrent executions of a Job. Valid values are: - "Allow" (default): allows CronJobs to run concurrently; - "Forbid": forbids concurrent runs, skipping next run if previous run hasn't finished yet; - "Replace": cancels currently running job and replaces it with a new one

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1Beta1.CronJobSpec.FailedJobsHistoryLimit
member.summary: The number of failed finished jobs to retain. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1Beta1.CronJobSpec.StartingDeadlineSeconds
member.summary: Optional deadline in seconds for starting the job if it misses scheduled time for any reason. Missed jobs executions will be counted as failed ones.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1Beta1.CronJobSpec.SuccessfulJobsHistoryLimit
member.summary: The number of successful finished jobs to retain. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 3.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Batch.V1Beta1.CronJobSpec.Suspend
member.summary: This flag tells the controller to suspend subsequent executions, it does not apply to already started executions. Defaults to false.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.AWSElasticBlockStoreVolumeSource
member.summary:
Represents a Persistent Disk resource in AWS.
An AWS EBS disk must exist before mounting to a container. The disk must also be in the same AWS zone as the kubelet. An AWS EBS disk can only be mounted as read/write once. AWS EBS volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.AWSElasticBlockStoreVolumeSource.VolumeID
member.summary: Unique ID of the persistent disk resource in AWS (Amazon EBS volume). More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.AWSElasticBlockStoreVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.AWSElasticBlockStoreVolumeSource.Partition
member.summary: The partition in the volume that you want to mount. If omitted, the default is to mount by volume name. Examples: For volume /dev/sda1, you specify the partition as "1". Similarly, the volume partition for /dev/sda is "0" (or you can leave the property empty).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.AWSElasticBlockStoreVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Specify "true" to force and set the ReadOnly property in VolumeMounts to "true". If omitted, the default is "false". More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Affinity
member.summary: Affinity is a group of affinity scheduling rules.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Affinity.NodeAffinity
member.summary: Describes node affinity scheduling rules for the pod.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Affinity.PodAffinity
member.summary: Describes pod affinity scheduling rules (e.g. co-locate this pod in the same node, zone, etc. as some other pod(s)).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Affinity.PodAntiAffinity
member.summary: Describes pod anti-affinity scheduling rules (e.g. avoid putting this pod in the same node, zone, etc. as some other pod(s)).

member.summary: DevicePath represents the device path where the volume should be available

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.AttachedVolume.Name
member.summary: Name of the attached volume

member.summary: AzureDisk represents an Azure Data Disk mount on the host and bind mount to the pod.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.AzureDiskVolumeSource.DiskName
member.summary: The Name of the data disk in the blob storage

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.AzureDiskVolumeSource.DiskURI
member.summary: The URI the data disk in the blob storage

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.AzureDiskVolumeSource.CachingMode
member.summary: Host Caching mode: None, Read Only, Read Write.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.AzureDiskVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.AzureDiskVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.AzureFilePersistentVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.

member.summary: the namespace of the secret that contains Azure Storage Account Name and Key default is the same as the Pod

member.summary: AzureFile represents an Azure File Service mount on the host and bind mount to the pod.

member.summary: the name of secret that contains Azure Storage Account Name and Key

member.summary: Binding ties one object to another; for example, a pod is bound to a node by a scheduler. Deprecated in 1.7, please use the bindings subresource of pods instead.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Binding.Target
member.summary: The target object that you want to bind to the standard object.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Binding.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents storage that is managed by an external CSI volume driver (Beta feature)

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.Driver
member.summary: Driver is the name of the driver to use for this volume. Required.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.VolumeHandle
member.summary: VolumeHandle is the unique volume name returned by the CSI volume plugins CreateVolume to refer to the volume on all subsequent calls. Required.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.ControllerExpandSecretRef
member.summary: ControllerExpandSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI ControllerExpandVolume call. This is an alpha field and requires enabling ExpandCSIVolumes feature gate. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.ControllerPublishSecretRef
member.summary: ControllerPublishSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI ControllerPublishVolume and ControllerUnpublishVolume calls. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs".

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.NodePublishSecretRef
member.summary: NodePublishSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI NodePublishVolume and NodeUnpublishVolume calls. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.NodeStageSecretRef
member.summary: NodeStageSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI NodeStageVolume and NodeStageVolume and NodeUnstageVolume calls. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Optional: The value to pass to ControllerPublishVolumeRequest. Defaults to false (read/write).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.VolumeAttributes
member.summary: Attributes of the volume to publish.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a source location of a volume to mount, managed by an external CSI driver

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIVolumeSource.Driver
member.summary: Driver is the name of the CSI driver that handles this volume. Consult with your admin for the correct name as registered in the cluster.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". If not provided, the empty value is passed to the associated CSI driver which will determine the default filesystem to apply.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIVolumeSource.NodePublishSecretRef
member.summary: NodePublishSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI NodePublishVolume and NodeUnpublishVolume calls. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secret references are passed.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Specifies a read-only configuration for the volume. Defaults to false (read/write).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CSIVolumeSource.VolumeAttributes
member.summary: VolumeAttributes stores driver-specific properties that are passed to the CSI driver. Consult your driver's documentation for supported values.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Capabilities
member.summary: Adds and removes POSIX capabilities from running containers.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Capabilities.Add
member.summary: Added capabilities

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Capabilities.Drop
member.summary: Removed capabilities

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CephFSPersistentVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a Ceph Filesystem mount that lasts the lifetime of a pod Cephfs volumes do not support ownership management or SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CephFSPersistentVolumeSource.Monitors
member.summary: Required: Monitors is a collection of Ceph monitors More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CephFSPersistentVolumeSource.Path
member.summary: Optional: Used as the mounted root, rather than the full Ceph tree, default is /

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CephFSPersistentVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Optional: Defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CephFSPersistentVolumeSource.SecretFile
member.summary: Optional: SecretFile is the path to key ring for User, default is /etc/ceph/user.secret More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CephFSPersistentVolumeSource.SecretRef
member.summary: Optional: SecretRef is reference to the authentication secret for User, default is empty. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CephFSPersistentVolumeSource.User
member.summary: Optional: User is the rados user name, default is admin More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CinderPersistentVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a cinder volume resource in Openstack. A Cinder volume must exist before mounting to a container. The volume must also be in the same region as the kubelet. Cinder volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CinderPersistentVolumeSource.VolumeID
member.summary: volume id used to identify the volume in cinder. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/mysql-cinder-pd/README.md

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CinderPersistentVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/mysql-cinder-pd/README.md

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CinderPersistentVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Optional: Defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/mysql-cinder-pd/README.md

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CinderPersistentVolumeSource.SecretRef
member.summary: Optional: points to a secret object containing parameters used to connect to OpenStack.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CinderVolumeSource

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CinderVolumeSource.VolumeID

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.CinderVolumeSource.ReadOnly

member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMap
member.summary: ConfigMap holds configuration data for pods to consume.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMap.BinaryData
member.summary: BinaryData contains the binary data. Each key must consist of alphanumeric characters, '-', '_' or '.'. BinaryData can contain byte sequences that are not in the UTF-8 range. The keys stored in BinaryData must not overlap with the ones in the Data field, this is enforced during validation process. Using this field will require 1.10+ apiserver and kubelet.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMap.Data
member.summary: Data contains the configuration data. Each key must consist of alphanumeric characters, '-', '_' or '.'. Values with non-UTF-8 byte sequences must use the BinaryData field. The keys stored in Data must not overlap with the keys in the BinaryData field, this is enforced during validation process.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMap.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapEnvSource
member.summary:
ConfigMapEnvSource selects a ConfigMap to populate the environment variables with.
The contents of the target ConfigMap's Data field will represent the key-value pairs as environment variables.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapEnvSource.Name
member.summary: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapEnvSource.Optional
member.summary: Specify whether the ConfigMap must be defined

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapKeySelector
member.summary: Selects a key from a ConfigMap.

member.summary: The key to select.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapKeySelector.Name
member.summary: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapKeySelector.Optional
member.summary: Specify whether the ConfigMap or its key must be defined

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapList
member.summary: ConfigMapList is a resource containing a list of ConfigMap objects.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapList.Items
member.summary: Items is the list of ConfigMaps.

member.summary: More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapNodeConfigSource
member.summary: ConfigMapNodeConfigSource contains the information to reference a ConfigMap as a config source for the Node.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapNodeConfigSource.KubeletConfigKey
member.summary: KubeletConfigKey declares which key of the referenced ConfigMap corresponds to the KubeletConfiguration structure This field is required in all cases.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapNodeConfigSource.Name
member.summary: Name is the metadata.name of the referenced ConfigMap. This field is required in all cases.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapNodeConfigSource.Namespace
member.summary: Namespace is the metadata.namespace of the referenced ConfigMap. This field is required in all cases.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapNodeConfigSource.ResourceVersion
member.summary: ResourceVersion is the metadata.ResourceVersion of the referenced ConfigMap. This field is forbidden in Node.Spec, and required in Node.Status.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapNodeConfigSource.Uid
member.summary: UID is the metadata.UID of the referenced ConfigMap. This field is forbidden in Node.Spec, and required in Node.Status.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapProjection
member.summary:
Adapts a ConfigMap into a projected volume.
The contents of the target ConfigMap's Data field will be presented in a projected volume as files using the keys in the Data field as the file names, unless the items element is populated with specific mappings of keys to paths. Note that this is identical to a configmap volume source without the default mode.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapProjection.Items
member.summary: If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced ConfigMap will be projected into the volume as a file whose name is the key and content is the value. If specified, the listed keys will be projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys will not be present. If a key is specified which is not present in the ConfigMap, the volume setup will error unless it is marked optional. Paths must be relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapProjection.Name
member.summary: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapProjection.Optional
member.summary: Specify whether the ConfigMap or its keys must be defined

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapVolumeSource
member.summary:
Adapts a ConfigMap into a volume.
The contents of the target ConfigMap's Data field will be presented in a volume as files using the keys in the Data field as the file names, unless the items element is populated with specific mappings of keys to paths. ConfigMap volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapVolumeSource.DefaultMode
member.summary: Optional: mode bits to use on created files by default. Must be a value between 0 and 0777. Defaults to 0644. Directories within the path are not affected by this setting. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapVolumeSource.Items
member.summary: If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced ConfigMap will be projected into the volume as a file whose name is the key and content is the value. If specified, the listed keys will be projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys will not be present. If a key is specified which is not present in the ConfigMap, the volume setup will error unless it is marked optional. Paths must be relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapVolumeSource.Name
member.summary: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapVolumeSource.Optional
member.summary: Specify whether the ConfigMap or its keys must be defined

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container
member.summary: A single application container that you want to run within a pod.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.Name
member.summary: Name of the container specified as a DNS_LABEL. Each container in a pod must have a unique name (DNS_LABEL). Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.Args
member.summary: Arguments to the entrypoint. The docker image's CMD is used if this is not provided. Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container's environment. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/define-command-argument-container/#running-a-command-in-a-shell

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.Command
member.summary: Entrypoint array. Not executed within a shell. The docker image's ENTRYPOINT is used if this is not provided. Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container's environment. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/define-command-argument-container/#running-a-command-in-a-shell

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.Env
member.summary: List of environment variables to set in the container. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.EnvFrom
member.summary: List of sources to populate environment variables in the container. The keys defined within a source must be a C_IDENTIFIER. All invalid keys will be reported as an event when the container is starting. When a key exists in multiple sources, the value associated with the last source will take precedence. Values defined by an Env with a duplicate key will take precedence. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.Image
member.summary: Docker image name. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images This field is optional to allow higher level config management to default or override container images in workload controllers like Deployments and StatefulSets.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.ImagePullPolicy
member.summary: Image pull policy. One of Always, Never, IfNotPresent. Defaults to Always if :latest tag is specified, or IfNotPresent otherwise. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#updating-images

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.Lifecycle
member.summary: Actions that the management system should take in response to container lifecycle events. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.LivenessProbe
member.summary: Periodic probe of container liveness. Container will be restarted if the probe fails. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.Ports
member.summary: List of ports to expose from the container. Exposing a port here gives the system additional information about the network connections a container uses, but is primarily informational. Not specifying a port here DOES NOT prevent that port from being exposed. Any port which is listening on the default "0.0.0.0" address inside a container will be accessible from the network. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.ReadinessProbe
member.summary: Periodic probe of container service readiness. Container will be removed from service endpoints if the probe fails. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.Resources
member.summary: Compute Resources required by this container. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-compute-resources-container/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.SecurityContext
member.summary: Security options the pod should run with. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/policy/security-context/ More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.StartupProbe
member.summary: StartupProbe indicates that the Pod has successfully initialized. If specified, no other probes are executed until this completes successfully. If this probe fails, the Pod will be restarted, just as if the livenessProbe failed. This can be used to provide different probe parameters at the beginning of a Pod's lifecycle, when it might take a long time to load data or warm a cache, than during steady-state operation. This cannot be updated. This is an alpha feature enabled by the StartupProbe feature flag. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.Stdin
member.summary: Whether this container should allocate a buffer for stdin in the container runtime. If this is not set, reads from stdin in the container will always result in EOF. Default is false.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.StdinOnce
member.summary: Whether the container runtime should close the stdin channel after it has been opened by a single attach. When stdin is true the stdin stream will remain open across multiple attach sessions. If stdinOnce is set to true, stdin is opened on container start, is empty until the first client attaches to stdin, and then remains open and accepts data until the client disconnects, at which time stdin is closed and remains closed until the container is restarted. If this flag is false, a container processes that reads from stdin will never receive an EOF. Default is false

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.TerminationMessagePath
member.summary: Optional: Path at which the file to which the container's termination message will be written is mounted into the container's filesystem. Message written is intended to be brief final status, such as an assertion failure message. Will be truncated by the node if greater than 4096 bytes. The total message length across all containers will be limited to 12kb. Defaults to /dev/termination-log. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.TerminationMessagePolicy
member.summary: Indicate how the termination message should be populated. File will use the contents of terminationMessagePath to populate the container status message on both success and failure. FallbackToLogsOnError will use the last chunk of container log output if the termination message file is empty and the container exited with an error. The log output is limited to 2048 bytes or 80 lines, whichever is smaller. Defaults to File. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.Tty
member.summary: Whether this container should allocate a TTY for itself, also requires 'stdin' to be true. Default is false.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.VolumeDevices
member.summary: volumeDevices is the list of block devices to be used by the container. This is a beta feature.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.VolumeMounts
member.summary: Pod volumes to mount into the container's filesystem. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Container.WorkingDir
member.summary: Container's working directory. If not specified, the container runtime's default will be used, which might be configured in the container image. Cannot be updated.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerImage
member.summary: Describe a container image

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerImage.Names
member.summary: Names by which this image is known. e.g. ["k8s.gcr.io/hyperkube:v1.0.7", "dockerhub.io/google_containers/hyperkube:v1.0.7"]

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerImage.SizeBytes
member.summary: The size of the image in bytes.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerPort
member.summary: ContainerPort represents a network port in a single container.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerPort.ContainerPortValue
member.summary: Number of port to expose on the pod's IP address. This must be a valid port number, 0 < x < 65536.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerPort.HostIP
member.summary: What host IP to bind the external port to.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerPort.HostPort
member.summary: Number of port to expose on the host. If specified, this must be a valid port number, 0 < x < 65536. If HostNetwork is specified, this must match ContainerPort. Most containers do not need this.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerPort.Name
member.summary: If specified, this must be an IANA_SVC_NAME and unique within the pod. Each named port in a pod must have a unique name. Name for the port that can be referred to by services.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerPort.Protocol
member.summary: Protocol for port. Must be UDP, TCP, or SCTP. Defaults to "TCP".

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerState
member.summary: ContainerState holds a possible state of container. Only one of its members may be specified. If none of them is specified, the default one is ContainerStateWaiting.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerState.Running
member.summary: Details about a running container

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerState.Terminated
