member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerStatus.Image
member.summary: The image the container is running. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerStatus.ImageID
member.summary: ImageID of the container's image.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerStatus.Name
member.summary: This must be a DNS_LABEL. Each container in a pod must have a unique name. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerStatus.Ready
member.summary: Specifies whether the container has passed its readiness probe.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerStatus.RestartCount
member.summary: The number of times the container has been restarted, currently based on the number of dead containers that have not yet been removed. Note that this is calculated from dead containers. But those containers are subject to garbage collection. This value will get capped at 5 by GC.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerStatus.ContainerID
member.summary: Container's ID in the format 'docker://<container_id>'.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerStatus.LastState
member.summary: Details about the container's last termination condition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerStatus.Started
member.summary: Specifies whether the container has passed its startup probe. Initialized as false, becomes true after startupProbe is considered successful. Resets to false when the container is restarted, or if kubelet loses state temporarily. Is always true when no startupProbe is defined.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ContainerStatus.State
member.summary: Details about the container's current condition.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.DaemonEndpoint
member.summary: DaemonEndpoint contains information about a single Daemon endpoint.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.DaemonEndpoint.Port
member.summary: Port number of the given endpoint.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIProjection
member.summary: Represents downward API info for projecting into a projected volume. Note that this is identical to a downwardAPI volume source without the default mode.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIProjection.Items
member.summary: Items is a list of DownwardAPIVolume file

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIVolumeFile
member.summary: DownwardAPIVolumeFile represents information to create the file containing the pod field

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIVolumeFile.Path
member.summary: Required: Path is the relative path name of the file to be created. Must not be absolute or contain the '..' path. Must be utf-8 encoded. The first item of the relative path must not start with '..'

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIVolumeFile.FieldRef
member.summary: Required: Selects a field of the pod: only annotations, labels, name and namespace are supported.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIVolumeFile.Mode
member.summary: Optional: mode bits to use on this file, must be a value between 0 and 0777. If not specified, the volume defaultMode will be used. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIVolumeFile.ResourceFieldRef
member.summary: Selects a resource of the container: only resources limits and requests (limits.cpu, limits.memory, requests.cpu and requests.memory) are currently supported.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIVolumeSource
member.summary: DownwardAPIVolumeSource represents a volume containing downward API info. Downward API volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIVolumeSource.DefaultMode
member.summary: Optional: mode bits to use on created files by default. Must be a value between 0 and 0777. Defaults to 0644. Directories within the path are not affected by this setting. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIVolumeSource.Items
member.summary: Items is a list of downward API volume file

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EmptyDirVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents an empty directory for a pod. Empty directory volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EmptyDirVolumeSource.Medium
member.summary: What type of storage medium should back this directory. The default is "" which means to use the node's default medium. Must be an empty string (default) or Memory. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#emptydir

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EmptyDirVolumeSource.SizeLimit
member.summary: Total amount of local storage required for this EmptyDir volume. The size limit is also applicable for memory medium. The maximum usage on memory medium EmptyDir would be the minimum value between the SizeLimit specified here and the sum of memory limits of all containers in a pod. The default is nil which means that the limit is undefined. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#emptydir

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointAddress
member.summary: EndpointAddress is a tuple that describes single IP address.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointAddress.Ip
member.summary: The IP of this endpoint. May not be loopback (127.0.0.0/8), link-local (169.254.0.0/16), or link-local multicast ((224.0.0.0/24). IPv6 is also accepted but not fully supported on all platforms. Also, certain kubernetes components, like kube-proxy, are not IPv6 ready.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointAddress.Hostname
member.summary: The Hostname of this endpoint

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointAddress.NodeName
member.summary: Optional: Node hosting this endpoint. This can be used to determine endpoints local to a node.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointAddress.TargetRef
member.summary: Reference to object providing the endpoint.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointPort
member.summary: EndpointPort is a tuple that describes a single port.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointPort.Port
member.summary: The port number of the endpoint.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointPort.Name
member.summary: The name of this port. This must match the 'name' field in the corresponding ServicePort. Must be a DNS_LABEL. Optional only if one port is defined.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointPort.Protocol
member.summary: The IP protocol for this port. Must be UDP, TCP, or SCTP. Default is TCP.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointSubset
member.summary: EndpointSubset is a group of addresses with a common set of ports. The expanded set of endpoints is the Cartesian product of Addresses x Ports. For example, given: { Addresses: [{"ip": "10.10.1.1"}, {"ip": "10.10.2.2"}], Ports: [{"name": "a", "port": 8675}, {"name": "b", "port": 309}] } The resulting set of endpoints can be viewed as: a: [ 10.10.1.1:8675, 10.10.2.2:8675 ], b: [ 10.10.1.1:309, 10.10.2.2:309 ]

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointSubset.Addresses
member.summary: IP addresses which offer the related ports that are marked as ready. These endpoints should be considered safe for load balancers and clients to utilize.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointSubset.NotReadyAddresses
member.summary: IP addresses which offer the related ports but are not currently marked as ready because they have not yet finished starting, have recently failed a readiness check, or have recently failed a liveness check.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointSubset.Ports
member.summary: Port numbers available on the related IP addresses.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Endpoints
P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Endpoints.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Endpoints.Subsets
member.summary: The set of all endpoints is the union of all subsets. Addresses are placed into subsets according to the IPs they share. A single address with multiple ports, some of which are ready and some of which are not (because they come from different containers) will result in the address being displayed in different subsets for the different ports. No address will appear in both Addresses and NotReadyAddresses in the same subset. Sets of addresses and ports that comprise a service.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointsList
member.summary: EndpointsList is a list of endpoints.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointsList.Items
member.summary: List of endpoints.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EndpointsList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EnvFromSource
member.summary: EnvFromSource represents the source of a set of ConfigMaps

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EnvFromSource.ConfigMapRef
member.summary: The ConfigMap to select from

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EnvFromSource.Prefix
member.summary: An optional identifier to prepend to each key in the ConfigMap. Must be a C_IDENTIFIER.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EnvFromSource.SecretRef
member.summary: The Secret to select from

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EnvVar
member.summary: EnvVar represents an environment variable present in a Container.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EnvVar.Name
member.summary: Name of the environment variable. Must be a C_IDENTIFIER.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EnvVar.Value
member.summary: Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the previous defined environment variables in the container and any service environment variables. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Defaults to "".

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EnvVar.ValueFrom
member.summary: Source for the environment variable's value. Cannot be used if value is not empty.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EnvVarSource
member.summary: EnvVarSource represents a source for the value of an EnvVar.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EnvVarSource.ConfigMapKeyRef
member.summary: Selects a key of a ConfigMap.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EnvVarSource.FieldRef
member.summary: Selects a field of the pod: supports metadata.name, metadata.namespace, metadata.labels, metadata.annotations, spec.nodeName, spec.serviceAccountName, status.hostIP, status.podIP.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EnvVarSource.ResourceFieldRef
member.summary: Selects a resource of the container: only resources limits and requests (limits.cpu, limits.memory, limits.ephemeral-storage, requests.cpu, requests.memory and requests.ephemeral-storage) are currently supported.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EnvVarSource.SecretKeyRef
member.summary: Selects a key of a secret in the pod's namespace

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer
member.summary: An EphemeralContainer is a container that may be added temporarily to an existing pod for user-initiated activities such as debugging. Ephemeral containers have no resource or scheduling guarantees, and they will not be restarted when they exit or when a pod is removed or restarted. If an ephemeral container causes a pod to exceed its resource allocation, the pod may be evicted. Ephemeral containers may not be added by directly updating the pod spec. They must be added via the pod's ephemeralcontainers subresource, and they will appear in the pod spec once added. This is an alpha feature enabled by the EphemeralContainers feature flag.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Name
member.summary: Name of the ephemeral container specified as a DNS_LABEL. This name must be unique among all containers, init containers and ephemeral containers.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Args
member.summary: Arguments to the entrypoint. The docker image's CMD is used if this is not provided. Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container's environment. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/define-command-argument-container/#running-a-command-in-a-shell

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Command
member.summary: Entrypoint array. Not executed within a shell. The docker image's ENTRYPOINT is used if this is not provided. Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container's environment. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/define-command-argument-container/#running-a-command-in-a-shell

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Env
member.summary: List of environment variables to set in the container. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.EnvFrom
member.summary: List of sources to populate environment variables in the container. The keys defined within a source must be a C_IDENTIFIER. All invalid keys will be reported as an event when the container is starting. When a key exists in multiple sources, the value associated with the last source will take precedence. Values defined by an Env with a duplicate key will take precedence. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Image
member.summary: Docker image name. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.ImagePullPolicy
member.summary: Image pull policy. One of Always, Never, IfNotPresent. Defaults to Always if :latest tag is specified, or IfNotPresent otherwise. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#updating-images

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Lifecycle
member.summary: Lifecycle is not allowed for ephemeral containers.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.LivenessProbe
member.summary: Probes are not allowed for ephemeral containers.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Ports
member.summary: Ports are not allowed for ephemeral containers.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.ReadinessProbe
member.summary: Probes are not allowed for ephemeral containers.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Resources
member.summary: Resources are not allowed for ephemeral containers. Ephemeral containers use spare resources already allocated to the pod.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.SecurityContext
member.summary: SecurityContext is not allowed for ephemeral containers.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.StartupProbe
member.summary: Probes are not allowed for ephemeral containers.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Stdin
member.summary: Whether this container should allocate a buffer for stdin in the container runtime. If this is not set, reads from stdin in the container will always result in EOF. Default is false.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.StdinOnce
member.summary: Whether the container runtime should close the stdin channel after it has been opened by a single attach. When stdin is true the stdin stream will remain open across multiple attach sessions. If stdinOnce is set to true, stdin is opened on container start, is empty until the first client attaches to stdin, and then remains open and accepts data until the client disconnects, at which time stdin is closed and remains closed until the container is restarted. If this flag is false, a container processes that reads from stdin will never receive an EOF. Default is false

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.TargetContainerName
member.summary: If set, the name of the container from PodSpec that this ephemeral container targets. The ephemeral container will be run in the namespaces (IPC, PID, etc) of this container. If not set then the ephemeral container is run in whatever namespaces are shared for the pod. Note that the container runtime must support this feature.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.TerminationMessagePath
member.summary: Optional: Path at which the file to which the container's termination message will be written is mounted into the container's filesystem. Message written is intended to be brief final status, such as an assertion failure message. Will be truncated by the node if greater than 4096 bytes. The total message length across all containers will be limited to 12kb. Defaults to /dev/termination-log. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.TerminationMessagePolicy
member.summary: Indicate how the termination message should be populated. File will use the contents of terminationMessagePath to populate the container status message on both success and failure. FallbackToLogsOnError will use the last chunk of container log output if the termination message file is empty and the container exited with an error. The log output is limited to 2048 bytes or 80 lines, whichever is smaller. Defaults to File. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Tty
member.summary: Whether this container should allocate a TTY for itself, also requires 'stdin' to be true. Default is false.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.VolumeDevices
member.summary: volumeDevices is the list of block devices to be used by the container. This is a beta feature.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.VolumeMounts
member.summary: Pod volumes to mount into the container's filesystem. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.WorkingDir
member.summary: Container's working directory. If not specified, the container runtime's default will be used, which might be configured in the container image. Cannot be updated.

member.summary: A human-readable description of the status of this operation.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Event.Reason
member.summary: This should be a short, machine understandable string that gives the reason for the transition into the object's current status.

member.summary: The component reporting this event. Should be a short machine understandable string.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Event.Type

member.summary: ExecAction describes a "run in container" action.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ExecAction.Command
member.summary: Command is the command line to execute inside the container, the working directory for the command is root ('/') in the container's filesystem. The command is simply exec'd, it is not run inside a shell, so traditional shell instructions ('|', etc) won't work. To use a shell, you need to explicitly call out to that shell. Exit status of 0 is treated as live/healthy and non-zero is unhealthy.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.FCVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a Fibre Channel volume. Fibre Channel volumes can only be mounted as read/write once. Fibre Channel volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.FCVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.FCVolumeSource.Lun
member.summary: Optional: FC target lun number

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.FCVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Optional: Defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.FCVolumeSource.TargetWWNs
member.summary: Optional: FC target worldwide names (WWNs)

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.FCVolumeSource.Wwids
member.summary: Optional: FC volume world wide identifiers (wwids) Either wwids or combination of targetWWNs and lun must be set, but not both simultaneously.

member.summary: Optional: SecretRef is reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the plugin scripts. This may be empty if no secret object is specified. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed to the plugin scripts.

member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". The default filesystem depends on FlexVolume script.

member.summary: Optional: SecretRef is reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the plugin scripts. This may be empty if no secret object is specified. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed to the plugin scripts.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.FlockerVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a Flocker volume mounted by the Flocker agent. One and only one of datasetName and datasetUUID should be set. Flocker volumes do not support ownership management or SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.FlockerVolumeSource.DatasetName
member.summary: Name of the dataset stored as metadata -> name on the dataset for Flocker should be considered as deprecated

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.FlockerVolumeSource.DatasetUUID
member.summary: UUID of the dataset. This is unique identifier of a Flocker dataset

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GCEPersistentDiskVolumeSource
member.summary:
Represents a Persistent Disk resource in Google Compute Engine.
A GCE PD must exist before mounting to a container. The disk must also be in the same GCE project and zone as the kubelet. A GCE PD can only be mounted as read/write once or read-only many times. GCE PDs support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GCEPersistentDiskVolumeSource.PdName
member.summary: Unique name of the PD resource in GCE. Used to identify the disk in GCE. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GCEPersistentDiskVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GCEPersistentDiskVolumeSource.Partition
member.summary: The partition in the volume that you want to mount. If omitted, the default is to mount by volume name. Examples: For volume /dev/sda1, you specify the partition as "1". Similarly, the volume partition for /dev/sda is "0" (or you can leave the property empty). More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GCEPersistentDiskVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GitRepoVolumeSource
member.summary:
Represents a volume that is populated with the contents of a git repository. Git repo volumes do not support ownership management. Git repo volumes support SELinux relabeling.
DEPRECATED: GitRepo is deprecated. To provision a container with a git repo, mount an EmptyDir into an InitContainer that clones the repo using git, then mount the EmptyDir into the Pod's container.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GitRepoVolumeSource.Repository
member.summary: Repository URL

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GitRepoVolumeSource.Directory
member.summary: Target directory name. Must not contain or start with '..'. If '.' is supplied, the volume directory will be the git repository. Otherwise, if specified, the volume will contain the git repository in the subdirectory with the given name.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GitRepoVolumeSource.Revision
member.summary: Commit hash for the specified revision.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsPersistentVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a Glusterfs mount that lasts the lifetime of a pod. Glusterfs volumes do not support ownership management or SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsPersistentVolumeSource.Endpoints

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsPersistentVolumeSource.Path

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsPersistentVolumeSource.EndpointsNamespace
member.summary: EndpointsNamespace is the namespace that contains Glusterfs endpoint. If this field is empty, the EndpointNamespace defaults to the same namespace as the bound PVC. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsPersistentVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: ReadOnly here will force the Glusterfs volume to be mounted with read-only permissions. Defaults to false. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a Glusterfs mount that lasts the lifetime of a pod. Glusterfs volumes do not support ownership management or SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsVolumeSource.Endpoints
member.summary: EndpointsName is the endpoint name that details Glusterfs topology. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsVolumeSource.Path
member.summary: Path is the Glusterfs volume path. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: ReadOnly here will force the Glusterfs volume to be mounted with read-only permissions. Defaults to false. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.HTTPGetAction
member.summary: HTTPGetAction describes an action based on HTTP Get requests.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.HTTPGetAction.Port

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.HTTPGetAction.Scheme

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ISCSIPersistentVolumeSource.Iqn

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ISCSIPersistentVolumeSource.ChapAuthDiscovery

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ISCSIPersistentVolumeSource.ChapAuthSession

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ISCSIPersistentVolumeSource.ReadOnly

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.KeyToPath
member.summary: Maps a string key to a path within a volume.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.KeyToPath.Key
member.summary: The key to project.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.KeyToPath.Path
member.summary: The relative path of the file to map the key to. May not be an absolute path. May not contain the path element '..'. May not start with the string '..'.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.KeyToPath.Mode
member.summary: Optional: mode bits to use on this file, must be a value between 0 and 0777. If not specified, the volume defaultMode will be used. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Lifecycle
member.summary: Lifecycle describes actions that the management system should take in response to container lifecycle events. For the PostStart and PreStop lifecycle handlers, management of the container blocks until the action is complete, unless the container process fails, in which case the handler is aborted.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Lifecycle.PostStart
member.summary: PostStart is called immediately after a container is created. If the handler fails, the container is terminated and restarted according to its restart policy. Other management of the container blocks until the hook completes. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/container-lifecycle-hooks/#container-hooks

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Lifecycle.PreStop
member.summary: PreStop is called immediately before a container is terminated due to an API request or management event such as liveness/startup probe failure, preemption, resource contention, etc. The handler is not called if the container crashes or exits. The reason for termination is passed to the handler. The Pod's termination grace period countdown begins before the PreStop hooked is executed. Regardless of the outcome of the handler, the container will eventually terminate within the Pod's termination grace period. Other management of the container blocks until the hook completes or until the termination grace period is reached. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/container-lifecycle-hooks/#container-hooks

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.LimitRange

member.summary: Min usage constraints on this kind by resource name.

member.summary: Spec defines the behavior of a node. https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#spec-and-status

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeAddress
member.summary: NodeAddress contains information for the node's address.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeAddress.Address
member.summary: The node address.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeAddress.Type
member.summary: Node address type, one of Hostname, ExternalIP or InternalIP.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeAffinity
member.summary: Node affinity is a group of node affinity scheduling rules.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeAffinity.PreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
member.summary: The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding "weight" to the sum if the node matches the corresponding matchExpressions; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeAffinity.RequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
member.summary: If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to an update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeCondition
member.summary: NodeCondition contains condition information for a node.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeCondition.Status
member.summary: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeCondition.Type
member.summary: Type of node condition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeCondition.LastHeartbeatTime
member.summary: Last time we got an update on a given condition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeCondition.LastTransitionTime
member.summary: Last time the condition transit from one status to another.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeCondition.Message
member.summary: Human readable message indicating details about last transition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeCondition.Reason
member.summary: (brief) reason for the condition's last transition.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeConfigSource
member.summary: NodeConfigSource specifies a source of node configuration. Exactly one subfield (excluding metadata) must be non-nil.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeConfigSource.ConfigMap
member.summary: ConfigMap is a reference to a Node's ConfigMap

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeConfigStatus
member.summary: NodeConfigStatus describes the status of the config assigned by Node.Spec.ConfigSource.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeConfigStatus.Active
member.summary: Active reports the checkpointed config the node is actively using. Active will represent either the current version of the Assigned config, or the current LastKnownGood config, depending on whether attempting to use the Assigned config results in an error.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeConfigStatus.Assigned
member.summary: Assigned reports the checkpointed config the node will try to use. When Node.Spec.ConfigSource is updated, the node checkpoints the associated config payload to local disk, along with a record indicating intended config. The node refers to this record to choose its config checkpoint, and reports this record in Assigned. Assigned only updates in the status after the record has been checkpointed to disk. When the Kubelet is restarted, it tries to make the Assigned config the Active config by loading and validating the checkpointed payload identified by Assigned.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeConfigStatus.Error
member.summary: Error describes any problems reconciling the Spec.ConfigSource to the Active config. Errors may occur, for example, attempting to checkpoint Spec.ConfigSource to the local Assigned record, attempting to checkpoint the payload associated with Spec.ConfigSource, attempting to load or validate the Assigned config, etc. Errors may occur at different points while syncing config. Earlier errors (e.g. download or checkpointing errors) will not result in a rollback to LastKnownGood, and may resolve across Kubelet retries. Later errors (e.g. loading or validating a checkpointed config) will result in a rollback to LastKnownGood. In the latter case, it is usually possible to resolve the error by fixing the config assigned in Spec.ConfigSource. You can find additional information for debugging by searching the error message in the Kubelet log. Error is a human-readable description of the error state; machines can check whether or not Error is empty, but should not rely on the stability of the Error text across Kubelet versions.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeConfigStatus.LastKnownGood
member.summary: LastKnownGood reports the checkpointed config the node will fall back to when it encounters an error attempting to use the Assigned config. The Assigned config becomes the LastKnownGood config when the node determines that the Assigned config is stable and correct. This is currently implemented as a 10-minute soak period starting when the local record of Assigned config is updated. If the Assigned config is Active at the end of this period, it becomes the LastKnownGood. Note that if Spec.ConfigSource is reset to nil (use local defaults), the LastKnownGood is also immediately reset to nil, because the local default config is always assumed good. You should not make assumptions about the node's method of determining config stability and correctness, as this may change or become configurable in the future.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeDaemonEndpoints
member.summary: NodeDaemonEndpoints lists ports opened by daemons running on the Node.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeDaemonEndpoints.KubeletEndpoint
member.summary: Endpoint on which Kubelet is listening.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeList
member.summary: NodeList is the whole list of all Nodes which have been registered with master.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeList.Items
member.summary: List of nodes

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeList.Metadata

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSelector
member.summary: A node selector represents the union of the results of one or more label queries over a set of nodes; that is, it represents the OR of the selectors represented by the node selector terms.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSelector.NodeSelectorTerms
member.summary: Required. A list of node selector terms. The terms are ORed.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSelectorRequirement
member.summary: A node selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that relates the key and values.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSelectorRequirement.Key
member.summary: The label key that the selector applies to.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSelectorRequirement.Operator
member.summary: Represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists, DoesNotExist. Gt, and Lt.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSelectorRequirement.Values
member.summary: An array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. If the operator is Gt or Lt, the values array must have a single element, which will be interpreted as an integer. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSelectorTerm
member.summary: A null or empty node selector term matches no objects. The requirements of them are ANDed. The TopologySelectorTerm type implements a subset of the NodeSelectorTerm.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSelectorTerm.MatchExpressions
member.summary: A list of node selector requirements by node's labels.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSelectorTerm.MatchFields
member.summary: A list of node selector requirements by node's fields.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec
member.summary: NodeSpec describes the attributes that a node is created with.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec.ConfigSource
member.summary: If specified, the source to get node configuration from The DynamicKubeletConfig feature gate must be enabled for the Kubelet to use this field

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec.ExternalID
member.summary: Deprecated. Not all kubelets will set this field. Remove field after 1.13. see: https://issues.k8s.io/61966

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec.PodCIDR
member.summary: PodCIDR represents the pod IP range assigned to the node.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec.PodCIDRs
member.summary: podCIDRs represents the IP ranges assigned to the node for usage by Pods on that node. If this field is specified, the 0th entry must match the podCIDR field. It may contain at most 1 value for each of IPv4 and IPv6.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec.ProviderID
member.summary: ID of the node assigned by the cloud provider in the format: <ProviderName>://<ProviderSpecificNodeID>

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec.Taints
member.summary: If specified, the node's taints.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec.Unschedulable
member.summary: Unschedulable controls node schedulability of new pods. By default, node is schedulable. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/nodes/node/#manual-node-administration

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus
member.summary: NodeStatus is information about the current status of a node.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.Addresses
member.summary: List of addresses reachable to the node. Queried from cloud provider, if available. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/nodes/node/#addresses Note: This field is declared as mergeable, but the merge key is not sufficiently unique, which can cause data corruption when it is merged. Callers should instead use a full-replacement patch. See http://pr.k8s.io/79391 for an example.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.Allocatable
member.summary: Allocatable represents the resources of a node that are available for scheduling. Defaults to Capacity.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.Capacity
member.summary: Capacity represents the total resources of a node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#capacity

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.Conditions
member.summary: Conditions is an array of current observed node conditions. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/nodes/node/#condition

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.Config
member.summary: Status of the config assigned to the node via the dynamic Kubelet config feature.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.DaemonEndpoints
member.summary: Endpoints of daemons running on the Node.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.Images
member.summary: List of container images on this node

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.NodeInfo
member.summary: Set of ids/uuids to uniquely identify the node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/nodes/node/#info

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.Phase
member.summary: NodePhase is the recently observed lifecycle phase of the node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/nodes/node/#phase The field is never populated, and now is deprecated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.VolumesAttached
member.summary: List of volumes that are attached to the node.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.VolumesInUse
member.summary: List of attachable volumes in use (mounted) by the node.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo
member.summary: NodeSystemInfo is a set of ids/uuids to uniquely identify the node.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.Architecture
member.summary: The Architecture reported by the node

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.BootID
member.summary: Boot ID reported by the node.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.ContainerRuntimeVersion
member.summary: ContainerRuntime Version reported by the node through runtime remote API (e.g. docker://1.5.0).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.KernelVersion
member.summary: Kernel Version reported by the node from 'uname -r' (e.g. 3.16.0-0.bpo.4-amd64).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.KubeProxyVersion
member.summary: KubeProxy Version reported by the node.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.KubeletVersion
member.summary: Kubelet Version reported by the node.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.MachineID
member.summary: MachineID reported by the node. For unique machine identification in the cluster this field is preferred. Learn more from man(5) machine-id: http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man5/machine-id.5.html

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.OperatingSystem
member.summary: The Operating System reported by the node

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.OsImage
member.summary: OS Image reported by the node from /etc/os-release (e.g. Debian GNU/Linux 7 (wheezy)).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.SystemUUID
member.summary: SystemUUID reported by the node. For unique machine identification MachineID is preferred. This field is specific to Red Hat hosts https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-US/Red_Hat_Subscription_Management/1/html/RHSM/getting-system-uuid.html

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ObjectFieldSelector
member.summary: ObjectFieldSelector selects an APIVersioned field of an object.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ObjectFieldSelector.FieldPath
member.summary: Path of the field to select in the specified API version.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ObjectReference
member.summary: ObjectReference contains enough information to let you inspect or modify the referred object.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ObjectReference.FieldPath
member.summary: If referring to a piece of an object instead of an entire object, this string should contain a valid JSON/Go field access statement, such as desiredState.manifest.containers[2]. For example, if the object reference is to a container within a pod, this would take on a value like: "spec.containers{name}" (where "name" refers to the name of the container that triggered the event) or if no container name is specified "spec.containers[2]" (container with index 2 in this pod). This syntax is chosen only to have some well-defined way of referencing a part of an object.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ObjectReference.Name
member.summary: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ObjectReference.Namespace
member.summary: Namespace of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ObjectReference.ResourceVersion
member.summary: Specific resourceVersion to which this reference is made, if any. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ObjectReference.Uid
member.summary: UID of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#uids

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolume
member.summary: PersistentVolume (PV) is a storage resource provisioned by an administrator. It is analogous to a node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolume.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolume.Spec
member.summary: Spec defines a specification of a persistent volume owned by the cluster. Provisioned by an administrator. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#persistent-volumes

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaim
member.summary: PersistentVolumeClaim is a user's request for and claim to a persistent volume

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaim.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaim.Spec
member.summary: Spec defines the desired characteristics of a volume requested by a pod author. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#persistentvolumeclaims

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimCondition
member.summary: PersistentVolumeClaimCondition contails details about state of pvc

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimCondition.LastProbeTime
member.summary: Last time we probed the condition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimCondition.LastTransitionTime
member.summary: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimCondition.Message
member.summary: Human-readable message indicating details about last transition.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimCondition.Reason
member.summary: Unique, this should be a short, machine understandable string that gives the reason for condition's last transition. If it reports "ResizeStarted" that means the underlying persistent volume is being resized.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimList
member.summary: PersistentVolumeClaimList is a list of PersistentVolumeClaim items.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimList.Items
member.summary: A list of persistent volume claims. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#persistentvolumeclaims

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec
member.summary: PersistentVolumeClaimSpec describes the common attributes of storage devices and allows a Source for provider-specific attributes

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec.AccessModes
member.summary: AccessModes contains the desired access modes the volume should have. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#access-modes-1

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec.DataSource
member.summary: This field requires the VolumeSnapshotDataSource alpha feature gate to be enabled and currently VolumeSnapshot is the only supported data source. If the provisioner can support VolumeSnapshot data source, it will create a new volume and data will be restored to the volume at the same time. If the provisioner does not support VolumeSnapshot data source, volume will not be created and the failure will be reported as an event. In the future, we plan to support more data source types and the behavior of the provisioner may change.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec.Resources
member.summary: Resources represents the minimum resources the volume should have. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#resources

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec.Selector
member.summary: A label query over volumes to consider for binding.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec.StorageClassName
member.summary: Name of the StorageClass required by the claim. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#class-1

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec.VolumeMode
member.summary: volumeMode defines what type of volume is required by the claim. Value of Filesystem is implied when not included in claim spec. This is a beta feature.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec.VolumeName
member.summary: VolumeName is the binding reference to the PersistentVolume backing this claim.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimStatus
member.summary: PersistentVolumeClaimStatus is the current status of a persistent volume claim.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimStatus.AccessModes
member.summary: AccessModes contains the actual access modes the volume backing the PVC has. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#access-modes-1

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimStatus.Capacity
member.summary: Represents the actual resources of the underlying volume.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimStatus.Conditions
member.summary: Current Condition of persistent volume claim. If underlying persistent volume is being resized then the Condition will be set to 'ResizeStarted'.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimStatus.Phase
member.summary: Phase represents the current phase of PersistentVolumeClaim.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimVolumeSource
member.summary: PersistentVolumeClaimVolumeSource references the user's PVC in the same namespace. This volume finds the bound PV and mounts that volume for the pod. A PersistentVolumeClaimVolumeSource is, essentially, a wrapper around another type of volume that is owned by someone else (the system).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimVolumeSource.ClaimName
member.summary: ClaimName is the name of a PersistentVolumeClaim in the same namespace as the pod using this volume. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#persistentvolumeclaims

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. Default false.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeList
member.summary: PersistentVolumeList is a list of PersistentVolume items.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeList.Items
member.summary: List of persistent volumes. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec
member.summary: PersistentVolumeSpec is the specification of a persistent volume.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.AccessModes
member.summary: AccessModes contains all ways the volume can be mounted. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#access-modes

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.AwsElasticBlockStore
member.summary: AWSElasticBlockStore represents an AWS Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.AzureDisk
member.summary: AzureDisk represents an Azure Data Disk mount on the host and bind mount to the pod.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.AzureFile
member.summary: AzureFile represents an Azure File Service mount on the host and bind mount to the pod.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Capacity
member.summary: A description of the persistent volume's resources and capacity. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#capacity

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Cephfs
member.summary: CephFS represents a Ceph FS mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Cinder
member.summary: Cinder represents a cinder volume attached and mounted on kubelets host machine. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/mysql-cinder-pd/README.md

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.ClaimRef
member.summary: ClaimRef is part of a bi-directional binding between PersistentVolume and PersistentVolumeClaim. Expected to be non-nil when bound. claim.VolumeName is the authoritative bind between PV and PVC. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#binding

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Csi
member.summary: CSI represents storage that is handled by an external CSI driver (Beta feature).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Fc
member.summary: FC represents a Fibre Channel resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.FlexVolume
member.summary: FlexVolume represents a generic volume resource that is provisioned/attached using an exec based plugin.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Flocker
member.summary: Flocker represents a Flocker volume attached to a kubelet's host machine and exposed to the pod for its usage. This depends on the Flocker control service being running

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.GcePersistentDisk
member.summary: GCEPersistentDisk represents a GCE Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. Provisioned by an admin. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Glusterfs
member.summary: Glusterfs represents a Glusterfs volume that is attached to a host and exposed to the pod. Provisioned by an admin. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.HostPath
member.summary: HostPath represents a directory on the host. Provisioned by a developer or tester. This is useful for single-node development and testing only! On-host storage is not supported in any way and WILL NOT WORK in a multi-node cluster. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#hostpath

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Iscsi
member.summary: ISCSI represents an ISCSI Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. Provisioned by an admin.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Local
member.summary: Local represents directly-attached storage with node affinity

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.MountOptions
member.summary: A list of mount options, e.g. ["ro", "soft"]. Not validated - mount will simply fail if one is invalid. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#mount-options

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Nfs
member.summary: NFS represents an NFS mount on the host. Provisioned by an admin. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#nfs

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.NodeAffinity
member.summary: NodeAffinity defines constraints that limit what nodes this volume can be accessed from. This field influences the scheduling of pods that use this volume.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.PersistentVolumeReclaimPolicy
member.summary: What happens to a persistent volume when released from its claim. Valid options are Retain (default for manually created PersistentVolumes), Delete (default for dynamically provisioned PersistentVolumes), and Recycle (deprecated). Recycle must be supported by the volume plugin underlying this PersistentVolume. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#reclaiming

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.PhotonPersistentDisk
member.summary: PhotonPersistentDisk represents a PhotonController persistent disk attached and mounted on kubelets host machine

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.PortworxVolume
member.summary: PortworxVolume represents a portworx volume attached and mounted on kubelets host machine

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Quobyte
member.summary: Quobyte represents a Quobyte mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Rbd
member.summary: RBD represents a Rados Block Device mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/rbd/README.md

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.ScaleIO
member.summary: ScaleIO represents a ScaleIO persistent volume attached and mounted on Kubernetes nodes.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.StorageClassName
member.summary: Name of StorageClass to which this persistent volume belongs. Empty value means that this volume does not belong to any StorageClass.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Storageos
member.summary: StorageOS represents a StorageOS volume that is attached to the kubelet's host machine and mounted into the pod More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/storageos/README.md

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.VolumeMode
member.summary: volumeMode defines if a volume is intended to be used with a formatted filesystem or to remain in raw block state. Value of Filesystem is implied when not included in spec. This is a beta feature.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.VsphereVolume
member.summary: VsphereVolume represents a vSphere volume attached and mounted on kubelets host machine

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeStatus
member.summary: PersistentVolumeStatus is the current status of a persistent volume.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeStatus.Message
member.summary: A human-readable message indicating details about why the volume is in this state.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeStatus.Phase

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeStatus.Reason
member.summary: Reason is a brief CamelCase string that describes any failure and is meant for machine parsing and tidy display in the CLI.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PhotonPersistentDiskVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a Photon Controller persistent disk resource.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PhotonPersistentDiskVolumeSource.PdID
member.summary: ID that identifies Photon Controller persistent disk

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.PhotonPersistentDiskVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Pod

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Pod.Metadata
