member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ScopeSelector.MatchExpressions
member.summary: A list of scope selector requirements by scope of the resources.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ScopedResourceSelectorRequirement
member.summary: A scoped-resource selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a scope name, and an operator that relates the scope name and values.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ScopedResourceSelectorRequirement.Operator
member.summary: Represents a scope's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists, DoesNotExist.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ScopedResourceSelectorRequirement.ScopeName
member.summary: The name of the scope that the selector applies to.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ScopedResourceSelectorRequirement.Values
member.summary: An array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Secret
member.summary: Secret holds secret data of a certain type. The total bytes of the values in the Data field must be less than MaxSecretSize bytes.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Secret.Data
member.summary: Data contains the secret data. Each key must consist of alphanumeric characters, '-', '_' or '.'. The serialized form of the secret data is a base64 encoded string, representing the arbitrary (possibly non-string) data value here. Described in https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4648#section-4

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Secret.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Secret.StringData
member.summary: stringData allows specifying non-binary secret data in string form. It is provided as a write-only convenience method. All keys and values are merged into the data field on write, overwriting any existing values. It is never output when reading from the API.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Secret.Type
member.summary: Used to facilitate programmatic handling of secret data.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretEnvSource
member.summary:
SecretEnvSource selects a Secret to populate the environment variables with.
The contents of the target Secret's Data field will represent the key-value pairs as environment variables.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretEnvSource.Name
member.summary: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretEnvSource.Optional
member.summary: Specify whether the Secret must be defined

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretKeySelector
member.summary: SecretKeySelector selects a key of a Secret.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretKeySelector.Key
member.summary: The key of the secret to select from. Must be a valid secret key.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretKeySelector.Name
member.summary: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretKeySelector.Optional
member.summary: Specify whether the Secret or its key must be defined

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretList
member.summary: SecretList is a list of Secret.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretList.Items
member.summary: Items is a list of secret objects. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretProjection
member.summary:
Adapts a secret into a projected volume.
The contents of the target Secret's Data field will be presented in a projected volume as files using the keys in the Data field as the file names. Note that this is identical to a secret volume source without the default mode.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretProjection.Items
member.summary: If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced Secret will be projected into the volume as a file whose name is the key and content is the value. If specified, the listed keys will be projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys will not be present. If a key is specified which is not present in the Secret, the volume setup will error unless it is marked optional. Paths must be relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretProjection.Name
member.summary: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretProjection.Optional
member.summary: Specify whether the Secret or its key must be defined

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretReference
member.summary: SecretReference represents a Secret Reference. It has enough information to retrieve secret in any namespace

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretReference.Name
member.summary: Name is unique within a namespace to reference a secret resource.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretReference.Namespace
member.summary: Namespace defines the space within which the secret name must be unique.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretVolumeSource
member.summary:
Adapts a Secret into a volume.
The contents of the target Secret's Data field will be presented in a volume as files using the keys in the Data field as the file names. Secret volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretVolumeSource.DefaultMode
member.summary: Optional: mode bits to use on created files by default. Must be a value between 0 and 0777. Defaults to 0644. Directories within the path are not affected by this setting. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretVolumeSource.Items
member.summary: If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced Secret will be projected into the volume as a file whose name is the key and content is the value. If specified, the listed keys will be projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys will not be present. If a key is specified which is not present in the Secret, the volume setup will error unless it is marked optional. Paths must be relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretVolumeSource.Optional
member.summary: Specify whether the Secret or its keys must be defined

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecretVolumeSource.SecretName
member.summary: Name of the secret in the pod's namespace to use. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#secret

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecurityContext
member.summary: SecurityContext holds security configuration that will be applied to a container. Some fields are present in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext. When both are set, the values in SecurityContext take precedence.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecurityContext.AllowPrivilegeEscalation
member.summary: AllowPrivilegeEscalation controls whether a process can gain more privileges than its parent process. This bool directly controls if the no_new_privs flag will be set on the container process. AllowPrivilegeEscalation is true always when the container is: 1) run as Privileged 2) has CAP_SYS_ADMIN

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecurityContext.Capabilities
member.summary: The capabilities to add/drop when running containers. Defaults to the default set of capabilities granted by the container runtime.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecurityContext.Privileged
member.summary: Run container in privileged mode. Processes in privileged containers are essentially equivalent to root on the host. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecurityContext.ProcMount
member.summary: procMount denotes the type of proc mount to use for the containers. The default is DefaultProcMount which uses the container runtime defaults for readonly paths and masked paths. This requires the ProcMountType feature flag to be enabled.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecurityContext.ReadOnlyRootFilesystem
member.summary: Whether this container has a read-only root filesystem. Default is false.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecurityContext.RunAsGroup
member.summary: The GID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Uses runtime default if unset. May also be set in PodSecurityContext. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecurityContext.RunAsNonRoot
member.summary: Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user. If true, the Kubelet will validate the image at runtime to ensure that it does not run as UID 0 (root) and fail to start the container if it does. If unset or false, no such validation will be performed. May also be set in PodSecurityContext. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecurityContext.RunAsUser
member.summary: The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified. May also be set in PodSecurityContext. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecurityContext.SeLinuxOptions
member.summary: The SELinux context to be applied to the container. If unspecified, the container runtime will allocate a random SELinux context for each container. May also be set in PodSecurityContext. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SecurityContext.WindowsOptions
member.summary: The Windows specific settings applied to all containers. If unspecified, the options from the PodSecurityContext will be used. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Service
member.summary: Service is a named abstraction of software service (for example, mysql) consisting of local port (for example 3306) that the proxy listens on, and the selector that determines which pods will answer requests sent through the proxy.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Service.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Service.Spec
member.summary: Spec defines the behavior of a service. https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#spec-and-status

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceAccount
member.summary: ServiceAccount binds together: * a name, understood by users, and perhaps by peripheral systems, for an identity * a principal that can be authenticated and authorized * a set of secrets

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceAccount.AutomountServiceAccountToken
member.summary: AutomountServiceAccountToken indicates whether pods running as this service account should have an API token automatically mounted. Can be overridden at the pod level.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceAccount.ImagePullSecrets
member.summary: ImagePullSecrets is a list of references to secrets in the same namespace to use for pulling any images in pods that reference this ServiceAccount. ImagePullSecrets are distinct from Secrets because Secrets can be mounted in the pod, but ImagePullSecrets are only accessed by the kubelet. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images/#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceAccount.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceAccount.Secrets
member.summary: Secrets is the list of secrets allowed to be used by pods running using this ServiceAccount. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceAccountList
member.summary: ServiceAccountList is a list of ServiceAccount objects

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceAccountList.Items
member.summary: List of ServiceAccounts. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-service-account/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceAccountList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceAccountTokenProjection
member.summary: ServiceAccountTokenProjection represents a projected service account token volume. This projection can be used to insert a service account token into the pods runtime filesystem for use against APIs (Kubernetes API Server or otherwise).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceAccountTokenProjection.Path
member.summary: Path is the path relative to the mount point of the file to project the token into.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceAccountTokenProjection.Audience
member.summary: Audience is the intended audience of the token. A recipient of a token must identify itself with an identifier specified in the audience of the token, and otherwise should reject the token. The audience defaults to the identifier of the apiserver.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceAccountTokenProjection.ExpirationSeconds
member.summary: ExpirationSeconds is the requested duration of validity of the service account token. As the token approaches expiration, the kubelet volume plugin will proactively rotate the service account token. The kubelet will start trying to rotate the token if the token is older than 80 percent of its time to live or if the token is older than 24 hours.Defaults to 1 hour and must be at least 10 minutes.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceList
member.summary: ServiceList holds a list of services.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceList.Items
member.summary: List of services

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServicePort
member.summary: ServicePort contains information on service's port.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServicePort.Port
member.summary: The port that will be exposed by this service.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServicePort.Name
member.summary: The name of this port within the service. This must be a DNS_LABEL. All ports within a ServiceSpec must have unique names. When considering the endpoints for a Service, this must match the 'name' field in the EndpointPort. Optional if only one ServicePort is defined on this service.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServicePort.NodePort
member.summary: The port on each node on which this service is exposed when type=NodePort or LoadBalancer. Usually assigned by the system. If specified, it will be allocated to the service if unused or else creation of the service will fail. Default is to auto-allocate a port if the ServiceType of this Service requires one. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#type-nodeport

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServicePort.Protocol
member.summary: The IP protocol for this port. Supports "TCP", "UDP", and "SCTP". Default is TCP.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServicePort.TargetPort
member.summary: Number or name of the port to access on the pods targeted by the service. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME. If this is a string, it will be looked up as a named port in the target Pod's container ports. If this is not specified, the value of the 'port' field is used (an identity map). This field is ignored for services with clusterIP=None, and should be omitted or set equal to the 'port' field. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#defining-a-service

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceSpec
member.summary: ServiceSpec describes the attributes that a user creates on a service.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceSpec.ClusterIP
member.summary: clusterIP is the IP address of the service and is usually assigned randomly by the master. If an address is specified manually and is not in use by others, it will be allocated to the service; otherwise, creation of the service will fail. This field can not be changed through updates. Valid values are "None", empty string (""), or a valid IP address. "None" can be specified for headless services when proxying is not required. Only applies to types ClusterIP, NodePort, and LoadBalancer. Ignored if type is ExternalName. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#virtual-ips-and-service-proxies

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceSpec.ExternalIPs
member.summary: externalIPs is a list of IP addresses for which nodes in the cluster will also accept traffic for this service. These IPs are not managed by Kubernetes. The user is responsible for ensuring that traffic arrives at a node with this IP. A common example is external load-balancers that are not part of the Kubernetes system.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceSpec.ExternalName
member.summary: externalName is the external reference that kubedns or equivalent will return as a CNAME record for this service. No proxying will be involved. Must be a valid RFC-1123 hostname (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1123) and requires Type to be ExternalName.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceSpec.ExternalTrafficPolicy
member.summary: externalTrafficPolicy denotes if this Service desires to route external traffic to node-local or cluster-wide endpoints. "Local" preserves the client source IP and avoids a second hop for LoadBalancer and Nodeport type services, but risks potentially imbalanced traffic spreading. "Cluster" obscures the client source IP and may cause a second hop to another node, but should have good overall load-spreading.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceSpec.HealthCheckNodePort
member.summary: healthCheckNodePort specifies the healthcheck nodePort for the service. If not specified, HealthCheckNodePort is created by the service api backend with the allocated nodePort. Will use user-specified nodePort value if specified by the client. Only effects when Type is set to LoadBalancer and ExternalTrafficPolicy is set to Local.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceSpec.IpFamily
member.summary: ipFamily specifies whether this Service has a preference for a particular IP family (e.g. IPv4 vs. IPv6). If a specific IP family is requested, the clusterIP field will be allocated from that family, if it is available in the cluster. If no IP family is requested, the cluster's primary IP family will be used. Other IP fields (loadBalancerIP, loadBalancerSourceRanges, externalIPs) and controllers which allocate external load-balancers should use the same IP family. Endpoints for this Service will be of this family. This field is immutable after creation. Assigning a ServiceIPFamily not available in the cluster (e.g. IPv6 in IPv4 only cluster) is an error condition and will fail during clusterIP assignment.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceSpec.LoadBalancerIP
member.summary: Only applies to Service Type: LoadBalancer LoadBalancer will get created with the IP specified in this field. This feature depends on whether the underlying cloud-provider supports specifying the loadBalancerIP when a load balancer is created. This field will be ignored if the cloud-provider does not support the feature.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceSpec.LoadBalancerSourceRanges
member.summary: If specified and supported by the platform, this will restrict traffic through the cloud-provider load-balancer will be restricted to the specified client IPs. This field will be ignored if the cloud-provider does not support the feature." More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/access-application-cluster/configure-cloud-provider-firewall/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceSpec.Ports
member.summary: The list of ports that are exposed by this service. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#virtual-ips-and-service-proxies

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceSpec.PublishNotReadyAddresses
member.summary: publishNotReadyAddresses, when set to true, indicates that DNS implementations must publish the notReadyAddresses of subsets for the Endpoints associated with the Service. The default value is false. The primary use case for setting this field is to use a StatefulSet's Headless Service to propagate SRV records for its Pods without respect to their readiness for purpose of peer discovery.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceSpec.Selector
member.summary: Route service traffic to pods with label keys and values matching this selector. If empty or not present, the service is assumed to have an external process managing its endpoints, which Kubernetes will not modify. Only applies to types ClusterIP, NodePort, and LoadBalancer. Ignored if type is ExternalName. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceSpec.SessionAffinity
member.summary: Supports "ClientIP" and "None". Used to maintain session affinity. Enable client IP based session affinity. Must be ClientIP or None. Defaults to None. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#virtual-ips-and-service-proxies

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceSpec.SessionAffinityConfig
member.summary: sessionAffinityConfig contains the configurations of session affinity.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceSpec.Type
member.summary: type determines how the Service is exposed. Defaults to ClusterIP. Valid options are ExternalName, ClusterIP, NodePort, and LoadBalancer. "ExternalName" maps to the specified externalName. "ClusterIP" allocates a cluster-internal IP address for load-balancing to endpoints. Endpoints are determined by the selector or if that is not specified, by manual construction of an Endpoints object. If clusterIP is "None", no virtual IP is allocated and the endpoints are published as a set of endpoints rather than a stable IP. "NodePort" builds on ClusterIP and allocates a port on every node which routes to the clusterIP. "LoadBalancer" builds on NodePort and creates an external load-balancer (if supported in the current cloud) which routes to the clusterIP. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#publishing-services-service-types

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceStatus
member.summary: ServiceStatus represents the current status of a service.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.ServiceStatus.LoadBalancer
member.summary: LoadBalancer contains the current status of the load-balancer, if one is present.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SessionAffinityConfig
member.summary: SessionAffinityConfig represents the configurations of session affinity.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.SessionAffinityConfig.ClientIP
member.summary: clientIP contains the configurations of Client IP based session affinity.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.StorageOSPersistentVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a StorageOS persistent volume resource.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.StorageOSPersistentVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.StorageOSPersistentVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.StorageOSPersistentVolumeSource.SecretRef
member.summary: SecretRef specifies the secret to use for obtaining the StorageOS API credentials. If not specified, default values will be attempted.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.StorageOSPersistentVolumeSource.VolumeName
member.summary: VolumeName is the human-readable name of the StorageOS volume. Volume names are only unique within a namespace.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.StorageOSPersistentVolumeSource.VolumeNamespace
member.summary: VolumeNamespace specifies the scope of the volume within StorageOS. If no namespace is specified then the Pod's namespace will be used. This allows the Kubernetes name scoping to be mirrored within StorageOS for tighter integration. Set VolumeName to any name to override the default behaviour. Set to "default" if you are not using namespaces within StorageOS. Namespaces that do not pre-exist within StorageOS will be created.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.StorageOSVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a StorageOS persistent volume resource.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.StorageOSVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.StorageOSVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.StorageOSVolumeSource.SecretRef
member.summary: SecretRef specifies the secret to use for obtaining the StorageOS API credentials. If not specified, default values will be attempted.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.StorageOSVolumeSource.VolumeName
member.summary: VolumeName is the human-readable name of the StorageOS volume. Volume names are only unique within a namespace.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.StorageOSVolumeSource.VolumeNamespace
member.summary: VolumeNamespace specifies the scope of the volume within StorageOS. If no namespace is specified then the Pod's namespace will be used. This allows the Kubernetes name scoping to be mirrored within StorageOS for tighter integration. Set VolumeName to any name to override the default behaviour. Set to "default" if you are not using namespaces within StorageOS. Namespaces that do not pre-exist within StorageOS will be created.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Sysctl
member.summary: Sysctl defines a kernel parameter to be set

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Sysctl.Name
member.summary: Name of a property to set

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Sysctl.Value
member.summary: Value of a property to set

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TCPSocketAction
member.summary: TCPSocketAction describes an action based on opening a socket

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TCPSocketAction.Port
member.summary: Number or name of the port to access on the container. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TCPSocketAction.Host
member.summary: Optional: Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Taint
member.summary: The node this Taint is attached to has the "effect" on any pod that does not tolerate the Taint.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Taint.Effect
member.summary: Required. The effect of the taint on pods that do not tolerate the taint. Valid effects are NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule and NoExecute.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Taint.Key
member.summary: Required. The taint key to be applied to a node.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Taint.TimeAdded
member.summary: TimeAdded represents the time at which the taint was added. It is only written for NoExecute taints.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Taint.Value
member.summary: Required. The taint value corresponding to the taint key.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Toleration
member.summary: The pod this Toleration is attached to tolerates any taint that matches the triple <key,value,effect> using the matching operator <operator>.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Toleration.Effect
member.summary: Effect indicates the taint effect to match. Empty means match all taint effects. When specified, allowed values are NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule and NoExecute.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Toleration.Key
member.summary: Key is the taint key that the toleration applies to. Empty means match all taint keys. If the key is empty, operator must be Exists; this combination means to match all values and all keys.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Toleration.Operator
member.summary: Operator represents a key's relationship to the value. Valid operators are Exists and Equal. Defaults to Equal. Exists is equivalent to wildcard for value, so that a pod can tolerate all taints of a particular category.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Toleration.TolerationSeconds
member.summary: TolerationSeconds represents the period of time the toleration (which must be of effect NoExecute, otherwise this field is ignored) tolerates the taint. By default, it is not set, which means tolerate the taint forever (do not evict). Zero and negative values will be treated as 0 (evict immediately) by the system.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Toleration.Value
member.summary: Value is the taint value the toleration matches to. If the operator is Exists, the value should be empty, otherwise just a regular string.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TopologySelectorLabelRequirement
member.summary: A topology selector requirement is a selector that matches given label. This is an alpha feature and may change in the future.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TopologySelectorLabelRequirement.Key
member.summary: The label key that the selector applies to.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TopologySelectorLabelRequirement.Values
member.summary: An array of string values. One value must match the label to be selected. Each entry in Values is ORed.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TopologySelectorTerm
member.summary: A topology selector term represents the result of label queries. A null or empty topology selector term matches no objects. The requirements of them are ANDed. It provides a subset of functionality as NodeSelectorTerm. This is an alpha feature and may change in the future.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TopologySelectorTerm.MatchLabelExpressions
member.summary: A list of topology selector requirements by labels.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TopologySpreadConstraint
member.summary: TopologySpreadConstraint specifies how to spread matching pods among the given topology.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TopologySpreadConstraint.MaxSkew
member.summary: MaxSkew describes the degree to which pods may be unevenly distributed. It's the maximum permitted difference between the number of matching pods in any two topology domains of a given topology type. For example, in a 3-zone cluster, MaxSkew is set to 1, and pods with the same labelSelector spread as 1/1/0: | zone1 | zone2 | zone3 | | P | P | | - if MaxSkew is 1, incoming pod can only be scheduled to zone3 to become 1/1/1; scheduling it onto zone1(zone2) would make the ActualSkew(2-0) on zone1(zone2) violate MaxSkew(1). - if MaxSkew is 2, incoming pod can be scheduled onto any zone. It's a required field. Default value is 1 and 0 is not allowed.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TopologySpreadConstraint.TopologyKey
member.summary: TopologyKey is the key of node labels. Nodes that have a label with this key and identical values are considered to be in the same topology. We consider each <key, value> as a "bucket", and try to put balanced number of pods into each bucket. It's a required field.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TopologySpreadConstraint.WhenUnsatisfiable
member.summary: WhenUnsatisfiable indicates how to deal with a pod if it doesn't satisfy the spread constraint. - DoNotSchedule (default) tells the scheduler not to schedule it - ScheduleAnyway tells the scheduler to still schedule it It's considered as "Unsatisfiable" if and only if placing incoming pod on any topology violates "MaxSkew". For example, in a 3-zone cluster, MaxSkew is set to 1, and pods with the same labelSelector spread as 3/1/1: | zone1 | zone2 | zone3 | | P P P | P | P | If WhenUnsatisfiable is set to DoNotSchedule, incoming pod can only be scheduled to zone2(zone3) to become 3/2/1(3/1/2) as ActualSkew(2-1) on zone2(zone3) satisfies MaxSkew(1). In other words, the cluster can still be imbalanced, but scheduler won't make it *more* imbalanced. It's a required field.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TopologySpreadConstraint.LabelSelector
member.summary: LabelSelector is used to find matching pods. Pods that match this label selector are counted to determine the number of pods in their corresponding topology domain.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TypedLocalObjectReference
member.summary: TypedLocalObjectReference contains enough information to let you locate the typed referenced object inside the same namespace.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TypedLocalObjectReference.Name
member.summary: Name is the name of resource being referenced

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.TypedLocalObjectReference.ApiGroup
member.summary: APIGroup is the group for the resource being referenced. If APIGroup is not specified, the specified Kind must be in the core API group. For any other third-party types, APIGroup is required.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume
member.summary: Volume represents a named volume in a pod that may be accessed by any container in the pod.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.Name
member.summary: Volume's name. Must be a DNS_LABEL and unique within the pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.AwsElasticBlockStore
member.summary: AWSElasticBlockStore represents an AWS Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.AzureDisk
member.summary: AzureDisk represents an Azure Data Disk mount on the host and bind mount to the pod.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.AzureFile
member.summary: AzureFile represents an Azure File Service mount on the host and bind mount to the pod.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.Cephfs
member.summary: CephFS represents a Ceph FS mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.Cinder
member.summary: Cinder represents a cinder volume attached and mounted on kubelets host machine. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/mysql-cinder-pd/README.md

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.ConfigMap
member.summary: ConfigMap represents a configMap that should populate this volume

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.Csi
member.summary: CSI (Container Storage Interface) represents storage that is handled by an external CSI driver (Alpha feature).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.DownwardAPI
member.summary: DownwardAPI represents downward API about the pod that should populate this volume

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.EmptyDir
member.summary: EmptyDir represents a temporary directory that shares a pod's lifetime. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#emptydir

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.Fc
member.summary: FC represents a Fibre Channel resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.FlexVolume
member.summary: FlexVolume represents a generic volume resource that is provisioned/attached using an exec based plugin.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.Flocker
member.summary: Flocker represents a Flocker volume attached to a kubelet's host machine. This depends on the Flocker control service being running

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.GcePersistentDisk
member.summary: GCEPersistentDisk represents a GCE Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.GitRepo
member.summary: GitRepo represents a git repository at a particular revision. DEPRECATED: GitRepo is deprecated. To provision a container with a git repo, mount an EmptyDir into an InitContainer that clones the repo using git, then mount the EmptyDir into the Pod's container.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.Glusterfs
member.summary: Glusterfs represents a Glusterfs mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.HostPath
member.summary: HostPath represents a pre-existing file or directory on the host machine that is directly exposed to the container. This is generally used for system agents or other privileged things that are allowed to see the host machine. Most containers will NOT need this. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#hostpath

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.Iscsi
member.summary: ISCSI represents an ISCSI Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/iscsi/README.md

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.Nfs
member.summary: NFS represents an NFS mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#nfs

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.PersistentVolumeClaim
member.summary: PersistentVolumeClaimVolumeSource represents a reference to a PersistentVolumeClaim in the same namespace. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#persistentvolumeclaims

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.PhotonPersistentDisk
member.summary: PhotonPersistentDisk represents a PhotonController persistent disk attached and mounted on kubelets host machine

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.PortworxVolume
member.summary: PortworxVolume represents a portworx volume attached and mounted on kubelets host machine

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.Projected
member.summary: Items for all in one resources secrets, configmaps, and downward API

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.Quobyte
member.summary: Quobyte represents a Quobyte mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.Rbd
member.summary: RBD represents a Rados Block Device mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/rbd/README.md

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.ScaleIO
member.summary: ScaleIO represents a ScaleIO persistent volume attached and mounted on Kubernetes nodes.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.Secret
member.summary: Secret represents a secret that should populate this volume. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#secret

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.Storageos
member.summary: StorageOS represents a StorageOS volume attached and mounted on Kubernetes nodes.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.Volume.VsphereVolume
member.summary: VsphereVolume represents a vSphere volume attached and mounted on kubelets host machine

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeDevice
member.summary: volumeDevice describes a mapping of a raw block device within a container.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeDevice.DevicePath
member.summary: devicePath is the path inside of the container that the device will be mapped to.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeDevice.Name
member.summary: name must match the name of a persistentVolumeClaim in the pod

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeMount
member.summary: VolumeMount describes a mounting of a Volume within a container.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeMount.MountPath
member.summary: Path within the container at which the volume should be mounted. Must not contain ':'.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeMount.Name
member.summary: This must match the Name of a Volume.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeMount.MountPropagation
member.summary: mountPropagation determines how mounts are propagated from the host to container and the other way around. When not set, MountPropagationNone is used. This field is beta in 1.10.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeMount.ReadOnly
member.summary: Mounted read-only if true, read-write otherwise (false or unspecified). Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeMount.SubPath
member.summary: Path within the volume from which the container's volume should be mounted. Defaults to "" (volume's root).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeMount.SubPathExpr
member.summary: Expanded path within the volume from which the container's volume should be mounted. Behaves similarly to SubPath but environment variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container's environment. Defaults to "" (volume's root). SubPathExpr and SubPath are mutually exclusive. This field is beta in 1.15.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeNodeAffinity
member.summary: VolumeNodeAffinity defines constraints that limit what nodes this volume can be accessed from.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeNodeAffinity.Required
member.summary: Required specifies hard node constraints that must be met.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeProjection

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeProjection.ConfigMap

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeProjection.DownwardAPI
member.summary: information about the downwardAPI data to project

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeProjection.Secret
member.summary: information about the secret data to project

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VolumeProjection.ServiceAccountToken

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VsphereVirtualDiskVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a vSphere volume resource.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VsphereVirtualDiskVolumeSource.VolumePath
member.summary: Path that identifies vSphere volume vmdk

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VsphereVirtualDiskVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VsphereVirtualDiskVolumeSource.StoragePolicyID
member.summary: Storage Policy Based Management (SPBM) profile ID associated with the StoragePolicyName.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.VsphereVirtualDiskVolumeSource.StoragePolicyName
member.summary: Storage Policy Based Management (SPBM) profile name.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.WeightedPodAffinityTerm
member.summary: The weights of all of the matched WeightedPodAffinityTerm fields are added per-node to find the most preferred node(s)

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.WeightedPodAffinityTerm.PodAffinityTerm
member.summary: Required. A pod affinity term, associated with the corresponding weight.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.WeightedPodAffinityTerm.Weight
member.summary: weight associated with matching the corresponding podAffinityTerm, in the range 1-100.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.WindowsSecurityContextOptions
member.summary: WindowsSecurityContextOptions contain Windows-specific options and credentials.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.WindowsSecurityContextOptions.GmsaCredentialSpec
member.summary: GMSACredentialSpec is where the GMSA admission webhook (https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/windows-gmsa) inlines the contents of the GMSA credential spec named by the GMSACredentialSpecName field. This field is alpha-level and is only honored by servers that enable the WindowsGMSA feature flag.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.WindowsSecurityContextOptions.GmsaCredentialSpecName
member.summary: GMSACredentialSpecName is the name of the GMSA credential spec to use. This field is alpha-level and is only honored by servers that enable the WindowsGMSA feature flag.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Core.V1.WindowsSecurityContextOptions.RunAsUserName
member.summary: The UserName in Windows to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to the user specified in image metadata if unspecified. May also be set in PodSecurityContext. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. This field is alpha-level and it is only honored by servers that enable the WindowsRunAsUserName feature flag.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.Endpoint
member.summary: Endpoint represents a single logical "backend" implementing a service.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.Endpoint.Addresses
member.summary: addresses of this endpoint. The contents of this field are interpreted according to the corresponding EndpointSlice addressType field. This allows for cases like dual-stack (IPv4 and IPv6) networking. Consumers (e.g. kube-proxy) must handle different types of addresses in the context of their own capabilities. This must contain at least one address but no more than 100.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.Endpoint.Conditions
member.summary: conditions contains information about the current status of the endpoint.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.Endpoint.Hostname
member.summary: hostname of this endpoint. This field may be used by consumers of endpoints to distinguish endpoints from each other (e.g. in DNS names). Multiple endpoints which use the same hostname should be considered fungible (e.g. multiple A values in DNS). Must pass DNS Label (RFC 1123) validation.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.Endpoint.TargetRef
member.summary: targetRef is a reference to a Kubernetes object that represents this endpoint.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.Endpoint.Topology
member.summary: topology contains arbitrary topology information associated with the endpoint. These key/value pairs must conform with the label format. https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels Topology may include a maximum of 16 key/value pairs. This includes, but is not limited to the following well known keys: * kubernetes.io/hostname: the value indicates the hostname of the node where the endpoint is located. This should match the corresponding node label. * topology.kubernetes.io/zone: the value indicates the zone where the endpoint is located. This should match the corresponding node label. * topology.kubernetes.io/region: the value indicates the region where the endpoint is located. This should match the corresponding node label.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.EndpointConditions
member.summary: EndpointConditions represents the current condition of an endpoint.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.EndpointConditions.Ready
member.summary: ready indicates that this endpoint is prepared to receive traffic, according to whatever system is managing the endpoint. A nil value indicates an unknown state. In most cases consumers should interpret this unknown state as ready.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.EndpointPort
member.summary: EndpointPort represents a Port used by an EndpointSlice

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.EndpointPort.Name
member.summary: The name of this port. All ports in an EndpointSlice must have a unique name. If the EndpointSlice is dervied from a Kubernetes service, this corresponds to the Service.ports[].name. Name must either be an empty string or pass IANA_SVC_NAME validation: * must be no more than 15 characters long * may contain only [-a-z0-9] * must contain at least one letter [a-z] * it must not start or end with a hyphen, nor contain adjacent hyphens Default is empty string.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.EndpointPort.Port
member.summary: The port number of the endpoint. If this is not specified, ports are not restricted and must be interpreted in the context of the specific consumer.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.EndpointPort.Protocol
member.summary: The IP protocol for this port. Must be UDP, TCP, or SCTP. Default is TCP.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.EndpointSlice
member.summary: EndpointSlice represents a subset of the endpoints that implement a service. For a given service there may be multiple EndpointSlice objects, selected by labels, which must be joined to produce the full set of endpoints.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.EndpointSlice.Endpoints
member.summary: endpoints is a list of unique endpoints in this slice. Each slice may include a maximum of 1000 endpoints.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.EndpointSlice.AddressType
member.summary: addressType specifies the type of address carried by this EndpointSlice. All addresses in this slice must be the same type. Default is IP

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.EndpointSlice.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.EndpointSlice.Ports
member.summary: ports specifies the list of network ports exposed by each endpoint in this slice. Each port must have a unique name. When ports is empty, it indicates that there are no defined ports. When a port is defined with a nil port value, it indicates "all ports". Each slice may include a maximum of 100 ports.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.EndpointSliceList
member.summary: EndpointSliceList represents a list of endpoint slices

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.EndpointSliceList.Items
member.summary: List of endpoint slices

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Discovery.V1Alpha1.EndpointSliceList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.Event
member.summary: Event is a report of an event somewhere in the cluster. It generally denotes some state change in the system.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.Event.EventTime
member.summary: Required. Time when this Event was first observed.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.Event.Action
member.summary: What action was taken/failed regarding to the regarding object.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.Event.DeprecatedCount
member.summary: Deprecated field assuring backward compatibility with core.v1 Event type

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.Event.DeprecatedFirstTimestamp
member.summary: Deprecated field assuring backward compatibility with core.v1 Event type

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.Event.DeprecatedLastTimestamp
member.summary: Deprecated field assuring backward compatibility with core.v1 Event type

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.Event.DeprecatedSource
member.summary: Deprecated field assuring backward compatibility with core.v1 Event type

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.Event.Note
member.summary: Optional. A human-readable description of the status of this operation. Maximal length of the note is 1kB, but libraries should be prepared to handle values up to 64kB.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.Event.Reason
member.summary: Why the action was taken.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.Event.Regarding
member.summary: The object this Event is about. In most cases it's an Object reporting controller implements. E.g. ReplicaSetController implements ReplicaSets and this event is emitted because it acts on some changes in a ReplicaSet object.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.Event.Related
member.summary: Optional secondary object for more complex actions. E.g. when regarding object triggers a creation or deletion of related object.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.Event.ReportingController
member.summary: Name of the controller that emitted this Event, e.g. `kubernetes.io/kubelet`.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.Event.ReportingInstance
member.summary: ID of the controller instance, e.g. `kubelet-xyzf`.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.Event.Series
member.summary: Data about the Event series this event represents or nil if it's a singleton Event.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.Event.Type
member.summary: Type of this event (Normal, Warning), new types could be added in the future.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.EventList
member.summary: EventList is a list of Event objects.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.EventList.Items
member.summary: Items is a list of schema objects.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.EventList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.EventSeries
member.summary: EventSeries contain information on series of events, i.e. thing that was/is happening continuously for some time.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.EventSeries.Count
member.summary: Number of occurrences in this series up to the last heartbeat time

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Events.V1Beta1.EventSeries.LastObservedTime

member.summary: AllowedFlexVolume represents a single Flexvolume that is allowed to be used. Deprecated: use AllowedFlexVolume from policy API Group instead.

member.summary: driver is the name of the Flexvolume driver.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.AllowedHostPath
member.summary: AllowedHostPath defines the host volume conditions that will be enabled by a policy for pods to use. It requires the path prefix to be defined. Deprecated: use AllowedHostPath from policy API Group instead.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.AllowedHostPath.PathPrefix
member.summary:
pathPrefix is the path prefix that the host volume must match. It does not support `*`. Trailing slashes are trimmed when validating the path prefix with a host path.
Examples: `/foo` would allow `/foo`, `/foo/` and `/foo/bar` `/foo` would not allow `/food` or `/etc/foo`

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.AllowedHostPath.ReadOnly
member.summary: when set to true, will allow host volumes matching the pathPrefix only if all volume mounts are readOnly.

member.summary: DaemonSetSpec is the specification of a daemon set.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetSpec.Template
member.summary: An object that describes the pod that will be created. The DaemonSet will create exactly one copy of this pod on every node that matches the template's node selector (or on every node if no node selector is specified). More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/replicationcontroller#pod-template

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetSpec.MinReadySeconds
member.summary: The minimum number of seconds for which a newly created DaemonSet pod should be ready without any of its container crashing, for it to be considered available. Defaults to 0 (pod will be considered available as soon as it is ready).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetSpec.RevisionHistoryLimit
member.summary: The number of old history to retain to allow rollback. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 10.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetSpec.Selector
member.summary: A label query over pods that are managed by the daemon set. Must match in order to be controlled. If empty, defaulted to labels on Pod template. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetSpec.TemplateGeneration
member.summary: DEPRECATED. A sequence number representing a specific generation of the template. Populated by the system. It can be set only during the creation.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetSpec.UpdateStrategy
member.summary: An update strategy to replace existing DaemonSet pods with new pods.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetStatus
member.summary: DaemonSetStatus represents the current status of a daemon set.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetStatus.CurrentNumberScheduled
member.summary: The number of nodes that are running at least 1 daemon pod and are supposed to run the daemon pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/daemonset/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetStatus.DesiredNumberScheduled
member.summary: The total number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod (including nodes correctly running the daemon pod). More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/daemonset/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetStatus.NumberMisscheduled
member.summary: The number of nodes that are running the daemon pod, but are not supposed to run the daemon pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/daemonset/

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetStatus.NumberReady
member.summary: The number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod and have one or more of the daemon pod running and ready.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetStatus.CollisionCount
member.summary: Count of hash collisions for the DaemonSet. The DaemonSet controller uses this field as a collision avoidance mechanism when it needs to create the name for the newest ControllerRevision.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetStatus.Conditions
member.summary: Represents the latest available observations of a DaemonSet's current state.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetStatus.NumberAvailable
member.summary: The number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod and have one or more of the daemon pod running and available (ready for at least spec.minReadySeconds)

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetStatus.NumberUnavailable
member.summary: The number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod and have none of the daemon pod running and available (ready for at least spec.minReadySeconds)

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetStatus.ObservedGeneration
member.summary: The most recent generation observed by the daemon set controller.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Inputs.Extensions.V1Beta1.DaemonSetStatus.UpdatedNumberScheduled
member.summary: The total number of nodes that are running updated daemon pod

member.summary: Rolling update config params. Present only if type = "RollingUpdate".

member.summary: Type of daemon set update. Can be "RollingUpdate" or "OnDelete". Default is OnDelete.
