member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.RollingUpdateDaemonSet
member.summary: Spec to control the desired behavior of daemon set rolling update.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.RollingUpdateDaemonSet.MaxUnavailable
member.summary: The maximum number of DaemonSet pods that can be unavailable during the update. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of total number of DaemonSet pods at the start of the update (ex: 10%). Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding up. This cannot be 0. Default value is 1. Example: when this is set to 30%, at most 30% of the total number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod (i.e. status.desiredNumberScheduled) can have their pods stopped for an update at any given time. The update starts by stopping at most 30% of those DaemonSet pods and then brings up new DaemonSet pods in their place. Once the new pods are available, it then proceeds onto other DaemonSet pods, thus ensuring that at least 70% of original number of DaemonSet pods are available at all times during the update.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.RollingUpdateDeployment
member.summary: Spec to control the desired behavior of rolling update.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.RollingUpdateDeployment.MaxSurge
member.summary: The maximum number of pods that can be scheduled above the desired number of pods. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of desired pods (ex: 10%). This can not be 0 if MaxUnavailable is 0. Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding up. Defaults to 25%. Example: when this is set to 30%, the new ReplicaSet can be scaled up immediately when the rolling update starts, such that the total number of old and new pods do not exceed 130% of desired pods. Once old pods have been killed, new ReplicaSet can be scaled up further, ensuring that total number of pods running at any time during the update is at most 130% of desired pods.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.RollingUpdateDeployment.MaxUnavailable
member.summary: The maximum number of pods that can be unavailable during the update. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of desired pods (ex: 10%). Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding down. This can not be 0 if MaxSurge is 0. Defaults to 25%. Example: when this is set to 30%, the old ReplicaSet can be scaled down to 70% of desired pods immediately when the rolling update starts. Once new pods are ready, old ReplicaSet can be scaled down further, followed by scaling up the new ReplicaSet, ensuring that the total number of pods available at all times during the update is at least 70% of desired pods.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategy
member.summary: RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategy is used to communicate parameter for RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategyType.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategy.Partition
member.summary: Partition indicates the ordinal at which the StatefulSet should be partitioned. Default value is 0.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSet
member.summary: StatefulSet represents a set of pods with consistent identities. Identities are defined as: - Network: A single stable DNS and hostname. - Storage: As many VolumeClaims as requested. The StatefulSet guarantees that a given network identity will always map to the same storage identity.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSet.Spec
member.summary: Spec defines the desired identities of pods in this set.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSet.Status
member.summary: Status is the current status of Pods in this StatefulSet. This data may be out of date by some window of time.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetCondition
member.summary: StatefulSetCondition describes the state of a statefulset at a certain point.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetCondition.LastTransitionTime
member.summary: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetCondition.Message
member.summary: A human readable message indicating details about the transition.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetCondition.Reason
member.summary: The reason for the condition's last transition.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetCondition.Status
member.summary: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetCondition.Type
member.summary: Type of statefulset condition.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetList
member.summary: StatefulSetList is a collection of StatefulSets.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec
member.summary: A StatefulSetSpec is the specification of a StatefulSet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.PodManagementPolicy
member.summary: podManagementPolicy controls how pods are created during initial scale up, when replacing pods on nodes, or when scaling down. The default policy is `OrderedReady`, where pods are created in increasing order (pod-0, then pod-1, etc) and the controller will wait until each pod is ready before continuing. When scaling down, the pods are removed in the opposite order. The alternative policy is `Parallel` which will create pods in parallel to match the desired scale without waiting, and on scale down will delete all pods at once.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.Replicas
member.summary: replicas is the desired number of replicas of the given Template. These are replicas in the sense that they are instantiations of the same Template, but individual replicas also have a consistent identity. If unspecified, defaults to 1.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.RevisionHistoryLimit
member.summary: revisionHistoryLimit is the maximum number of revisions that will be maintained in the StatefulSet's revision history. The revision history consists of all revisions not represented by a currently applied StatefulSetSpec version. The default value is 10.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.Selector
member.summary: selector is a label query over pods that should match the replica count. It must match the pod template's labels. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.ServiceName
member.summary: serviceName is the name of the service that governs this StatefulSet. This service must exist before the StatefulSet, and is responsible for the network identity of the set. Pods get DNS/hostnames that follow the pattern: pod-specific-string.serviceName.default.svc.cluster.local where "pod-specific-string" is managed by the StatefulSet controller.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.Template
member.summary: template is the object that describes the pod that will be created if insufficient replicas are detected. Each pod stamped out by the StatefulSet will fulfill this Template, but have a unique identity from the rest of the StatefulSet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.UpdateStrategy
member.summary: updateStrategy indicates the StatefulSetUpdateStrategy that will be employed to update Pods in the StatefulSet when a revision is made to Template.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetSpec.VolumeClaimTemplates
member.summary: volumeClaimTemplates is a list of claims that pods are allowed to reference. The StatefulSet controller is responsible for mapping network identities to claims in a way that maintains the identity of a pod. Every claim in this list must have at least one matching (by name) volumeMount in one container in the template. A claim in this list takes precedence over any volumes in the template, with the same name.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus
member.summary: StatefulSetStatus represents the current state of a StatefulSet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.CollisionCount
member.summary: collisionCount is the count of hash collisions for the StatefulSet. The StatefulSet controller uses this field as a collision avoidance mechanism when it needs to create the name for the newest ControllerRevision.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.Conditions
member.summary: Represents the latest available observations of a statefulset's current state.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.CurrentReplicas
member.summary: currentReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller from the StatefulSet version indicated by currentRevision.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.CurrentRevision
member.summary: currentRevision, if not empty, indicates the version of the StatefulSet used to generate Pods in the sequence [0,currentReplicas).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.ObservedGeneration
member.summary: observedGeneration is the most recent generation observed for this StatefulSet. It corresponds to the StatefulSet's generation, which is updated on mutation by the API Server.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.ReadyReplicas
member.summary: readyReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller that have a Ready Condition.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.Replicas
member.summary: replicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.UpdateRevision
member.summary: updateRevision, if not empty, indicates the version of the StatefulSet used to generate Pods in the sequence [replicas-updatedReplicas,replicas)

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetStatus.UpdatedReplicas
member.summary: updatedReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller from the StatefulSet version indicated by updateRevision.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetUpdateStrategy
member.summary: StatefulSetUpdateStrategy indicates the strategy that the StatefulSet controller will use to perform updates. It includes any additional parameters necessary to perform the update for the indicated strategy.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetUpdateStrategy.RollingUpdate
member.summary: RollingUpdate is used to communicate parameters when Type is RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategyType.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1.StatefulSetUpdateStrategy.Type
member.summary: Type indicates the type of the StatefulSetUpdateStrategy. Default is RollingUpdate.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.ControllerRevision
member.summary:
DEPRECATED - apps/v1beta1/ControllerRevision is not supported by Kubernetes 1.16+ clusters. Use apps/v1/ControllerRevision instead.
ControllerRevision implements an immutable snapshot of state data. Clients are responsible for serializing and deserializing the objects that contain their internal state. Once a ControllerRevision has been successfully created, it can not be updated. The API Server will fail validation of all requests that attempt to mutate the Data field. ControllerRevisions may, however, be deleted. Note that, due to its use by both the DaemonSet and StatefulSet controllers for update and rollback, this object is beta. However, it may be subject to name and representation changes in future releases, and clients should not depend on its stability. It is primarily for internal use by controllers.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.ControllerRevision.Data
member.summary: Data is the serialized representation of the state.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.ControllerRevision.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.ControllerRevision.Revision
member.summary: Revision indicates the revision of the state represented by Data.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.ControllerRevisionList
member.summary: ControllerRevisionList is a resource containing a list of ControllerRevision objects.

member.summary: Items is the list of ControllerRevisions

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentSpec.MinReadySeconds
member.summary: Minimum number of seconds for which a newly created pod should be ready without any of its container crashing, for it to be considered available. Defaults to 0 (pod will be considered available as soon as it is ready)

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentSpec.Paused
member.summary: Indicates that the deployment is paused.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentSpec.ProgressDeadlineSeconds
member.summary: The maximum time in seconds for a deployment to make progress before it is considered to be failed. The deployment controller will continue to process failed deployments and a condition with a ProgressDeadlineExceeded reason will be surfaced in the deployment status. Note that progress will not be estimated during the time a deployment is paused. Defaults to 600s.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentSpec.Replicas
member.summary: Number of desired pods. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 1.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentSpec.RevisionHistoryLimit
member.summary: The number of old ReplicaSets to retain to allow rollback. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 2.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentSpec.RollbackTo
member.summary: DEPRECATED. The config this deployment is rolling back to. Will be cleared after rollback is done.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentSpec.Selector
member.summary: Label selector for pods. Existing ReplicaSets whose pods are selected by this will be the ones affected by this deployment.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentSpec.Strategy
member.summary: The deployment strategy to use to replace existing pods with new ones.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentSpec.Template
member.summary: Template describes the pods that will be created.

member.summary: DeploymentStatus is the most recently observed status of the Deployment.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentStatus.AvailableReplicas
member.summary: Total number of available pods (ready for at least minReadySeconds) targeted by this deployment.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentStatus.CollisionCount
member.summary: Count of hash collisions for the Deployment. The Deployment controller uses this field as a collision avoidance mechanism when it needs to create the name for the newest ReplicaSet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentStatus.Conditions
member.summary: Represents the latest available observations of a deployment's current state.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentStatus.ObservedGeneration
member.summary: The generation observed by the deployment controller.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentStatus.ReadyReplicas
member.summary: Total number of ready pods targeted by this deployment.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentStatus.Replicas
member.summary: Total number of non-terminated pods targeted by this deployment (their labels match the selector).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentStatus.UnavailableReplicas
member.summary: Total number of unavailable pods targeted by this deployment. This is the total number of pods that are still required for the deployment to have 100% available capacity. They may either be pods that are running but not yet available or pods that still have not been created.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentStatus.UpdatedReplicas
member.summary: Total number of non-terminated pods targeted by this deployment that have the desired template spec.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentStrategy
member.summary: DeploymentStrategy describes how to replace existing pods with new ones.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentStrategy.RollingUpdate
member.summary: Rolling update config params. Present only if DeploymentStrategyType = RollingUpdate.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.DeploymentStrategy.Type
member.summary: Type of deployment. Can be "Recreate" or "RollingUpdate". Default is RollingUpdate.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.RollbackConfig
member.summary: DEPRECATED.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.RollbackConfig.Revision
member.summary: The revision to rollback to. If set to 0, rollback to the last revision.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.RollingUpdateDeployment
member.summary: Spec to control the desired behavior of rolling update.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.RollingUpdateDeployment.MaxSurge
member.summary: The maximum number of pods that can be scheduled above the desired number of pods. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of desired pods (ex: 10%). This can not be 0 if MaxUnavailable is 0. Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding up. Defaults to 25%. Example: when this is set to 30%, the new ReplicaSet can be scaled up immediately when the rolling update starts, such that the total number of old and new pods do not exceed 130% of desired pods. Once old pods have been killed, new ReplicaSet can be scaled up further, ensuring that total number of pods running at any time during the update is at most 130% of desired pods.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.RollingUpdateDeployment.MaxUnavailable
member.summary: The maximum number of pods that can be unavailable during the update. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of desired pods (ex: 10%). Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding down. This can not be 0 if MaxSurge is 0. Defaults to 25%. Example: when this is set to 30%, the old ReplicaSet can be scaled down to 70% of desired pods immediately when the rolling update starts. Once new pods are ready, old ReplicaSet can be scaled down further, followed by scaling up the new ReplicaSet, ensuring that the total number of pods available at all times during the update is at least 70% of desired pods.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta1.RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategy
member.summary: RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategy is used to communicate parameter for RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategyType.

member.summary: Partition indicates the ordinal at which the StatefulSet should be partitioned.

This is done to avoid introspection in the clients. The string will be in the same format as the query-param syntax. If the target type only supports map-based selectors, both this field and map-based selector field are populated. member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.ControllerRevision
member.summary:
DEPRECATED - apps/v1beta2/ControllerRevision is not supported by Kubernetes 1.16+ clusters. Use apps/v1/ControllerRevision instead.
ControllerRevision implements an immutable snapshot of state data. Clients are responsible for serializing and deserializing the objects that contain their internal state. Once a ControllerRevision has been successfully created, it can not be updated. The API Server will fail validation of all requests that attempt to mutate the Data field. ControllerRevisions may, however, be deleted. Note that, due to its use by both the DaemonSet and StatefulSet controllers for update and rollback, this object is beta. However, it may be subject to name and representation changes in future releases, and clients should not depend on its stability. It is primarily for internal use by controllers.

The deployment controller will continue to process failed deployments and a condition with a ProgressDeadlineExceeded reason will be surfaced in the deployment status. Note that progress will not be estimated during the time a deployment is paused. Defaults to 600s.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.RollingUpdateDaemonSet
member.summary: Spec to control the desired behavior of daemon set rolling update.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.RollingUpdateDaemonSet.MaxUnavailable
member.summary: The maximum number of DaemonSet pods that can be unavailable during the update. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of total number of DaemonSet pods at the start of the update (ex: 10%). Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding up. This cannot be 0. Default value is 1. Example: when this is set to 30%, at most 30% of the total number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod (i.e. status.desiredNumberScheduled) can have their pods stopped for an update at any given time. The update starts by stopping at most 30% of those DaemonSet pods and then brings up new DaemonSet pods in their place. Once the new pods are available, it then proceeds onto other DaemonSet pods, thus ensuring that at least 70% of original number of DaemonSet pods are available at all times during the update.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.RollingUpdateDeployment
member.summary: Spec to control the desired behavior of rolling update.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.RollingUpdateDeployment.MaxSurge
member.summary: The maximum number of pods that can be scheduled above the desired number of pods. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of desired pods (ex: 10%). This can not be 0 if MaxUnavailable is 0. Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding up. Defaults to 25%. Example: when this is set to 30%, the new ReplicaSet can be scaled up immediately when the rolling update starts, such that the total number of old and new pods do not exceed 130% of desired pods. Once old pods have been killed, new ReplicaSet can be scaled up further, ensuring that total number of pods running at any time during the update is at most 130% of desired pods.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.RollingUpdateDeployment.MaxUnavailable
member.summary: The maximum number of pods that can be unavailable during the update. Value can be an absolute number (ex: 5) or a percentage of desired pods (ex: 10%). Absolute number is calculated from percentage by rounding down. This can not be 0 if MaxSurge is 0. Defaults to 25%. Example: when this is set to 30%, the old ReplicaSet can be scaled down to 70% of desired pods immediately when the rolling update starts. Once new pods are ready, old ReplicaSet can be scaled down further, followed by scaling up the new ReplicaSet, ensuring that the total number of pods available at all times during the update is at least 70% of desired pods.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategy
member.summary: RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategy is used to communicate parameter for RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategyType.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.RollingUpdateStatefulSetStrategy.Partition

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.ScaleStatus.TargetSelector
member.summary: label selector for pods that should match the replicas count. This is a serializated version of both map-based and more expressive set-based selectors. This is done to avoid introspection in the clients. The string will be in the same format as the query-param syntax. If the target type only supports map-based selectors, both this field and map-based selector field are populated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSet
member.summary:
DEPRECATED - apps/v1beta2/StatefulSet is not supported by Kubernetes 1.16+ clusters. Use apps/v1/StatefulSet instead.
StatefulSet represents a set of pods with consistent identities. Identities are defined as: - Network: A single stable DNS and hostname. - Storage: As many VolumeClaims as requested. The StatefulSet guarantees that a given network identity will always map to the same storage identity.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSet.Spec
member.summary: Spec defines the desired identities of pods in this set.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSet.Status
member.summary: Status is the current status of Pods in this StatefulSet. This data may be out of date by some window of time.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetCondition
member.summary: StatefulSetCondition describes the state of a statefulset at a certain point.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetCondition.LastTransitionTime
member.summary: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetCondition.Message
member.summary: A human readable message indicating details about the transition.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetCondition.Reason
member.summary: The reason for the condition's last transition.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetCondition.Status
member.summary: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetCondition.Type
member.summary: Type of statefulset condition.

member.summary: StatefulSetList is a collection of StatefulSets.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec
member.summary: A StatefulSetSpec is the specification of a StatefulSet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.PodManagementPolicy
member.summary: podManagementPolicy controls how pods are created during initial scale up, when replacing pods on nodes, or when scaling down. The default policy is `OrderedReady`, where pods are created in increasing order (pod-0, then pod-1, etc) and the controller will wait until each pod is ready before continuing. When scaling down, the pods are removed in the opposite order. The alternative policy is `Parallel` which will create pods in parallel to match the desired scale without waiting, and on scale down will delete all pods at once.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.Replicas
member.summary: replicas is the desired number of replicas of the given Template. These are replicas in the sense that they are instantiations of the same Template, but individual replicas also have a consistent identity. If unspecified, defaults to 1.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.RevisionHistoryLimit
member.summary: revisionHistoryLimit is the maximum number of revisions that will be maintained in the StatefulSet's revision history. The revision history consists of all revisions not represented by a currently applied StatefulSetSpec version. The default value is 10.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.Selector
member.summary: selector is a label query over pods that should match the replica count. It must match the pod template's labels. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.ServiceName
member.summary: serviceName is the name of the service that governs this StatefulSet. This service must exist before the StatefulSet, and is responsible for the network identity of the set. Pods get DNS/hostnames that follow the pattern: pod-specific-string.serviceName.default.svc.cluster.local where "pod-specific-string" is managed by the StatefulSet controller.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.Template
member.summary: template is the object that describes the pod that will be created if insufficient replicas are detected. Each pod stamped out by the StatefulSet will fulfill this Template, but have a unique identity from the rest of the StatefulSet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.UpdateStrategy
member.summary: updateStrategy indicates the StatefulSetUpdateStrategy that will be employed to update Pods in the StatefulSet when a revision is made to Template.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetSpec.VolumeClaimTemplates
member.summary: volumeClaimTemplates is a list of claims that pods are allowed to reference. The StatefulSet controller is responsible for mapping network identities to claims in a way that maintains the identity of a pod. Every claim in this list must have at least one matching (by name) volumeMount in one container in the template. A claim in this list takes precedence over any volumes in the template, with the same name.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus
member.summary: StatefulSetStatus represents the current state of a StatefulSet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.CollisionCount
member.summary: collisionCount is the count of hash collisions for the StatefulSet. The StatefulSet controller uses this field as a collision avoidance mechanism when it needs to create the name for the newest ControllerRevision.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.Conditions
member.summary: Represents the latest available observations of a statefulset's current state.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.CurrentReplicas
member.summary: currentReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller from the StatefulSet version indicated by currentRevision.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.CurrentRevision
member.summary: currentRevision, if not empty, indicates the version of the StatefulSet used to generate Pods in the sequence [0,currentReplicas).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.ObservedGeneration
member.summary: observedGeneration is the most recent generation observed for this StatefulSet. It corresponds to the StatefulSet's generation, which is updated on mutation by the API Server.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.ReadyReplicas
member.summary: readyReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller that have a Ready Condition.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.Replicas
member.summary: replicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.UpdateRevision
member.summary: updateRevision, if not empty, indicates the version of the StatefulSet used to generate Pods in the sequence [replicas-updatedReplicas,replicas)

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Apps.V1Beta2.StatefulSetStatus.UpdatedReplicas
member.summary: updatedReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller from the StatefulSet version indicated by updateRevision.

member.summary: StatefulSetUpdateStrategy indicates the strategy that the StatefulSet controller will use to perform updates. It includes any additional parameters necessary to perform the update for the indicated strategy.

member.summary: Throttle holds the options for throttling the webhook

member.summary: WebhookClientConfig contains the information to make a connection with the webhook

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.AuditRegistraion.V1Alpha1.WebhookClientConfig.CaBundle
member.summary: `caBundle` is a PEM encoded CA bundle which will be used to validate the webhook's server certificate. If unspecified, system trust roots on the apiserver are used.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.AuditRegistraion.V1Alpha1.WebhookClientConfig.Service
member.summary:
`service` is a reference to the service for this webhook. Either `service` or `url` must be specified.
If the webhook is running within the cluster, then you should use `service`.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.AuditRegistraion.V1Alpha1.WebhookClientConfig.Url
member.summary:
`url` gives the location of the webhook, in standard URL form (`scheme://host:port/path`). Exactly one of `url` or `service` must be specified.
The `host` should not refer to a service running in the cluster; use the `service` field instead. The host might be resolved via external DNS in some apiservers (e.g., `kube-apiserver` cannot resolve in-cluster DNS as that would be a layering violation). `host` may also be an IP address.
Please note that using `localhost` or `127.0.0.1` as a `host` is risky unless you take great care to run this webhook on all hosts which run an apiserver which might need to make calls to this webhook. Such installs are likely to be non-portable, i.e., not easy to turn up in a new cluster.
The scheme must be "https"; the URL must begin with "https://".
A path is optional, and if present may be any string permissible in a URL. You may use the path to pass an arbitrary string to the webhook, for example, a cluster identifier.
Attempting to use a user or basic auth e.g. "user:password@" is not allowed. Fragments ("#...") and query parameters ("?...") are not allowed, either.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.AuditRegistraion.V1Alpha1.WebhookThrottleConfig
member.summary: WebhookThrottleConfig holds the configuration for throttling events

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.AuditRegistraion.V1Alpha1.WebhookThrottleConfig.Burst
member.summary: ThrottleBurst is the maximum number of events sent at the same moment default 15 QPS

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.AuditRegistraion.V1Alpha1.WebhookThrottleConfig.Qps
member.summary: ThrottleQPS maximum number of batches per second default 10 QPS

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenRequest
member.summary: TokenRequest requests a token for a given service account.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenRequestSpec
member.summary: TokenRequestSpec contains client provided parameters of a token request.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenRequestSpec.Audiences
member.summary: Audiences are the intendend audiences of the token. A recipient of a token must identitfy themself with an identifier in the list of audiences of the token, and otherwise should reject the token. A token issued for multiple audiences may be used to authenticate against any of the audiences listed but implies a high degree of trust between the target audiences.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenRequestSpec.BoundObjectRef
member.summary: BoundObjectRef is a reference to an object that the token will be bound to. The token will only be valid for as long as the bound object exists. NOTE: The API server's TokenReview endpoint will validate the BoundObjectRef, but other audiences may not. Keep ExpirationSeconds small if you want prompt revocation.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenRequestSpec.ExpirationSeconds
member.summary: ExpirationSeconds is the requested duration of validity of the request. The token issuer may return a token with a different validity duration so a client needs to check the 'expiration' field in a response.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenRequestStatus
member.summary: TokenRequestStatus is the result of a token request.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenRequestStatus.ExpirationTimestamp
member.summary: ExpirationTimestamp is the time of expiration of the returned token.

member.summary: Token is the opaque bearer token.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReview
member.summary: TokenReview attempts to authenticate a token to a known user. Note: TokenReview requests may be cached by the webhook token authenticator plugin in the kube-apiserver.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReview.Spec
member.summary: Spec holds information about the request being evaluated

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReview.Status
member.summary: Status is filled in by the server and indicates whether the request can be authenticated.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewSpec
member.summary: TokenReviewSpec is a description of the token authentication request.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewSpec.Audiences
member.summary: Audiences is a list of the identifiers that the resource server presented with the token identifies as. Audience-aware token authenticators will verify that the token was intended for at least one of the audiences in this list. If no audiences are provided, the audience will default to the audience of the Kubernetes apiserver.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewSpec.Token
member.summary: Token is the opaque bearer token.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewStatus
member.summary: TokenReviewStatus is the result of the token authentication request.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewStatus.Audiences
member.summary: Audiences are audience identifiers chosen by the authenticator that are compatible with both the TokenReview and token. An identifier is any identifier in the intersection of the TokenReviewSpec audiences and the token's audiences. A client of the TokenReview API that sets the spec.audiences field should validate that a compatible audience identifier is returned in the status.audiences field to ensure that the TokenReview server is audience aware. If a TokenReview returns an empty status.audience field where status.authenticated is "true", the token is valid against the audience of the Kubernetes API server.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewStatus.Authenticated
member.summary: Authenticated indicates that the token was associated with a known user.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewStatus.Error
member.summary: Error indicates that the token couldn't be checked

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.TokenReviewStatus.User
member.summary: User is the UserInfo associated with the provided token.

member.summary: UserInfo holds the information about the user needed to implement the user.Info interface.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authentication.V1.UserInfo.Extra
member.summary: Any additional information provided by the authenticator.

member.summary: The names of groups this user is a part of.

member.summary: A unique value that identifies this user across time. If this user is deleted and another user by the same name is added, they will have different UIDs.

member.summary: The name that uniquely identifies this user among all active users.

member.summary: SelfSubjectAccessReview checks whether or the current user can perform an action. Not filling in a spec.namespace means "in all namespaces". Self is a special case, because users should always be able to check whether they can perform an action

member.summary: ResourceAuthorizationAttributes describes information for a resource access request

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authorization.V1.SelfSubjectRulesReview
member.summary: SelfSubjectRulesReview enumerates the set of actions the current user can perform within a namespace. The returned list of actions may be incomplete depending on the server's authorization mode, and any errors experienced during the evaluation. SelfSubjectRulesReview should be used by UIs to show/hide actions, or to quickly let an end user reason about their permissions. It should NOT Be used by external systems to drive authorization decisions as this raises confused deputy, cache lifetime/revocation, and correctness concerns. SubjectAccessReview, and LocalAccessReview are the correct way to defer authorization decisions to the API server.

member.summary: Spec holds information about the request being evaluated.

member.summary: Status is filled in by the server and indicates the set of actions a user can perform.

member.summary: Namespace to evaluate rules for. Required.

member.summary: ResourceAuthorizationAttributes describes information for a resource access request

member.summary: UID information about the requesting user.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewSpec.User
member.summary: User is the user you're testing for. If you specify "User" but not "Groups", then is it interpreted as "What if User were not a member of any groups

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewStatus
member.summary: SubjectAccessReviewStatus

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewStatus.Allowed
member.summary: Allowed is required. True if the action would be allowed, false otherwise.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewStatus.Denied
member.summary: Denied is optional. True if the action would be denied, otherwise false. If both allowed is false and denied is false, then the authorizer has no opinion on whether to authorize the action. Denied may not be true if Allowed is true.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewStatus.EvaluationError
member.summary: EvaluationError is an indication that some error occurred during the authorization check. It is entirely possible to get an error and be able to continue determine authorization status in spite of it. For instance, RBAC can be missing a role, but enough roles are still present and bound to reason about the request.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectAccessReviewStatus.Reason
member.summary: Reason is optional. It indicates why a request was allowed or denied.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectRulesReviewStatus
member.summary: SubjectRulesReviewStatus contains the result of a rules check. This check can be incomplete depending on the set of authorizers the server is configured with and any errors experienced during evaluation. Because authorization rules are additive, if a rule appears in a list it's safe to assume the subject has that permission, even if that list is incomplete.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectRulesReviewStatus.EvaluationError
member.summary: EvaluationError can appear in combination with Rules. It indicates an error occurred during rule evaluation, such as an authorizer that doesn't support rule evaluation, and that ResourceRules and/or NonResourceRules may be incomplete.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectRulesReviewStatus.Incomplete
member.summary: Incomplete is true when the rules returned by this call are incomplete. This is most commonly encountered when an authorizer, such as an external authorizer, doesn't support rules evaluation.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectRulesReviewStatus.NonResourceRules
member.summary: NonResourceRules is the list of actions the subject is allowed to perform on non-resources. The list ordering isn't significant, may contain duplicates, and possibly be incomplete.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Authorization.V1.SubjectRulesReviewStatus.ResourceRules
member.summary: ResourceRules is the list of actions the subject is allowed to perform on resources. The list ordering isn't significant, may contain duplicates, and possibly be incomplete.

member.summary: specification of a horizontal pod autoscaler.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.MaxReplicas
member.summary: upper limit for the number of pods that can be set by the autoscaler; cannot be smaller than MinReplicas.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.MinReplicas
member.summary: minReplicas is the lower limit for the number of replicas to which the autoscaler can scale down. It defaults to 1 pod. minReplicas is allowed to be 0 if the alpha feature gate HPAScaleToZero is enabled and at least one Object or External metric is configured. Scaling is active as long as at least one metric value is available.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.ScaleTargetRef
member.summary: reference to scaled resource; horizontal pod autoscaler will learn the current resource consumption and will set the desired number of pods by using its Scale subresource.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.TargetCPUUtilizationPercentage
member.summary: target average CPU utilization (represented as a percentage of requested CPU) over all the pods; if not specified the default autoscaling policy will be used.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus
member.summary: current status of a horizontal pod autoscaler

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.CurrentCPUUtilizationPercentage
member.summary: current average CPU utilization over all pods, represented as a percentage of requested CPU, e.g. 70 means that an average pod is using now 70% of its requested CPU.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.CurrentReplicas
member.summary: current number of replicas of pods managed by this autoscaler.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.DesiredReplicas
member.summary: desired number of replicas of pods managed by this autoscaler.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.LastScaleTime
member.summary: last time the HorizontalPodAutoscaler scaled the number of pods; used by the autoscaler to control how often the number of pods is changed.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec
member.summary: HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec describes the desired functionality of the HorizontalPodAutoscaler.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.MaxReplicas
member.summary: maxReplicas is the upper limit for the number of replicas to which the autoscaler can scale up. It cannot be less that minReplicas.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.Metrics
member.summary: metrics contains the specifications for which to use to calculate the desired replica count (the maximum replica count across all metrics will be used). The desired replica count is calculated multiplying the ratio between the target value and the current value by the current number of pods. Ergo, metrics used must decrease as the pod count is increased, and vice-versa. See the individual metric source types for more information about how each type of metric must respond.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.MinReplicas
member.summary: minReplicas is the lower limit for the number of replicas to which the autoscaler can scale down. It defaults to 1 pod. minReplicas is allowed to be 0 if the alpha feature gate HPAScaleToZero is enabled and at least one Object or External metric is configured. Scaling is active as long as at least one metric value is available.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec.ScaleTargetRef
member.summary: scaleTargetRef points to the target resource to scale, and is used to the pods for which metrics should be collected, as well as to actually change the replica count.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus
member.summary: HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus describes the current status of a horizontal pod autoscaler.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.Conditions
member.summary: conditions is the set of conditions required for this autoscaler to scale its target, and indicates whether or not those conditions are met.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.CurrentMetrics
member.summary: currentMetrics is the last read state of the metrics used by this autoscaler.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.CurrentReplicas
member.summary: currentReplicas is current number of replicas of pods managed by this autoscaler, as last seen by the autoscaler.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.DesiredReplicas
member.summary: desiredReplicas is the desired number of replicas of pods managed by this autoscaler, as last calculated by the autoscaler.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.LastScaleTime
member.summary: lastScaleTime is the last time the HorizontalPodAutoscaler scaled the number of pods, used by the autoscaler to control how often the number of pods is changed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.ObservedGeneration
member.summary: observedGeneration is the most recent generation observed by this autoscaler.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricSpec
member.summary: MetricSpec specifies how to scale based on a single metric (only `type` and one other matching field should be set at once).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricSpec.External
member.summary: external refers to a global metric that is not associated with any Kubernetes object. It allows autoscaling based on information coming from components running outside of cluster (for example length of queue in cloud messaging service, or QPS from loadbalancer running outside of cluster).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricSpec.Object
member.summary: object refers to a metric describing a single kubernetes object (for example, hits-per-second on an Ingress object).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricSpec.Pods
member.summary: pods refers to a metric describing each pod in the current scale target (for example, transactions-processed-per-second). The values will be averaged together before being compared to the target value.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricSpec.Resource
member.summary: resource refers to a resource metric (such as those specified in requests and limits) known to Kubernetes describing each pod in the current scale target (e.g. CPU or memory). Such metrics are built in to Kubernetes, and have special scaling options on top of those available to normal per-pod metrics using the "pods" source.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricSpec.Type
member.summary: type is the type of metric source. It should be one of "Object", "Pods" or "Resource", each mapping to a matching field in the object.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricStatus
member.summary: MetricStatus describes the last-read state of a single metric.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricStatus.External
member.summary: external refers to a global metric that is not associated with any Kubernetes object. It allows autoscaling based on information coming from components running outside of cluster (for example length of queue in cloud messaging service, or QPS from loadbalancer running outside of cluster).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricStatus.Object
member.summary: object refers to a metric describing a single kubernetes object (for example, hits-per-second on an Ingress object).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricStatus.Pods
member.summary: pods refers to a metric describing each pod in the current scale target (for example, transactions-processed-per-second). The values will be averaged together before being compared to the target value.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.MetricStatus.Resource
member.summary: resource refers to a resource metric (such as those specified in requests and limits) known to Kubernetes describing each pod in the current scale target (e.g. CPU or memory). Such metrics are built in to Kubernetes, and have special scaling options on top of those available to normal per-pod metrics using the "pods" source.

member.summary: type is the type of metric source. It will be one of "Object", "Pods" or "Resource", each corresponds to a matching field in the object.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ObjectMetricSource
member.summary: ObjectMetricSource indicates how to scale on a metric describing a kubernetes object (for example, hits-per-second on an Ingress object).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ObjectMetricSource.AverageValue
member.summary: averageValue is the target value of the average of the metric across all relevant pods (as a quantity)

member.summary: metricName is the name of the metric in question.

member.summary: selector is the string-encoded form of a standard kubernetes label selector for the given metric When set, it is passed as an additional parameter to the metrics server for more specific metrics scoping When unset, just the metricName will be used to gather metrics.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ObjectMetricSource.Target
member.summary: target is the described Kubernetes object.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ObjectMetricSource.TargetValue
member.summary: targetValue is the target value of the metric (as a quantity).

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ObjectMetricStatus
member.summary: ObjectMetricStatus indicates the current value of a metric describing a kubernetes object (for example, hits-per-second on an Ingress object).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ObjectMetricStatus.AverageValue
member.summary: averageValue is the current value of the average of the metric across all relevant pods (as a quantity)

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ObjectMetricStatus.CurrentValue
member.summary: currentValue is the current value of the metric (as a quantity).

member.summary: metricName is the name of the metric in question.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ObjectMetricStatus.Selector
member.summary: selector is the string-encoded form of a standard kubernetes label selector for the given metric When set in the ObjectMetricSource, it is passed as an additional parameter to the metrics server for more specific metrics scoping. When unset, just the metricName will be used to gather metrics.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ObjectMetricStatus.Target
member.summary: target is the described Kubernetes object.

member.summary: PodsMetricSource indicates how to scale on a metric describing each pod in the current scale target (for example, transactions-processed-per-second). The values will be averaged together before being compared to the target value.

member.summary: metricName is the name of the metric in question

member.summary: selector is the string-encoded form of a standard kubernetes label selector for the given metric When set, it is passed as an additional parameter to the metrics server for more specific metrics scoping When unset, just the metricName will be used to gather metrics.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.PodsMetricSource.TargetAverageValue
member.summary: targetAverageValue is the target value of the average of the metric across all relevant pods (as a quantity)

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.PodsMetricStatus
member.summary: PodsMetricStatus indicates the current value of a metric describing each pod in the current scale target (for example, transactions-processed-per-second).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.PodsMetricStatus.CurrentAverageValue
member.summary: currentAverageValue is the current value of the average of the metric across all relevant pods (as a quantity)

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.PodsMetricStatus.MetricName
member.summary: metricName is the name of the metric in question

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.PodsMetricStatus.Selector
member.summary: selector is the string-encoded form of a standard kubernetes label selector for the given metric When set in the PodsMetricSource, it is passed as an additional parameter to the metrics server for more specific metrics scoping. When unset, just the metricName will be used to gather metrics.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricSource
member.summary: ResourceMetricSource indicates how to scale on a resource metric known to Kubernetes, as specified in requests and limits, describing each pod in the current scale target (e.g. CPU or memory). The values will be averaged together before being compared to the target. Such metrics are built in to Kubernetes, and have special scaling options on top of those available to normal per-pod metrics using the "pods" source. Only one "target" type should be set.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricSource.Name
member.summary: name is the name of the resource in question.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricSource.TargetAverageUtilization
member.summary: targetAverageUtilization is the target value of the average of the resource metric across all relevant pods, represented as a percentage of the requested value of the resource for the pods.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricSource.TargetAverageValue
member.summary: targetAverageValue is the target value of the average of the resource metric across all relevant pods, as a raw value (instead of as a percentage of the request), similar to the "pods" metric source type.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricStatus
member.summary: ResourceMetricStatus indicates the current value of a resource metric known to Kubernetes, as specified in requests and limits, describing each pod in the current scale target (e.g. CPU or memory). Such metrics are built in to Kubernetes, and have special scaling options on top of those available to normal per-pod metrics using the "pods" source.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricStatus.CurrentAverageUtilization
member.summary: currentAverageUtilization is the current value of the average of the resource metric across all relevant pods, represented as a percentage of the requested value of the resource for the pods. It will only be present if `targetAverageValue` was set in the corresponding metric specification.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricStatus.CurrentAverageValue
member.summary: currentAverageValue is the current value of the average of the resource metric across all relevant pods, as a raw value (instead of as a percentage of the request), similar to the "pods" metric source type. It will always be set, regardless of the corresponding metric specification.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta1.ResourceMetricStatus.Name
member.summary: name is the name of the resource in question.

member.summary: currentMetrics is the last read state of the metrics used by this autoscaler.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.CurrentReplicas
member.summary: currentReplicas is current number of replicas of pods managed by this autoscaler, as last seen by the autoscaler.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.DesiredReplicas
member.summary: desiredReplicas is the desired number of replicas of pods managed by this autoscaler, as last calculated by the autoscaler.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.LastScaleTime
member.summary: lastScaleTime is the last time the HorizontalPodAutoscaler scaled the number of pods, used by the autoscaler to control how often the number of pods is changed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.HorizontalPodAutoscalerStatus.ObservedGeneration
member.summary: observedGeneration is the most recent generation observed by this autoscaler.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricIdentifier
member.summary: MetricIdentifier defines the name and optionally selector for a metric

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricIdentifier.Name
member.summary: name is the name of the given metric

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricIdentifier.Selector
member.summary: selector is the string-encoded form of a standard kubernetes label selector for the given metric When set, it is passed as an additional parameter to the metrics server for more specific metrics scoping. When unset, just the metricName will be used to gather metrics.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricSpec
member.summary: MetricSpec specifies how to scale based on a single metric (only `type` and one other matching field should be set at once).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricSpec.External
member.summary: external refers to a global metric that is not associated with any Kubernetes object. It allows autoscaling based on information coming from components running outside of cluster (for example length of queue in cloud messaging service, or QPS from loadbalancer running outside of cluster).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricSpec.Object
member.summary: object refers to a metric describing a single kubernetes object (for example, hits-per-second on an Ingress object).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricSpec.Pods
member.summary: pods refers to a metric describing each pod in the current scale target (for example, transactions-processed-per-second). The values will be averaged together before being compared to the target value.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricSpec.Resource
member.summary: resource refers to a resource metric (such as those specified in requests and limits) known to Kubernetes describing each pod in the current scale target (e.g. CPU or memory). Such metrics are built in to Kubernetes, and have special scaling options on top of those available to normal per-pod metrics using the "pods" source.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricSpec.Type
member.summary: type is the type of metric source. It should be one of "Object", "Pods" or "Resource", each mapping to a matching field in the object.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricStatus
member.summary: MetricStatus describes the last-read state of a single metric.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricStatus.External
member.summary: external refers to a global metric that is not associated with any Kubernetes object. It allows autoscaling based on information coming from components running outside of cluster (for example length of queue in cloud messaging service, or QPS from loadbalancer running outside of cluster).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricStatus.Object
member.summary: object refers to a metric describing a single kubernetes object (for example, hits-per-second on an Ingress object).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricStatus.Pods
member.summary: pods refers to a metric describing each pod in the current scale target (for example, transactions-processed-per-second). The values will be averaged together before being compared to the target value.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricStatus.Resource
member.summary: resource refers to a resource metric (such as those specified in requests and limits) known to Kubernetes describing each pod in the current scale target (e.g. CPU or memory). member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricStatus.Type
member.summary: type is the type of metric source. It will be one of "Object", "Pods" or "Resource", each corresponds to a matching field in the object.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricTarget
member.summary: MetricTarget defines the target value, average value, or average utilization of a specific metric

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricTarget.AverageUtilization
member.summary: averageUtilization is the target value of the average of the resource metric across all relevant pods, represented as a percentage of the requested value of the resource for the pods. Currently only valid for Resource metric source type

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricTarget.AverageValue
member.summary: averageValue is the target value of the average of the metric across all relevant pods (as a quantity)

member.summary: type represents whether the metric type is Utilization, Value, or AverageValue

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricTarget.Value
member.summary: value is the target value of the metric (as a quantity).

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricValueStatus
member.summary: MetricValueStatus holds the current value for a metric

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricValueStatus.AverageUtilization
member.summary: currentAverageUtilization is the current value of the average of the resource metric across all relevant pods, represented as a percentage of the requested value of the resource for the pods.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricValueStatus.AverageValue
member.summary: averageValue is the current value of the average of the metric across all relevant pods (as a quantity)

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Autoscaling.V2Beta2.MetricValueStatus.Value
member.summary: value is the current value of the metric (as a quantity).

member.summary: JobCondition describes current state of a job.

member.summary: Last time the condition was checked.

member.summary: Last time the condition transit from one status to another.

member.summary: Human readable message indicating details about last transition.

member.summary: (brief) reason for the condition's last transition.

member.summary: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

member.summary: Type of job condition, Complete or Failed.

member.summary: JobList is a collection of jobs.

member.summary: items is the list of Jobs.

member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec
member.summary: JobSpec describes how the job execution will look like.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.ActiveDeadlineSeconds
member.summary: Specifies the duration in seconds relative to the startTime that the job may be active before the system tries to terminate it; value must be positive integer

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.BackoffLimit
member.summary: Specifies the number of retries before marking this job failed. Defaults to 6

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.Completions
member.summary: Specifies the desired number of successfully finished pods the job should be run with. Setting to nil means that the success of any pod signals the success of all pods, and allows parallelism to have any positive value. Setting to 1 means that parallelism is limited to 1 and the success of that pod signals the success of the job. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.ManualSelector
member.summary: manualSelector controls generation of pod labels and pod selectors. Leave `manualSelector` unset unless you are certain what you are doing. When false or unset, the system pick labels unique to this job and appends those labels to the pod template. When true, the user is responsible for picking unique labels and specifying the selector. Failure to pick a unique label may cause this and other jobs to not function correctly. However, You may see `manualSelector=true` in jobs that were created with the old `extensions/v1beta1` API. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/#specifying-your-own-pod-selector

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.Parallelism
member.summary: Specifies the maximum desired number of pods the job should run at any given time. The actual number of pods running in steady state will be less than this number when ((.spec.completions - .status.successful) < .spec.parallelism), i.e. when the work left to do is less than max parallelism. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.Selector
member.summary: A label query over pods that should match the pod count. Normally, the system sets this field for you. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.Template
member.summary: Describes the pod that will be created when executing a job. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobSpec.TtlSecondsAfterFinished
member.summary: ttlSecondsAfterFinished limits the lifetime of a Job that has finished execution (either Complete or Failed). If this field is set, ttlSecondsAfterFinished after the Job finishes, it is eligible to be automatically deleted. When the Job is being deleted, its lifecycle guarantees (e.g. finalizers) will be honored. If this field is unset, the Job won't be automatically deleted. If this field is set to zero, the Job becomes eligible to be deleted immediately after it finishes. This field is alpha-level and is only honored by servers that enable the TTLAfterFinished feature.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobStatus
member.summary: JobStatus represents the current state of a Job.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobStatus.Active
member.summary: The number of actively running pods.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobStatus.CompletionTime
member.summary: Represents time when the job was completed. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobStatus.Conditions
member.summary: The latest available observations of an object's current state. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobStatus.Failed
member.summary: The number of pods which reached phase Failed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobStatus.StartTime
member.summary: Represents time when the job was acknowledged by the job controller. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1.JobStatus.Succeeded
member.summary: The number of pods which reached phase Succeeded.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1Beta1.CronJobSpec
member.summary: CronJobSpec describes how the job execution will look like and when it will actually run.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1Beta1.CronJobSpec.ConcurrencyPolicy
member.summary: Specifies how to treat concurrent executions of a Job. Valid values are: - "Allow" (default): allows CronJobs to run concurrently; - "Forbid": forbids concurrent runs, skipping next run if previous run hasn't finished yet; - "Replace": cancels currently running job and replaces it with a new one

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1Beta1.CronJobSpec.FailedJobsHistoryLimit
member.summary: The number of failed finished jobs to retain. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 1.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1Beta1.CronJobSpec.JobTemplate
member.summary: Specifies the job that will be created when executing a CronJob.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1Beta1.CronJobSpec.Schedule
member.summary: The schedule in Cron format, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1Beta1.CronJobSpec.StartingDeadlineSeconds
member.summary: Optional deadline in seconds for starting the job if it misses scheduled time for any reason. Missed jobs executions will be counted as failed ones.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1Beta1.CronJobSpec.SuccessfulJobsHistoryLimit
member.summary: The number of successful finished jobs to retain. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 3.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Batch.V1Beta1.CronJobSpec.Suspend
member.summary: This flag tells the controller to suspend subsequent executions, it does not apply to already started executions. Defaults to false.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.AWSElasticBlockStoreVolumeSource
member.summary:
Represents a Persistent Disk resource in AWS.
An AWS EBS disk must exist before mounting to a container. The disk must also be in the same AWS zone as the kubelet. An AWS EBS disk can only be mounted as read/write once. AWS EBS volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.AWSElasticBlockStoreVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.AWSElasticBlockStoreVolumeSource.Partition
member.summary: The partition in the volume that you want to mount. If omitted, the default is to mount by volume name. Examples: For volume /dev/sda1, you specify the partition as "1". Similarly, the volume partition for /dev/sda is "0" (or you can leave the property empty).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.AWSElasticBlockStoreVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Specify "true" to force and set the ReadOnly property in VolumeMounts to "true". If omitted, the default is "false". More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.AWSElasticBlockStoreVolumeSource.VolumeID
member.summary: Unique ID of the persistent disk resource in AWS (Amazon EBS volume). More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Affinity

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Affinity.PodAntiAffinity
member.summary: Describes pod anti-affinity scheduling rules (e.g. avoid putting this pod in the same node, zone, etc. as some other pod(s)).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.AzureDiskVolumeSource.ReadOnly
