member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents storage that is managed by an external CSI volume driver (Beta feature)

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.ControllerExpandSecretRef
member.summary: ControllerExpandSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI ControllerExpandVolume call. This is an alpha field and requires enabling ExpandCSIVolumes feature gate. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.ControllerPublishSecretRef
member.summary: ControllerPublishSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI ControllerPublishVolume and ControllerUnpublishVolume calls. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.Driver
member.summary: Driver is the name of the driver to use for this volume. Required.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs".

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.NodePublishSecretRef
member.summary: NodePublishSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI NodePublishVolume and NodeUnpublishVolume calls. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.NodeStageSecretRef
member.summary: NodeStageSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI NodeStageVolume and NodeStageVolume and NodeUnstageVolume calls. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Optional: The value to pass to ControllerPublishVolumeRequest. Defaults to false (read/write).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.VolumeAttributes
member.summary: Attributes of the volume to publish.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIPersistentVolumeSource.VolumeHandle
member.summary: VolumeHandle is the unique volume name returned by the CSI volume plugins CreateVolume to refer to the volume on all subsequent calls. Required.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a source location of a volume to mount, managed by an external CSI driver

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIVolumeSource.Driver
member.summary: Driver is the name of the CSI driver that handles this volume. Consult with your admin for the correct name as registered in the cluster.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". If not provided, the empty value is passed to the associated CSI driver which will determine the default filesystem to apply.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIVolumeSource.NodePublishSecretRef
member.summary: NodePublishSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI NodePublishVolume and NodeUnpublishVolume calls. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secret references are passed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Specifies a read-only configuration for the volume. Defaults to false (read/write).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CSIVolumeSource.VolumeAttributes
member.summary: VolumeAttributes stores driver-specific properties that are passed to the CSI driver. Consult your driver's documentation for supported values.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Capabilities
member.summary: Adds and removes POSIX capabilities from running containers.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Capabilities.Add
member.summary: Added capabilities

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Capabilities.Drop
member.summary: Removed capabilities

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CephFSPersistentVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a Ceph Filesystem mount that lasts the lifetime of a pod Cephfs volumes do not support ownership management or SELinux relabeling.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CephFSPersistentVolumeSource.Monitors
member.summary: Required: Monitors is a collection of Ceph monitors More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CephFSPersistentVolumeSource.Path
member.summary: Optional: Used as the mounted root, rather than the full Ceph tree, default is /

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CephFSPersistentVolumeSource.ReadOnly

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CephFSPersistentVolumeSource.SecretFile

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CephFSPersistentVolumeSource.SecretRef

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CephFSPersistentVolumeSource.User

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CinderPersistentVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a cinder volume resource in Openstack. A Cinder volume must exist before mounting to a container. The volume must also be in the same region as the kubelet. Cinder volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CinderPersistentVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/mysql-cinder-pd/README.md

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CinderPersistentVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Optional: Defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/mysql-cinder-pd/README.md

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CinderPersistentVolumeSource.SecretRef
member.summary: Optional: points to a secret object containing parameters used to connect to OpenStack.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.CinderPersistentVolumeSource.VolumeID
member.summary: volume id used to identify the volume in cinder. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/mysql-cinder-pd/README.md

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMap
member.summary: ConfigMap holds configuration data for pods to consume.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMap.BinaryData
member.summary: BinaryData contains the binary data. Each key must consist of alphanumeric characters, '-', '_' or '.'. BinaryData can contain byte sequences that are not in the UTF-8 range. The keys stored in BinaryData must not overlap with the ones in the Data field, this is enforced during validation process. Using this field will require 1.10+ apiserver and kubelet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMap.Data
member.summary: Data contains the configuration data. Each key must consist of alphanumeric characters, '-', '_' or '.'. Values with non-UTF-8 byte sequences must use the BinaryData field. The keys stored in Data must not overlap with the keys in the BinaryData field, this is enforced during validation process.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMap.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapEnvSource
member.summary:
ConfigMapEnvSource selects a ConfigMap to populate the environment variables with.
The contents of the target ConfigMap's Data field will represent the key-value pairs as environment variables.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapEnvSource.Name
member.summary: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapEnvSource.Optional

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapKeySelector.Optional

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapNodeConfigSource
member.summary: ConfigMapNodeConfigSource contains the information to reference a ConfigMap as a config source for the Node.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapNodeConfigSource.KubeletConfigKey
member.summary: KubeletConfigKey declares which key of the referenced ConfigMap corresponds to the KubeletConfiguration structure This field is required in all cases.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapNodeConfigSource.Name
member.summary: Name is the metadata.name of the referenced ConfigMap. This field is required in all cases.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapNodeConfigSource.Namespace
member.summary: Namespace is the metadata.namespace of the referenced ConfigMap. This field is required in all cases.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapNodeConfigSource.ResourceVersion
member.summary: ResourceVersion is the metadata.ResourceVersion of the referenced ConfigMap. This field is forbidden in Node.Spec, and required in Node.Status.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapNodeConfigSource.Uid
member.summary: UID is the metadata.UID of the referenced ConfigMap. This field is forbidden in Node.Spec, and required in Node.Status.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapProjection
member.summary:
Adapts a ConfigMap into a projected volume.
The contents of the target ConfigMap's Data field will be presented in a projected volume as files using the keys in the Data field as the file names, unless the items element is populated with specific mappings of keys to paths. Note that this is identical to a configmap volume source without the default mode.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapProjection.Items
member.summary: If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced ConfigMap will be projected into the volume as a file whose name is the key and content is the value. If specified, the listed keys will be projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys will not be present. If a key is specified which is not present in the ConfigMap, the volume setup will error unless it is marked optional. Paths must be relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapProjection.Name
member.summary: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapProjection.Optional
member.summary: Specify whether the ConfigMap or its keys must be defined

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapVolumeSource
member.summary:
Adapts a ConfigMap into a volume.
The contents of the target ConfigMap's Data field will be presented in a volume as files using the keys in the Data field as the file names, unless the items element is populated with specific mappings of keys to paths. ConfigMap volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapVolumeSource.DefaultMode
member.summary: Optional: mode bits to use on created files by default. Must be a value between 0 and 0777. Defaults to 0644. Directories within the path are not affected by this setting. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapVolumeSource.Items
member.summary: If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced ConfigMap will be projected into the volume as a file whose name is the key and content is the value. If specified, the listed keys will be projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys will not be present. If a key is specified which is not present in the ConfigMap, the volume setup will error unless it is marked optional. Paths must be relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapVolumeSource.Name
member.summary: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ConfigMapVolumeSource.Optional
member.summary: Specify whether the ConfigMap or its keys must be defined

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container
member.summary: A single application container that you want to run within a pod.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.Args
member.summary: Arguments to the entrypoint. The docker image's CMD is used if this is not provided. Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container's environment. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/define-command-argument-container/#running-a-command-in-a-shell

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.Command
member.summary: Entrypoint array. Not executed within a shell. The docker image's ENTRYPOINT is used if this is not provided. Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container's environment. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/define-command-argument-container/#running-a-command-in-a-shell

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.Env
member.summary: List of environment variables to set in the container. Cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.EnvFrom
member.summary: List of sources to populate environment variables in the container. The keys defined within a source must be a C_IDENTIFIER. All invalid keys will be reported as an event when the container is starting. When a key exists in multiple sources, the value associated with the last source will take precedence. Values defined by an Env with a duplicate key will take precedence. Cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.Image
member.summary: Docker image name. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images This field is optional to allow higher level config management to default or override container images in workload controllers like Deployments and StatefulSets.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.ImagePullPolicy
member.summary: Image pull policy. One of Always, Never, IfNotPresent. Defaults to Always if :latest tag is specified, or IfNotPresent otherwise. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#updating-images

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.Lifecycle
member.summary: Actions that the management system should take in response to container lifecycle events. Cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.LivenessProbe
member.summary: Periodic probe of container liveness. Container will be restarted if the probe fails. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.Name
member.summary: Name of the container specified as a DNS_LABEL. Each container in a pod must have a unique name (DNS_LABEL). Cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.Ports
member.summary: List of ports to expose from the container. Exposing a port here gives the system additional information about the network connections a container uses, but is primarily informational. Not specifying a port here DOES NOT prevent that port from being exposed. Any port which is listening on the default "0.0.0.0" address inside a container will be accessible from the network. Cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.ReadinessProbe
member.summary: Periodic probe of container service readiness. Container will be removed from service endpoints if the probe fails. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.Resources
member.summary: Compute Resources required by this container. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-compute-resources-container/

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.SecurityContext
member.summary: Security options the pod should run with. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/policy/security-context/ More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.StartupProbe
member.summary: StartupProbe indicates that the Pod has successfully initialized. If specified, no other probes are executed until this completes successfully. If this probe fails, the Pod will be restarted, just as if the livenessProbe failed. This can be used to provide different probe parameters at the beginning of a Pod's lifecycle, when it might take a long time to load data or warm a cache, than during steady-state operation. This cannot be updated. This is an alpha feature enabled by the StartupProbe feature flag. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.Stdin
member.summary: Whether this container should allocate a buffer for stdin in the container runtime. If this is not set, reads from stdin in the container will always result in EOF. Default is false.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.StdinOnce
member.summary: Whether the container runtime should close the stdin channel after it has been opened by a single attach. When stdin is true the stdin stream will remain open across multiple attach sessions. If stdinOnce is set to true, stdin is opened on container start, is empty until the first client attaches to stdin, and then remains open and accepts data until the client disconnects, at which time stdin is closed and remains closed until the container is restarted. If this flag is false, a container processes that reads from stdin will never receive an EOF. Default is false

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.TerminationMessagePath
member.summary: Optional: Path at which the file to which the container's termination message will be written is mounted into the container's filesystem. Message written is intended to be brief final status, such as an assertion failure message. Will be truncated by the node if greater than 4096 bytes. The total message length across all containers will be limited to 12kb. Defaults to /dev/termination-log. Cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.TerminationMessagePolicy
member.summary: Indicate how the termination message should be populated. File will use the contents of terminationMessagePath to populate the container status message on both success and failure. FallbackToLogsOnError will use the last chunk of container log output if the termination message file is empty and the container exited with an error. The log output is limited to 2048 bytes or 80 lines, whichever is smaller. Defaults to File. Cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.Tty
member.summary: Whether this container should allocate a TTY for itself, also requires 'stdin' to be true. Default is false.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.VolumeDevices
member.summary: volumeDevices is the list of block devices to be used by the container. This is a beta feature.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.VolumeMounts
member.summary: Pod volumes to mount into the container's filesystem. Cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Container.WorkingDir
member.summary: Container's working directory. If not specified, the container runtime's default will be used, which might be configured in the container image. Cannot be updated.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ContainerImage
member.summary: Describe a container image

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ContainerImage.Names
member.summary: Names by which this image is known. e.g. ["k8s.gcr.io/hyperkube:v1.0.7", "dockerhub.io/google_containers/hyperkube:v1.0.7"]

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ContainerImage.SizeBytes
member.summary: The size of the image in bytes.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ContainerPort
member.summary: ContainerPort represents a network port in a single container.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ContainerPort.ContainerPortValue
member.summary: Number of port to expose on the pod's IP address. This must be a valid port number, 0 < x < 65536.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ContainerPort.HostIP
member.summary: What host IP to bind the external port to.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ContainerPort.HostPort
member.summary: Number of port to expose on the host. If specified, this must be a valid port number, 0 < x < 65536. If HostNetwork is specified, this must match ContainerPort. Most containers do not need this.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ContainerPort.Name
member.summary: If specified, this must be an IANA_SVC_NAME and unique within the pod. Each named port in a pod must have a unique name. Name for the port that can be referred to by services.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ContainerPort.Protocol
member.summary: Protocol for port. Must be UDP, TCP, or SCTP. Defaults to "TCP".

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ContainerState

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ContainerStatus.RestartCount
member.summary: The number of times the container has been restarted, currently based on the number of dead containers that have not yet been removed. Note that this is calculated from dead containers. But those containers are subject to garbage collection. This value will get capped at 5 by GC.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ContainerStatus.Started
member.summary: Specifies whether the container has passed its startup probe. Initialized as false, becomes true after startupProbe is considered successful. Resets to false when the container is restarted, or if kubelet loses state temporarily. Is always true when no startupProbe is defined.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ContainerStatus.State

member.summary: Items is a list of DownwardAPIVolume file

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIVolumeFile.FieldRef
member.summary: Required: Selects a field of the pod: only annotations, labels, name and namespace are supported.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIVolumeFile.Mode
member.summary: Optional: mode bits to use on this file, must be a value between 0 and 0777. If not specified, the volume defaultMode will be used. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIVolumeFile.Path
member.summary: Required: Path is the relative path name of the file to be created. Must not be absolute or contain the '..' path. Must be utf-8 encoded. The first item of the relative path must not start with '..'

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIVolumeFile.ResourceFieldRef
member.summary: Selects a resource of the container: only resources limits and requests (limits.cpu, limits.memory, requests.cpu and requests.memory) are currently supported.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIVolumeSource
member.summary: DownwardAPIVolumeSource represents a volume containing downward API info. Downward API volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIVolumeSource.DefaultMode
member.summary: Optional: mode bits to use on created files by default. Must be a value between 0 and 0777. Defaults to 0644. Directories within the path are not affected by this setting. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.DownwardAPIVolumeSource.Items
member.summary: Items is a list of downward API volume file

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EmptyDirVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents an empty directory for a pod. Empty directory volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EmptyDirVolumeSource.Medium
member.summary: What type of storage medium should back this directory. The default is "" which means to use the node's default medium. Must be an empty string (default) or Memory. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#emptydir

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EmptyDirVolumeSource.SizeLimit
member.summary: Total amount of local storage required for this EmptyDir volume. The size limit is also applicable for memory medium. The maximum usage on memory medium EmptyDir would be the minimum value between the SizeLimit specified here and the sum of memory limits of all containers in a pod. The default is nil which means that the limit is undefined. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#emptydir

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointAddress
member.summary: EndpointAddress is a tuple that describes single IP address.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointAddress.Hostname
member.summary: The Hostname of this endpoint

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointAddress.Ip
member.summary: The IP of this endpoint. May not be loopback (127.0.0.0/8), link-local (169.254.0.0/16), or link-local multicast ((224.0.0.0/24). IPv6 is also accepted but not fully supported on all platforms. Also, certain kubernetes components, like kube-proxy, are not IPv6 ready.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointAddress.NodeName
member.summary: Optional: Node hosting this endpoint. This can be used to determine endpoints local to a node.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointAddress.TargetRef
member.summary: Reference to object providing the endpoint.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointPort
member.summary: EndpointPort is a tuple that describes a single port.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointPort.Name
member.summary: The name of this port. This must match the 'name' field in the corresponding ServicePort. Must be a DNS_LABEL. Optional only if one port is defined.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointPort.Port
member.summary: The port number of the endpoint.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointPort.Protocol
member.summary: The IP protocol for this port. Must be UDP, TCP, or SCTP. Default is TCP.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointSubset
member.summary: EndpointSubset is a group of addresses with a common set of ports. The expanded set of endpoints is the Cartesian product of Addresses x Ports. For example, given: { Addresses: [{"ip": "10.10.1.1"}, {"ip": "10.10.2.2"}], Ports: [{"name": "a", "port": 8675}, {"name": "b", "port": 309}] } The resulting set of endpoints can be viewed as: a: [ 10.10.1.1:8675, 10.10.2.2:8675 ], b: [ 10.10.1.1:309, 10.10.2.2:309 ]

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointSubset.Addresses
member.summary: IP addresses which offer the related ports that are marked as ready. These endpoints should be considered safe for load balancers and clients to utilize.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointSubset.NotReadyAddresses
member.summary: IP addresses which offer the related ports but are not currently marked as ready because they have not yet finished starting, have recently failed a readiness check, or have recently failed a liveness check.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointSubset.Ports
member.summary: Port numbers available on the related IP addresses.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Endpoints
F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Endpoints.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Endpoints.Subsets
member.summary: The set of all endpoints is the union of all subsets. Addresses are placed into subsets according to the IPs they share. A single address with multiple ports, some of which are ready and some of which are not (because they come from different containers) will result in the address being displayed in different subsets for the different ports. No address will appear in both Addresses and NotReadyAddresses in the same subset. Sets of addresses and ports that comprise a service.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointsList
member.summary: EndpointsList is a list of endpoints.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointsList.Items
member.summary: List of endpoints.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EndpointsList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EnvFromSource
member.summary: EnvFromSource represents the source of a set of ConfigMaps

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EnvFromSource.ConfigMapRef
member.summary: The ConfigMap to select from

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EnvFromSource.Prefix
member.summary: An optional identifier to prepend to each key in the ConfigMap. Must be a C_IDENTIFIER.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EnvFromSource.SecretRef
member.summary: The Secret to select from

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EnvVar
member.summary: EnvVar represents an environment variable present in a Container.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EnvVar.Name
member.summary: Name of the environment variable. Must be a C_IDENTIFIER.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EnvVar.Value
member.summary: Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the previous defined environment variables in the container and any service environment variables. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Defaults to "".

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EnvVar.ValueFrom
member.summary: Source for the environment variable's value. Cannot be used if value is not empty.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EnvVarSource
member.summary: EnvVarSource represents a source for the value of an EnvVar.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EnvVarSource.ConfigMapKeyRef
member.summary: Selects a key of a ConfigMap.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EnvVarSource.FieldRef
member.summary: Selects a field of the pod: supports metadata.name, metadata.namespace, metadata.labels, metadata.annotations, spec.nodeName, spec.serviceAccountName, status.hostIP, status.podIP.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EnvVarSource.ResourceFieldRef
member.summary: Selects a resource of the container: only resources limits and requests (limits.cpu, limits.memory, limits.ephemeral-storage, requests.cpu, requests.memory and requests.ephemeral-storage) are currently supported.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EnvVarSource.SecretKeyRef
member.summary: Selects a key of a secret in the pod's namespace

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer
member.summary: An EphemeralContainer is a container that may be added temporarily to an existing pod for user-initiated activities such as debugging. Ephemeral containers have no resource or scheduling guarantees, and they will not be restarted when they exit or when a pod is removed or restarted. If an ephemeral container causes a pod to exceed its resource allocation, the pod may be evicted. Ephemeral containers may not be added by directly updating the pod spec. They must be added via the pod's ephemeralcontainers subresource, and they will appear in the pod spec once added. This is an alpha feature enabled by the EphemeralContainers feature flag.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Args
member.summary: Arguments to the entrypoint. The docker image's CMD is used if this is not provided. Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container's environment. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/define-command-argument-container/#running-a-command-in-a-shell

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Command
member.summary: Entrypoint array. Not executed within a shell. The docker image's ENTRYPOINT is used if this is not provided. Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container's environment. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/define-command-argument-container/#running-a-command-in-a-shell

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Env
member.summary: List of environment variables to set in the container. Cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.EnvFrom
member.summary: List of sources to populate environment variables in the container. The keys defined within a source must be a C_IDENTIFIER. All invalid keys will be reported as an event when the container is starting. When a key exists in multiple sources, the value associated with the last source will take precedence. Values defined by an Env with a duplicate key will take precedence. Cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Image
member.summary: Docker image name. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.ImagePullPolicy
member.summary: Image pull policy. One of Always, Never, IfNotPresent. Defaults to Always if :latest tag is specified, or IfNotPresent otherwise. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#updating-images

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Lifecycle
member.summary: Lifecycle is not allowed for ephemeral containers.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.LivenessProbe
member.summary: Probes are not allowed for ephemeral containers.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Name
member.summary: Name of the ephemeral container specified as a DNS_LABEL. This name must be unique among all containers, init containers and ephemeral containers.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Ports
member.summary: Ports are not allowed for ephemeral containers.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.ReadinessProbe
member.summary: Probes are not allowed for ephemeral containers.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Resources
member.summary: Resources are not allowed for ephemeral containers. Ephemeral containers use spare resources already allocated to the pod.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.SecurityContext
member.summary: SecurityContext is not allowed for ephemeral containers.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.StartupProbe
member.summary: Probes are not allowed for ephemeral containers.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Stdin
member.summary: Whether this container should allocate a buffer for stdin in the container runtime. If this is not set, reads from stdin in the container will always result in EOF. Default is false.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.StdinOnce
member.summary: Whether the container runtime should close the stdin channel after it has been opened by a single attach. When stdin is true the stdin stream will remain open across multiple attach sessions. If stdinOnce is set to true, stdin is opened on container start, is empty until the first client attaches to stdin, and then remains open and accepts data until the client disconnects, at which time stdin is closed and remains closed until the container is restarted. If this flag is false, a container processes that reads from stdin will never receive an EOF. Default is false

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.TargetContainerName
member.summary: If set, the name of the container from PodSpec that this ephemeral container targets. The ephemeral container will be run in the namespaces (IPC, PID, etc) of this container. If not set then the ephemeral container is run in whatever namespaces are shared for the pod. Note that the container runtime must support this feature.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.TerminationMessagePath
member.summary: Optional: Path at which the file to which the container's termination message will be written is mounted into the container's filesystem. Message written is intended to be brief final status, such as an assertion failure message. Will be truncated by the node if greater than 4096 bytes. The total message length across all containers will be limited to 12kb. Defaults to /dev/termination-log. Cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.TerminationMessagePolicy
member.summary: Indicate how the termination message should be populated. File will use the contents of terminationMessagePath to populate the container status message on both success and failure. FallbackToLogsOnError will use the last chunk of container log output if the termination message file is empty and the container exited with an error. The log output is limited to 2048 bytes or 80 lines, whichever is smaller. Defaults to File. Cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.Tty
member.summary: Whether this container should allocate a TTY for itself, also requires 'stdin' to be true. Default is false.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.VolumeDevices
member.summary: volumeDevices is the list of block devices to be used by the container. This is a beta feature.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.VolumeMounts
member.summary: Pod volumes to mount into the container's filesystem. Cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.EphemeralContainer.WorkingDir
member.summary: Container's working directory. If not specified, the container runtime's default will be used, which might be configured in the container image. Cannot be updated.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Event

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Event.Count

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Event.EventTime
member.summary: Time when this Event was first observed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Event.FirstTimestamp

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Event.Message

member.summary: This should be a short, machine understandable string that gives the reason for the transition into the object's current status.

member.summary: ExecAction describes a "run in container" action.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ExecAction.Command
member.summary: Command is the command line to execute inside the container, the working directory for the command is root ('/') in the container's filesystem. The command is simply exec'd, it is not run inside a shell, so traditional shell instructions ('|', etc) won't work. To use a shell, you need to explicitly call out to that shell. Exit status of 0 is treated as live/healthy and non-zero is unhealthy.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.FCVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a Fibre Channel volume. Fibre Channel volumes can only be mounted as read/write once. Fibre Channel volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.FCVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.FCVolumeSource.Lun
member.summary: Optional: FC target lun number

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.FCVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Optional: Defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.FCVolumeSource.TargetWWNs
member.summary: Optional: FC target worldwide names (WWNs)

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.FCVolumeSource.Wwids
member.summary: Optional: FC volume world wide identifiers (wwids) Either wwids or combination of targetWWNs and lun must be set, but not both simultaneously.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.FlockerVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a Flocker volume mounted by the Flocker agent. One and only one of datasetName and datasetUUID should be set. Flocker volumes do not support ownership management or SELinux relabeling.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.FlockerVolumeSource.DatasetName
member.summary: Name of the dataset stored as metadata -> name on the dataset for Flocker should be considered as deprecated

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.FlockerVolumeSource.DatasetUUID

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GCEPersistentDiskVolumeSource
member.summary:
Represents a Persistent Disk resource in Google Compute Engine.
A GCE PD must exist before mounting to a container. The disk must also be in the same GCE project and zone as the kubelet. A GCE PD can only be mounted as read/write once or read-only many times. GCE PDs support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GCEPersistentDiskVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GCEPersistentDiskVolumeSource.Partition
member.summary: The partition in the volume that you want to mount. If omitted, the default is to mount by volume name. Examples: For volume /dev/sda1, you specify the partition as "1". Similarly, the volume partition for /dev/sda is "0" (or you can leave the property empty). More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GCEPersistentDiskVolumeSource.PdName
member.summary: Unique name of the PD resource in GCE. Used to identify the disk in GCE. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GCEPersistentDiskVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GitRepoVolumeSource
member.summary:
Represents a volume that is populated with the contents of a git repository. Git repo volumes do not support ownership management. Git repo volumes support SELinux relabeling.
DEPRECATED: GitRepo is deprecated. To provision a container with a git repo, mount an EmptyDir into an InitContainer that clones the repo using git, then mount the EmptyDir into the Pod's container.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GitRepoVolumeSource.Directory
member.summary: Target directory name. Must not contain or start with '..'. If '.' is supplied, the volume directory will be the git repository. Otherwise, if specified, the volume will contain the git repository in the subdirectory with the given name.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GitRepoVolumeSource.Repository
member.summary: Repository URL

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GitRepoVolumeSource.Revision
member.summary: Commit hash for the specified revision.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsPersistentVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a Glusterfs mount that lasts the lifetime of a pod. Glusterfs volumes do not support ownership management or SELinux relabeling.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsPersistentVolumeSource.Endpoints

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsPersistentVolumeSource.EndpointsNamespace
member.summary: EndpointsNamespace is the namespace that contains Glusterfs endpoint. If this field is empty, the EndpointNamespace defaults to the same namespace as the bound PVC. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsPersistentVolumeSource.Path
member.summary: Path is the Glusterfs volume path. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

member.summary: ReadOnly here will force the Glusterfs volume to be mounted with read-only permissions. Defaults to false. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a Glusterfs mount that lasts the lifetime of a pod. Glusterfs volumes do not support ownership management or SELinux relabeling.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsVolumeSource.Endpoints
member.summary: EndpointsName is the endpoint name that details Glusterfs topology. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsVolumeSource.Path
member.summary: Path is the Glusterfs volume path. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.GlusterfsVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: ReadOnly here will force the Glusterfs volume to be mounted with read-only permissions. Defaults to false. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.HTTPGetAction
member.summary: HTTPGetAction describes an action based on HTTP Get requests.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.HTTPGetAction.Scheme

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.KeyToPath
member.summary: Maps a string key to a path within a volume.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.KeyToPath.Key
member.summary: The key to project.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.KeyToPath.Mode
member.summary: Optional: mode bits to use on this file, must be a value between 0 and 0777. If not specified, the volume defaultMode will be used. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.KeyToPath.Path
member.summary: The relative path of the file to map the key to. May not be an absolute path. May not contain the path element '..'. May not start with the string '..'.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Lifecycle
member.summary: Lifecycle describes actions that the management system should take in response to container lifecycle events. For the PostStart and PreStop lifecycle handlers, management of the container blocks until the action is complete, unless the container process fails, in which case the handler is aborted.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Lifecycle.PostStart
member.summary: PostStart is called immediately after a container is created. If the handler fails, the container is terminated and restarted according to its restart policy. Other management of the container blocks until the hook completes. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/container-lifecycle-hooks/#container-hooks

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Lifecycle.PreStop
member.summary: PreStop is called immediately before a container is terminated due to an API request or management event such as liveness/startup probe failure, preemption, resource contention, etc. The handler is not called if the container crashes or exits. The reason for termination is passed to the handler. The Pod's termination grace period countdown begins before the PreStop hooked is executed. Regardless of the outcome of the handler, the container will eventually terminate within the Pod's termination grace period. Other management of the container blocks until the hook completes or until the termination grace period is reached. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/container-lifecycle-hooks/#container-hooks

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.LimitRange

member.summary: Default resource requirement limit value by resource name if resource limit is omitted.

member.summary: DefaultRequest is the default resource requirement request value by resource name if resource request is omitted.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.LimitRangeItem.Type

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeAddress
member.summary: NodeAddress contains information for the node's address.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeAddress.Address
member.summary: The node address.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeAddress.Type
member.summary: Node address type, one of Hostname, ExternalIP or InternalIP.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeAffinity
member.summary: Node affinity is a group of node affinity scheduling rules.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeAffinity.PreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
member.summary: The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding "weight" to the sum if the node matches the corresponding matchExpressions; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeAffinity.RequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
member.summary: If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to an update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeCondition

member.summary: Last time we got an update on a given condition.

member.summary: Last time the condition transit from one status to another.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeCondition.Message
member.summary: Human readable message indicating details about last transition.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeCondition.Reason

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeCondition.Status
member.summary: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeCondition.Type

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeConfigSource
member.summary: NodeConfigSource specifies a source of node configuration. Exactly one subfield (excluding metadata) must be non-nil.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeConfigSource.ConfigMap
member.summary: ConfigMap is a reference to a Node's ConfigMap

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeConfigStatus
member.summary: NodeConfigStatus describes the status of the config assigned by Node.Spec.ConfigSource.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeConfigStatus.Active
member.summary: Active reports the checkpointed config the node is actively using. Active will represent either the current version of the Assigned config, or the current LastKnownGood config, depending on whether attempting to use the Assigned config results in an error.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeConfigStatus.Assigned
member.summary: Assigned reports the checkpointed config the node will try to use. When Node.Spec.ConfigSource is updated, the node checkpoints the associated config payload to local disk, along with a record indicating intended config. The node refers to this record to choose its config checkpoint, and reports this record in Assigned. Assigned only updates in the status after the record has been checkpointed to disk. When the Kubelet is restarted, it tries to make the Assigned config the Active config by loading and validating the checkpointed payload identified by Assigned.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeConfigStatus.Error
member.summary: Error describes any problems reconciling the Spec.ConfigSource to the Active config. Errors may occur, for example, attempting to checkpoint Spec.ConfigSource to the local Assigned record, attempting to checkpoint the payload associated with Spec.ConfigSource, attempting to load or validate the Assigned config, etc. Errors may occur at different points while syncing config. Earlier errors (e.g. download or checkpointing errors) will not result in a rollback to LastKnownGood, and may resolve across Kubelet retries. Later errors (e.g. loading or validating a checkpointed config) will result in a rollback to LastKnownGood. In the latter case, it is usually possible to resolve the error by fixing the config assigned in Spec.ConfigSource. You can find additional information for debugging by searching the error message in the Kubelet log. Error is a human-readable description of the error state; machines can check whether or not Error is empty, but should not rely on the stability of the Error text across Kubelet versions.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeConfigStatus.LastKnownGood
member.summary: LastKnownGood reports the checkpointed config the node will fall back to when it encounters an error attempting to use the Assigned config. The Assigned config becomes the LastKnownGood config when the node determines that the Assigned config is stable and correct. This is currently implemented as a 10-minute soak period starting when the local record of Assigned config is updated. If the Assigned config is Active at the end of this period, it becomes the LastKnownGood. Note that if Spec.ConfigSource is reset to nil (use local defaults), the LastKnownGood is also immediately reset to nil, because the local default config is always assumed good. You should not make assumptions about the node's method of determining config stability and correctness, as this may change or become configurable in the future.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeDaemonEndpoints
member.summary: NodeDaemonEndpoints lists ports opened by daemons running on the Node.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeDaemonEndpoints.KubeletEndpoint
member.summary: Endpoint on which Kubelet is listening.
