member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSelector
member.summary: A node selector represents the union of the results of one or more label queries over a set of nodes; that is, it represents the OR of the selectors represented by the node selector terms.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSelector.NodeSelectorTerms
member.summary: Required. A list of node selector terms. The terms are ORed.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSelectorRequirement
member.summary: A node selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that relates the key and values.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSelectorRequirement.Key
member.summary: The label key that the selector applies to.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSelectorRequirement.Operator
member.summary: Represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists, DoesNotExist. Gt, and Lt.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSelectorRequirement.Values
member.summary: An array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. If the operator is Gt or Lt, the values array must have a single element, which will be interpreted as an integer. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSelectorTerm
member.summary: A null or empty node selector term matches no objects. The requirements of them are ANDed. The TopologySelectorTerm type implements a subset of the NodeSelectorTerm.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSelectorTerm.MatchExpressions
member.summary: A list of node selector requirements by node's labels.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSelectorTerm.MatchFields
member.summary: A list of node selector requirements by node's fields.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec
member.summary: NodeSpec describes the attributes that a node is created with.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec.ConfigSource
member.summary: If specified, the source to get node configuration from The DynamicKubeletConfig feature gate must be enabled for the Kubelet to use this field

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec.ExternalID
member.summary: Deprecated. Not all kubelets will set this field. Remove field after 1.13. see: https://issues.k8s.io/61966

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec.PodCIDR
member.summary: PodCIDR represents the pod IP range assigned to the node.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec.PodCIDRs
member.summary: podCIDRs represents the IP ranges assigned to the node for usage by Pods on that node. If this field is specified, the 0th entry must match the podCIDR field. It may contain at most 1 value for each of IPv4 and IPv6.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec.ProviderID
member.summary: ID of the node assigned by the cloud provider in the format: <ProviderName>://<ProviderSpecificNodeID>

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec.Taints
member.summary: If specified, the node's taints.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSpec.Unschedulable
member.summary: Unschedulable controls node schedulability of new pods. By default, node is schedulable. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/nodes/node/#manual-node-administration

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus
member.summary: NodeStatus is information about the current status of a node.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.Addresses
member.summary: List of addresses reachable to the node. Queried from cloud provider, if available. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/nodes/node/#addresses Note: This field is declared as mergeable, but the merge key is not sufficiently unique, which can cause data corruption when it is merged. Callers should instead use a full-replacement patch. See http://pr.k8s.io/79391 for an example.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.Allocatable
member.summary: Allocatable represents the resources of a node that are available for scheduling. Defaults to Capacity.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.Capacity
member.summary: Capacity represents the total resources of a node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#capacity

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.Conditions
member.summary: Conditions is an array of current observed node conditions. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/nodes/node/#condition

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.Config
member.summary: Status of the config assigned to the node via the dynamic Kubelet config feature.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.DaemonEndpoints
member.summary: Endpoints of daemons running on the Node.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.Images
member.summary: List of container images on this node

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.NodeInfo
member.summary: Set of ids/uuids to uniquely identify the node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/nodes/node/#info

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.Phase
member.summary: NodePhase is the recently observed lifecycle phase of the node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/nodes/node/#phase The field is never populated, and now is deprecated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.VolumesAttached
member.summary: List of volumes that are attached to the node.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeStatus.VolumesInUse
member.summary: List of attachable volumes in use (mounted) by the node.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo
member.summary: NodeSystemInfo is a set of ids/uuids to uniquely identify the node.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.Architecture
member.summary: The Architecture reported by the node

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.BootID
member.summary: Boot ID reported by the node.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.ContainerRuntimeVersion
member.summary: ContainerRuntime Version reported by the node through runtime remote API (e.g. docker://1.5.0).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.KernelVersion
member.summary: Kernel Version reported by the node from 'uname -r' (e.g. 3.16.0-0.bpo.4-amd64).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.KubeProxyVersion
member.summary: KubeProxy Version reported by the node.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.KubeletVersion
member.summary: Kubelet Version reported by the node.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.MachineID
member.summary: MachineID reported by the node. For unique machine identification in the cluster this field is preferred. Learn more from man(5) machine-id: http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man5/machine-id.5.html

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.OperatingSystem
member.summary: The Operating System reported by the node

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.OsImage
member.summary: OS Image reported by the node from /etc/os-release (e.g. Debian GNU/Linux 7 (wheezy)).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.NodeSystemInfo.SystemUUID
member.summary: SystemUUID reported by the node. For unique machine identification MachineID is preferred. This field is specific to Red Hat hosts https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-US/Red_Hat_Subscription_Management/1/html/RHSM/getting-system-uuid.html

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ObjectFieldSelector
member.summary: ObjectFieldSelector selects an APIVersioned field of an object.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ObjectFieldSelector.FieldPath
member.summary: Path of the field to select in the specified API version.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ObjectReference
member.summary: ObjectReference contains enough information to let you inspect or modify the referred object.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ObjectReference.FieldPath
member.summary: If referring to a piece of an object instead of an entire object, this string should contain a valid JSON/Go field access statement, such as desiredState.manifest.containers[2]. For example, if the object reference is to a container within a pod, this would take on a value like: "spec.containers{name}" (where "name" refers to the name of the container that triggered the event) or if no container name is specified "spec.containers[2]" (container with index 2 in this pod). This syntax is chosen only to have some well-defined way of referencing a part of an object.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ObjectReference.Name
member.summary: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ObjectReference.Namespace
member.summary: Namespace of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ObjectReference.ResourceVersion
member.summary: Specific resourceVersion to which this reference is made, if any. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ObjectReference.Uid
member.summary: UID of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#uids

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolume
member.summary: PersistentVolume (PV) is a storage resource provisioned by an administrator. It is analogous to a node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolume.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolume.Spec
member.summary: Spec defines a specification of a persistent volume owned by the cluster. Provisioned by an administrator. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#persistent-volumes

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolume.Status
member.summary: Status represents the current information/status for the persistent volume. Populated by the system. Read-only. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#persistent-volumes

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaim
member.summary: PersistentVolumeClaim is a user's request for and claim to a persistent volume

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaim.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaim.Spec
member.summary: Spec defines the desired characteristics of a volume requested by a pod author. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#persistentvolumeclaims

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaim.Status
member.summary: Status represents the current information/status of a persistent volume claim. Read-only. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#persistentvolumeclaims

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimCondition
member.summary: PersistentVolumeClaimCondition contails details about state of pvc

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimCondition.LastProbeTime
member.summary: Last time we probed the condition.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimCondition.LastTransitionTime
member.summary: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimCondition.Message
member.summary: Human-readable message indicating details about last transition.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimCondition.Reason
member.summary: Unique, this should be a short, machine understandable string that gives the reason for condition's last transition. If it reports "ResizeStarted" that means the underlying persistent volume is being resized.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimList
member.summary: PersistentVolumeClaimList is a list of PersistentVolumeClaim items.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimList.Items
member.summary: A list of persistent volume claims. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#persistentvolumeclaims

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec
member.summary: PersistentVolumeClaimSpec describes the common attributes of storage devices and allows a Source for provider-specific attributes

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec.AccessModes
member.summary: AccessModes contains the desired access modes the volume should have. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#access-modes-1

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec.DataSource
member.summary: This field requires the VolumeSnapshotDataSource alpha feature gate to be enabled and currently VolumeSnapshot is the only supported data source. If the provisioner can support VolumeSnapshot data source, it will create a new volume and data will be restored to the volume at the same time. If the provisioner does not support VolumeSnapshot data source, volume will not be created and the failure will be reported as an event. In the future, we plan to support more data source types and the behavior of the provisioner may change.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec.Resources
member.summary: Resources represents the minimum resources the volume should have. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#resources

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec.Selector
member.summary: A label query over volumes to consider for binding.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec.StorageClassName
member.summary: Name of the StorageClass required by the claim. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#class-1

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec.VolumeMode
member.summary: volumeMode defines what type of volume is required by the claim. Value of Filesystem is implied when not included in claim spec. This is a beta feature.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimSpec.VolumeName
member.summary: VolumeName is the binding reference to the PersistentVolume backing this claim.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimStatus
member.summary: PersistentVolumeClaimStatus is the current status of a persistent volume claim.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimStatus.AccessModes
member.summary: AccessModes contains the actual access modes the volume backing the PVC has. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#access-modes-1

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimStatus.Capacity
member.summary: Represents the actual resources of the underlying volume.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimStatus.Conditions
member.summary: Current Condition of persistent volume claim. If underlying persistent volume is being resized then the Condition will be set to 'ResizeStarted'.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimStatus.Phase
member.summary: Phase represents the current phase of PersistentVolumeClaim.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimVolumeSource
member.summary: PersistentVolumeClaimVolumeSource references the user's PVC in the same namespace. This volume finds the bound PV and mounts that volume for the pod. A PersistentVolumeClaimVolumeSource is, essentially, a wrapper around another type of volume that is owned by someone else (the system).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimVolumeSource.ClaimName
member.summary: ClaimName is the name of a PersistentVolumeClaim in the same namespace as the pod using this volume. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#persistentvolumeclaims

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeClaimVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. Default false.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeList
member.summary: PersistentVolumeList is a list of PersistentVolume items.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeList.Items
member.summary: List of persistent volumes. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec
member.summary: PersistentVolumeSpec is the specification of a persistent volume.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.AccessModes
member.summary: AccessModes contains all ways the volume can be mounted. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#access-modes

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.AwsElasticBlockStore
member.summary: AWSElasticBlockStore represents an AWS Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.AzureDisk
member.summary: AzureDisk represents an Azure Data Disk mount on the host and bind mount to the pod.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.AzureFile
member.summary: AzureFile represents an Azure File Service mount on the host and bind mount to the pod.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Capacity
member.summary: A description of the persistent volume's resources and capacity. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#capacity

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Cephfs
member.summary: CephFS represents a Ceph FS mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Cinder
member.summary: Cinder represents a cinder volume attached and mounted on kubelets host machine. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/mysql-cinder-pd/README.md

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.ClaimRef
member.summary: ClaimRef is part of a bi-directional binding between PersistentVolume and PersistentVolumeClaim. Expected to be non-nil when bound. claim.VolumeName is the authoritative bind between PV and PVC. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#binding

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Csi
member.summary: CSI represents storage that is handled by an external CSI driver (Beta feature).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Fc
member.summary: FC represents a Fibre Channel resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.FlexVolume
member.summary: FlexVolume represents a generic volume resource that is provisioned/attached using an exec based plugin.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Flocker
member.summary: Flocker represents a Flocker volume attached to a kubelet's host machine and exposed to the pod for its usage. This depends on the Flocker control service being running

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.GcePersistentDisk
member.summary: GCEPersistentDisk represents a GCE Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. Provisioned by an admin. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Glusterfs
member.summary: Glusterfs represents a Glusterfs volume that is attached to a host and exposed to the pod. Provisioned by an admin. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/glusterfs/README.md

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.HostPath
member.summary: HostPath represents a directory on the host. Provisioned by a developer or tester. This is useful for single-node development and testing only! On-host storage is not supported in any way and WILL NOT WORK in a multi-node cluster. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#hostpath

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Iscsi
member.summary: ISCSI represents an ISCSI Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. Provisioned by an admin.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Local
member.summary: Local represents directly-attached storage with node affinity

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.MountOptions
member.summary: A list of mount options, e.g. ["ro", "soft"]. Not validated - mount will simply fail if one is invalid. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#mount-options

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Nfs
member.summary: NFS represents an NFS mount on the host. Provisioned by an admin. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#nfs

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.NodeAffinity
member.summary: NodeAffinity defines constraints that limit what nodes this volume can be accessed from. This field influences the scheduling of pods that use this volume.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.PersistentVolumeReclaimPolicy
member.summary: What happens to a persistent volume when released from its claim. Valid options are Retain (default for manually created PersistentVolumes), Delete (default for dynamically provisioned PersistentVolumes), and Recycle (deprecated). Recycle must be supported by the volume plugin underlying this PersistentVolume. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#reclaiming

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.PhotonPersistentDisk
member.summary: PhotonPersistentDisk represents a PhotonController persistent disk attached and mounted on kubelets host machine

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.PortworxVolume
member.summary: PortworxVolume represents a portworx volume attached and mounted on kubelets host machine

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Quobyte
member.summary: Quobyte represents a Quobyte mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Rbd
member.summary: RBD represents a Rados Block Device mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/rbd/README.md

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.ScaleIO
member.summary: ScaleIO represents a ScaleIO persistent volume attached and mounted on Kubernetes nodes.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.StorageClassName
member.summary: Name of StorageClass to which this persistent volume belongs. Empty value means that this volume does not belong to any StorageClass.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.Storageos
member.summary: StorageOS represents a StorageOS volume that is attached to the kubelet's host machine and mounted into the pod More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/storageos/README.md

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.VolumeMode
member.summary: volumeMode defines if a volume is intended to be used with a formatted filesystem or to remain in raw block state. Value of Filesystem is implied when not included in spec. This is a beta feature.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeSpec.VsphereVolume
member.summary: VsphereVolume represents a vSphere volume attached and mounted on kubelets host machine

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeStatus
member.summary: PersistentVolumeStatus is the current status of a persistent volume.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeStatus.Message
member.summary: A human-readable message indicating details about why the volume is in this state.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeStatus.Phase
member.summary: Phase indicates if a volume is available, bound to a claim, or released by a claim. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#phase

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PersistentVolumeStatus.Reason
member.summary: Reason is a brief CamelCase string that describes any failure and is meant for machine parsing and tidy display in the CLI.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PhotonPersistentDiskVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a Photon Controller persistent disk resource.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PhotonPersistentDiskVolumeSource.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PhotonPersistentDiskVolumeSource.PdID
member.summary: ID that identifies Photon Controller persistent disk

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Pod
member.summary: Pod is a collection of containers that can run on a host. This resource is created by clients and scheduled onto hosts.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Pod.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Pod.Spec
member.summary: Specification of the desired behavior of the pod. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#spec-and-status

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Pod.Status
member.summary: Most recently observed status of the pod. This data may not be up to date. Populated by the system. Read-only. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#spec-and-status

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodAffinity
member.summary: Pod affinity is a group of inter pod affinity scheduling rules.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodAffinity.PreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
member.summary: The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding "weight" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodAffinity.RequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
member.summary: If the affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodAffinityTerm
member.summary: Defines a set of pods (namely those matching the labelSelector relative to the given namespace(s)) that this pod should be co-located (affinity) or not co-located (anti-affinity) with, where co-located is defined as running on a node whose value of the label with key <topologyKey> matches that of any node on which a pod of the set of pods is running

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodAffinityTerm.LabelSelector
member.summary: A label query over a set of resources, in this case pods.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodAffinityTerm.Namespaces
member.summary: namespaces specifies which namespaces the labelSelector applies to (matches against); null or empty list means "this pod's namespace"

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodAffinityTerm.TopologyKey
member.summary: This pod should be co-located (affinity) or not co-located (anti-affinity) with the pods matching the labelSelector in the specified namespaces, where co-located is defined as running on a node whose value of the label with key topologyKey matches that of any node on which any of the selected pods is running. Empty topologyKey is not allowed.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodAntiAffinity
member.summary: Pod anti affinity is a group of inter pod anti affinity scheduling rules.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodAntiAffinity.PreferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
member.summary: The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the anti-affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling anti-affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding "weight" to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodAntiAffinity.RequiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution
member.summary: If the anti-affinity requirements specified by this field are not met at scheduling time, the pod will not be scheduled onto the node. If the anti-affinity requirements specified by this field cease to be met at some point during pod execution (e.g. due to a pod label update), the system may or may not try to eventually evict the pod from its node. When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodCondition
member.summary: PodCondition contains details for the current condition of this pod.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodCondition.LastProbeTime
member.summary: Last time we probed the condition.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodCondition.LastTransitionTime
member.summary: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodCondition.Message
member.summary: Human-readable message indicating details about last transition.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodCondition.Reason
member.summary: Unique, one-word, CamelCase reason for the condition's last transition.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodCondition.Status
member.summary: Status is the status of the condition. Can be True, False, Unknown. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#pod-conditions

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodCondition.Type
member.summary: Type is the type of the condition. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#pod-conditions

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodDNSConfig
member.summary: PodDNSConfig defines the DNS parameters of a pod in addition to those generated from DNSPolicy.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodDNSConfig.Nameservers
member.summary: A list of DNS name server IP addresses. This will be appended to the base nameservers generated from DNSPolicy. Duplicated nameservers will be removed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodDNSConfig.Options
member.summary: A list of DNS resolver options. This will be merged with the base options generated from DNSPolicy. Duplicated entries will be removed. Resolution options given in Options will override those that appear in the base DNSPolicy.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodDNSConfig.Searches
member.summary: A list of DNS search domains for host-name lookup. This will be appended to the base search paths generated from DNSPolicy. Duplicated search paths will be removed.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodDNSConfigOption
member.summary: PodDNSConfigOption defines DNS resolver options of a pod.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodDNSConfigOption.Name
member.summary: Required.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodIP
member.summary: IP address information for entries in the (plural) PodIPs field. Each entry includes: IP: An IP address allocated to the pod. Routable at least within the cluster.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodIP.Ip
member.summary: ip is an IP address (IPv4 or IPv6) assigned to the pod

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodList
member.summary: PodList is a list of Pods.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodList.Items
member.summary: List of pods. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodReadinessGate
member.summary: PodReadinessGate contains the reference to a pod condition

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodReadinessGate.ConditionType
member.summary: ConditionType refers to a condition in the pod's condition list with matching type.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSecurityContext
member.summary: PodSecurityContext holds pod-level security attributes and common container settings. Some fields are also present in container.securityContext. Field values of container.securityContext take precedence over field values of PodSecurityContext.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSecurityContext.FsGroup
member.summary:
A special supplemental group that applies to all containers in a pod. Some volume types allow the Kubelet to change the ownership of that volume to be owned by the pod:
1. The owning GID will be the FSGroup 2. The setgid bit is set (new files created in the volume will be owned by FSGroup) 3. The permission bits are OR'd with rw-rw----
If unset, the Kubelet will not modify the ownership and permissions of any volume.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSecurityContext.RunAsGroup
member.summary: The GID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Uses runtime default if unset. May also be set in SecurityContext. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence for that container.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSecurityContext.RunAsNonRoot
member.summary: Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user. If true, the Kubelet will validate the image at runtime to ensure that it does not run as UID 0 (root) and fail to start the container if it does. If unset or false, no such validation will be performed. May also be set in SecurityContext. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSecurityContext.RunAsUser
member.summary: The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified. May also be set in SecurityContext. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence for that container.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSecurityContext.SeLinuxOptions
member.summary: The SELinux context to be applied to all containers. If unspecified, the container runtime will allocate a random SELinux context for each container. May also be set in SecurityContext. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence for that container.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSecurityContext.SupplementalGroups
member.summary: A list of groups applied to the first process run in each container, in addition to the container's primary GID. If unspecified, no groups will be added to any container.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSecurityContext.Sysctls
member.summary: Sysctls hold a list of namespaced sysctls used for the pod. Pods with unsupported sysctls (by the container runtime) might fail to launch.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSecurityContext.WindowsOptions
member.summary: The Windows specific settings applied to all containers. If unspecified, the options within a container's SecurityContext will be used. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec
member.summary: PodSpec is a description of a pod.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.ActiveDeadlineSeconds
member.summary: Optional duration in seconds the pod may be active on the node relative to StartTime before the system will actively try to mark it failed and kill associated containers. Value must be a positive integer.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.Affinity
member.summary: If specified, the pod's scheduling constraints

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.AutomountServiceAccountToken
member.summary: AutomountServiceAccountToken indicates whether a service account token should be automatically mounted.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.Containers
member.summary: List of containers belonging to the pod. Containers cannot currently be added or removed. There must be at least one container in a Pod. Cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.DnsConfig
member.summary: Specifies the DNS parameters of a pod. Parameters specified here will be merged to the generated DNS configuration based on DNSPolicy.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.DnsPolicy
member.summary: Set DNS policy for the pod. Defaults to "ClusterFirst". Valid values are 'ClusterFirstWithHostNet', 'ClusterFirst', 'Default' or 'None'. DNS parameters given in DNSConfig will be merged with the policy selected with DNSPolicy. To have DNS options set along with hostNetwork, you have to specify DNS policy explicitly to 'ClusterFirstWithHostNet'.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.EnableServiceLinks
member.summary: EnableServiceLinks indicates whether information about services should be injected into pod's environment variables, matching the syntax of Docker links. Optional: Defaults to true.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.EphemeralContainers
member.summary: List of ephemeral containers run in this pod. Ephemeral containers may be run in an existing pod to perform user-initiated actions such as debugging. This list cannot be specified when creating a pod, and it cannot be modified by updating the pod spec. In order to add an ephemeral container to an existing pod, use the pod's ephemeralcontainers subresource. This field is alpha-level and is only honored by servers that enable the EphemeralContainers feature.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.HostAliases
member.summary: HostAliases is an optional list of hosts and IPs that will be injected into the pod's hosts file if specified. This is only valid for non-hostNetwork pods.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.HostIPC
member.summary: Use the host's ipc namespace. Optional: Default to false.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.HostNetwork
member.summary: Host networking requested for this pod. Use the host's network namespace. If this option is set, the ports that will be used must be specified. Default to false.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.HostPID
member.summary: Use the host's pid namespace. Optional: Default to false.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.Hostname
member.summary: Specifies the hostname of the Pod If not specified, the pod's hostname will be set to a system-defined value.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.ImagePullSecrets
member.summary: ImagePullSecrets is an optional list of references to secrets in the same namespace to use for pulling any of the images used by this PodSpec. If specified, these secrets will be passed to individual puller implementations for them to use. For example, in the case of docker, only DockerConfig type secrets are honored. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.InitContainers
member.summary: List of initialization containers belonging to the pod. Init containers are executed in order prior to containers being started. If any init container fails, the pod is considered to have failed and is handled according to its restartPolicy. The name for an init container or normal container must be unique among all containers. Init containers may not have Lifecycle actions, Readiness probes, Liveness probes, or Startup probes. The resourceRequirements of an init container are taken into account during scheduling by finding the highest request/limit for each resource type, and then using the max of of that value or the sum of the normal containers. Limits are applied to init containers in a similar fashion. Init containers cannot currently be added or removed. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/init-containers/

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.NodeName
member.summary: NodeName is a request to schedule this pod onto a specific node. If it is non-empty, the scheduler simply schedules this pod onto that node, assuming that it fits resource requirements.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.NodeSelector
member.summary: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the pod to fit on a node. Selector which must match a node's labels for the pod to be scheduled on that node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/assign-pod-node/

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.Overhead
member.summary: Overhead represents the resource overhead associated with running a pod for a given RuntimeClass. This field will be autopopulated at admission time by the RuntimeClass admission controller. If the RuntimeClass admission controller is enabled, overhead must not be set in Pod create requests. The RuntimeClass admission controller will reject Pod create requests which have the overhead already set. If RuntimeClass is configured and selected in the PodSpec, Overhead will be set to the value defined in the corresponding RuntimeClass, otherwise it will remain unset and treated as zero. More info: https://git.k8s.io/enhancements/keps/sig-node/20190226-pod-overhead.md This field is alpha-level as of Kubernetes v1.16, and is only honored by servers that enable the PodOverhead feature.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.PreemptionPolicy
member.summary: PreemptionPolicy is the Policy for preempting pods with lower priority. One of Never, PreemptLowerPriority. Defaults to PreemptLowerPriority if unset. This field is alpha-level and is only honored by servers that enable the NonPreemptingPriority feature.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.Priority
member.summary: The priority value. Various system components use this field to find the priority of the pod. When Priority Admission Controller is enabled, it prevents users from setting this field. The admission controller populates this field from PriorityClassName. The higher the value, the higher the priority.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.PriorityClassName
member.summary: If specified, indicates the pod's priority. "system-node-critical" and "system-cluster-critical" are two special keywords which indicate the highest priorities with the former being the highest priority. Any other name must be defined by creating a PriorityClass object with that name. If not specified, the pod priority will be default or zero if there is no default.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.ReadinessGates
member.summary: If specified, all readiness gates will be evaluated for pod readiness. A pod is ready when all its containers are ready AND all conditions specified in the readiness gates have status equal to "True" More info: https://git.k8s.io/enhancements/keps/sig-network/0007-pod-ready%2B%2B.md

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.RestartPolicy
member.summary: Restart policy for all containers within the pod. One of Always, OnFailure, Never. Default to Always. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle/#restart-policy

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.RuntimeClassName
member.summary: RuntimeClassName refers to a RuntimeClass object in the node.k8s.io group, which should be used to run this pod. If no RuntimeClass resource matches the named class, the pod will not be run. If unset or empty, the "legacy" RuntimeClass will be used, which is an implicit class with an empty definition that uses the default runtime handler. More info: https://git.k8s.io/enhancements/keps/sig-node/runtime-class.md This is a beta feature as of Kubernetes v1.14.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.SchedulerName
member.summary: If specified, the pod will be dispatched by specified scheduler. If not specified, the pod will be dispatched by default scheduler.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.SecurityContext
member.summary: SecurityContext holds pod-level security attributes and common container settings. Optional: Defaults to empty. See type description for default values of each field.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.ServiceAccount
member.summary: DeprecatedServiceAccount is a depreciated alias for ServiceAccountName. Deprecated: Use serviceAccountName instead.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.ServiceAccountName
member.summary: ServiceAccountName is the name of the ServiceAccount to use to run this pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-service-account/

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.ShareProcessNamespace
member.summary: Share a single process namespace between all of the containers in a pod. When this is set containers will be able to view and signal processes from other containers in the same pod, and the first process in each container will not be assigned PID 1. HostPID and ShareProcessNamespace cannot both be set. Optional: Default to false. This field is beta-level and may be disabled with the PodShareProcessNamespace feature.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.Subdomain
member.summary: If specified, the fully qualified Pod hostname will be "<hostname>.<subdomain>.<pod namespace>.svc.<cluster domain>". If not specified, the pod will not have a domainname at all.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.TerminationGracePeriodSeconds
member.summary: Optional duration in seconds the pod needs to terminate gracefully. May be decreased in delete request. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates delete immediately. If this value is nil, the default grace period will be used instead. The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. Defaults to 30 seconds.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.Tolerations
member.summary: If specified, the pod's tolerations.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.TopologySpreadConstraints
member.summary: TopologySpreadConstraints describes how a group of pods ought to spread across topology domains. Scheduler will schedule pods in a way which abides by the constraints. This field is alpha-level and is only honored by clusters that enables the EvenPodsSpread feature. All topologySpreadConstraints are ANDed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodSpec.Volumes
member.summary: List of volumes that can be mounted by containers belonging to the pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodStatus
member.summary: PodStatus represents information about the status of a pod. Status may trail the actual state of a system, especially if the node that hosts the pod cannot contact the control plane.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodStatus.Conditions
member.summary: Current service state of pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#pod-conditions

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodStatus.ContainerStatuses
member.summary: The list has one entry per container in the manifest. Each entry is currently the output of `docker inspect`. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#pod-and-container-status

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodStatus.EphemeralContainerStatuses
member.summary: Status for any ephemeral containers that have run in this pod. This field is alpha-level and is only populated by servers that enable the EphemeralContainers feature.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodStatus.HostIP
member.summary: IP address of the host to which the pod is assigned. Empty if not yet scheduled.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodStatus.InitContainerStatuses
member.summary: The list has one entry per init container in the manifest. The most recent successful init container will have ready = true, the most recently started container will have startTime set. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#pod-and-container-status

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodStatus.Message
member.summary: A human readable message indicating details about why the pod is in this condition.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodStatus.NominatedNodeName
member.summary: nominatedNodeName is set only when this pod preempts other pods on the node, but it cannot be scheduled right away as preemption victims receive their graceful termination periods. This field does not guarantee that the pod will be scheduled on this node. Scheduler may decide to place the pod elsewhere if other nodes become available sooner. Scheduler may also decide to give the resources on this node to a higher priority pod that is created after preemption. As a result, this field may be different than PodSpec.nodeName when the pod is scheduled.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodStatus.Phase
member.summary:
The phase of a Pod is a simple, high-level summary of where the Pod is in its lifecycle. The conditions array, the reason and message fields, and the individual container status arrays contain more detail about the pod's status. There are five possible phase values:
Pending: The pod has been accepted by the Kubernetes system, but one or more of the container images has not been created. This includes time before being scheduled as well as time spent downloading images over the network, which could take a while. Running: The pod has been bound to a node, and all of the containers have been created. At least one container is still running, or is in the process of starting or restarting. Succeeded: All containers in the pod have terminated in success, and will not be restarted. Failed: All containers in the pod have terminated, and at least one container has terminated in failure. The container either exited with non-zero status or was terminated by the system. Unknown: For some reason the state of the pod could not be obtained, typically due to an error in communicating with the host of the pod.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#pod-phase

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodStatus.PodIP
member.summary: IP address allocated to the pod. Routable at least within the cluster. Empty if not yet allocated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodStatus.PodIPs
member.summary: podIPs holds the IP addresses allocated to the pod. If this field is specified, the 0th entry must match the podIP field. Pods may be allocated at most 1 value for each of IPv4 and IPv6. This list is empty if no IPs have been allocated yet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodStatus.QosClass
member.summary: The Quality of Service (QOS) classification assigned to the pod based on resource requirements See PodQOSClass type for available QOS classes More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/design-proposals/node/resource-qos.md

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PodStatus.Reason
member.summary: A brief CamelCase message indicating details about why the pod is in this state. e.g. 'Evicted'

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PreferredSchedulingTerm
member.summary: An empty preferred scheduling term matches all objects with implicit weight 0 (i.e. it's a no-op). A null preferred scheduling term matches no objects (i.e. is also a no-op).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PreferredSchedulingTerm.Preference
member.summary: A node selector term, associated with the corresponding weight.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.PreferredSchedulingTerm.Weight
member.summary: Weight associated with matching the corresponding nodeSelectorTerm, in the range 1-100.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Probe
member.summary: Probe describes a health check to be performed against a container to determine whether it is alive or ready to receive traffic.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Probe.Exec
member.summary: One and only one of the following should be specified. Exec specifies the action to take.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Probe.FailureThreshold
member.summary: Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded. Defaults to 3. Minimum value is 1.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Probe.HttpGet
member.summary: HTTPGet specifies the http request to perform.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Probe.InitialDelaySeconds
member.summary: Number of seconds after the container has started before liveness probes are initiated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Probe.PeriodSeconds
member.summary: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. Default to 10 seconds. Minimum value is 1.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Probe.SuccessThreshold
member.summary: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. Defaults to 1. Must be 1 for liveness and startup. Minimum value is 1.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Probe.TcpSocket
member.summary: TCPSocket specifies an action involving a TCP port. TCP hooks not yet supported

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.Probe.TimeoutSeconds
member.summary: Number of seconds after which the probe times out. Defaults to 1 second. Minimum value is 1. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ProjectedVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a projected volume source

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ProjectedVolumeSource.DefaultMode
member.summary: Mode bits to use on created files by default. Must be a value between 0 and 0777. Directories within the path are not affected by this setting. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ProjectedVolumeSource.Sources
member.summary: list of volume projections

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.QuobyteVolumeSource
member.summary: Represents a Quobyte mount that lasts the lifetime of a pod. Quobyte volumes do not support ownership management or SELinux relabeling.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.QuobyteVolumeSource.Group
member.summary: Group to map volume access to Default is no group

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.QuobyteVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: ReadOnly here will force the Quobyte volume to be mounted with read-only permissions. Defaults to false.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.QuobyteVolumeSource.Registry
member.summary: Registry represents a single or multiple Quobyte Registry services specified as a string as host:port pair (multiple entries are separated with commas) which acts as the central registry for volumes

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.QuobyteVolumeSource.Tenant
member.summary: Tenant owning the given Quobyte volume in the Backend Used with dynamically provisioned Quobyte volumes, value is set by the plugin

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.QuobyteVolumeSource.User
member.summary: User to map volume access to Defaults to serivceaccount user

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.QuobyteVolumeSource.Volume
member.summary: Volume is a string that references an already created Quobyte volume by name.

member.summary: Filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#rbd

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.RBDPersistentVolumeSource.Image

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.RBDPersistentVolumeSource.Monitors

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.RBDPersistentVolumeSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false. More info: https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/rbd/README.md#how-to-use-it

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.RBDPersistentVolumeSource.User

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationController
member.summary: ReplicationController represents the configuration of a replication controller.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationController.Metadata
member.summary: If the Labels of a ReplicationController are empty, they are defaulted to be the same as the Pod(s) that the replication controller manages. Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationController.Spec
member.summary: Spec defines the specification of the desired behavior of the replication controller. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#spec-and-status

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationController.Status
member.summary: Status is the most recently observed status of the replication controller. This data may be out of date by some window of time. Populated by the system. Read-only. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#spec-and-status

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerCondition
member.summary: ReplicationControllerCondition describes the state of a replication controller at a certain point.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerCondition.LastTransitionTime
member.summary: The last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerCondition.Message
member.summary: A human readable message indicating details about the transition.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerCondition.Reason
member.summary: The reason for the condition's last transition.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerCondition.Status
member.summary: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerCondition.Type
member.summary: Type of replication controller condition.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerList
member.summary: ReplicationControllerList is a collection of replication controllers.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerList.Items
member.summary: List of replication controllers. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/replicationcontroller

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerSpec
member.summary: ReplicationControllerSpec is the specification of a replication controller.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerSpec.MinReadySeconds
member.summary: Minimum number of seconds for which a newly created pod should be ready without any of its container crashing, for it to be considered available. Defaults to 0 (pod will be considered available as soon as it is ready)

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerSpec.Replicas
member.summary: Replicas is the number of desired replicas. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and unspecified. Defaults to 1. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/replicationcontroller#what-is-a-replicationcontroller

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerSpec.Selector
member.summary: Selector is a label query over pods that should match the Replicas count. If Selector is empty, it is defaulted to the labels present on the Pod template. Label keys and values that must match in order to be controlled by this replication controller, if empty defaulted to labels on Pod template. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerSpec.Template
member.summary: Template is the object that describes the pod that will be created if insufficient replicas are detected. This takes precedence over a TemplateRef. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/replicationcontroller#pod-template

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerStatus
member.summary: ReplicationControllerStatus represents the current status of a replication controller.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerStatus.AvailableReplicas
member.summary: The number of available replicas (ready for at least minReadySeconds) for this replication controller.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerStatus.Conditions
member.summary: Represents the latest available observations of a replication controller's current state.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerStatus.FullyLabeledReplicas
member.summary: The number of pods that have labels matching the labels of the pod template of the replication controller.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerStatus.ObservedGeneration
member.summary: ObservedGeneration reflects the generation of the most recently observed replication controller.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerStatus.ReadyReplicas
member.summary: The number of ready replicas for this replication controller.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ReplicationControllerStatus.Replicas
member.summary: Replicas is the most recently oberved number of replicas. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/replicationcontroller#what-is-a-replicationcontroller

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ScaleIOPersistentVolumeSource.System

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Core.V1.ScaleIOPersistentVolumeSource.VolumeName
