member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIGroup
member.summary: APIGroup contains the name, the supported versions, and the preferred version of a group.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIGroup.Name
member.summary: name is the name of the group.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIGroup.PreferredVersion
member.summary: preferredVersion is the version preferred by the API server, which probably is the storage version.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIGroup.ServerAddressByClientCIDRs
member.summary: a map of client CIDR to server address that is serving this group. This is to help clients reach servers in the most network-efficient way possible. Clients can use the appropriate server address as per the CIDR that they match. In case of multiple matches, clients should use the longest matching CIDR. The server returns only those CIDRs that it thinks that the client can match. For example: the master will return an internal IP CIDR only, if the client reaches the server using an internal IP. Server looks at X-Forwarded-For header or X-Real-Ip header or request.RemoteAddr (in that order) to get the client IP.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIGroup.Versions
member.summary: versions are the versions supported in this group.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIGroupList
member.summary: APIGroupList is a list of APIGroup, to allow clients to discover the API at /apis.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIGroupList.Groups
member.summary: groups is a list of APIGroup.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIResource
member.summary: APIResource specifies the name of a resource and whether it is namespaced.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIResource.Categories
member.summary: categories is a list of the grouped resources this resource belongs to (e.g. 'all')

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIResource.Group
member.summary: group is the preferred group of the resource. Empty implies the group of the containing resource list. For subresources, this may have a different value, for example: Scale".

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIResource.Name
member.summary: name is the plural name of the resource.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIResource.Namespaced
member.summary: namespaced indicates if a resource is namespaced or not.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIResource.ShortNames
member.summary: shortNames is a list of suggested short names of the resource.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIResource.SingularName
member.summary: singularName is the singular name of the resource. This allows clients to handle plural and singular opaquely. The singularName is more correct for reporting status on a single item and both singular and plural are allowed from the kubectl CLI interface.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIResource.StorageVersionHash
member.summary: The hash value of the storage version, the version this resource is converted to when written to the data store. Value must be treated as opaque by clients. Only equality comparison on the value is valid. This is an alpha feature and may change or be removed in the future. The field is populated by the apiserver only if the StorageVersionHash feature gate is enabled. This field will remain optional even if it graduates.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIResource.Verbs
member.summary: verbs is a list of supported kube verbs (this includes get, list, watch, create, update, patch, delete, deletecollection, and proxy)

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIResource.Version
member.summary: version is the preferred version of the resource. Empty implies the version of the containing resource list For subresources, this may have a different value, for example: v1 (while inside a v1beta1 version of the core resource's group)".

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIResourceList
member.summary: APIResourceList is a list of APIResource, it is used to expose the name of the resources supported in a specific group and version, and if the resource is namespaced.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIResourceList.GroupVersion
member.summary: groupVersion is the group and version this APIResourceList is for.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIResourceList.Resources
member.summary: resources contains the name of the resources and if they are namespaced.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIVersions
member.summary: APIVersions lists the versions that are available, to allow clients to discover the API at /api, which is the root path of the legacy v1 API.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIVersions.ServerAddressByClientCIDRs
member.summary: a map of client CIDR to server address that is serving this group. This is to help clients reach servers in the most network-efficient way possible. Clients can use the appropriate server address as per the CIDR that they match. In case of multiple matches, clients should use the longest matching CIDR. The server returns only those CIDRs that it thinks that the client can match. For example: the master will return an internal IP CIDR only, if the client reaches the server using an internal IP. Server looks at X-Forwarded-For header or X-Real-Ip header or request.RemoteAddr (in that order) to get the client IP.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.APIVersions.Versions
member.summary: versions are the api versions that are available.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.DeleteOptions
member.summary: DeleteOptions may be provided when deleting an API object.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.DeleteOptions.DryRun
member.summary: When present, indicates that modifications should not be persisted. An invalid or unrecognized dryRun directive will result in an error response and no further processing of the request. Valid values are: - All: all dry run stages will be processed

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.DeleteOptions.GracePeriodSeconds
member.summary: The duration in seconds before the object should be deleted. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates delete immediately. If this value is nil, the default grace period for the specified type will be used. Defaults to a per object value if not specified. zero means delete immediately.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.DeleteOptions.OrphanDependents
member.summary: Deprecated: please use the PropagationPolicy, this field will be deprecated in 1.7. Should the dependent objects be orphaned. If true/false, the "orphan" finalizer will be added to/removed from the object's finalizers list. Either this field or PropagationPolicy may be set, but not both.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.DeleteOptions.Preconditions
member.summary: Must be fulfilled before a deletion is carried out. If not possible, a 409 Conflict status will be returned.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.DeleteOptions.PropagationPolicy
member.summary: Whether and how garbage collection will be performed. Either this field or OrphanDependents may be set, but not both. The default policy is decided by the existing finalizer set in the metadata.finalizers and the resource-specific default policy. Acceptable values are: 'Orphan' - orphan the dependents; 'Background' - allow the garbage collector to delete the dependents in the background; 'Foreground' - a cascading policy that deletes all dependents in the foreground.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.GroupVersionForDiscovery
member.summary: GroupVersion contains the "group/version" and "version" string of a version. It is made a struct to keep extensibility.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.GroupVersionForDiscovery.GroupVersion
member.summary: groupVersion specifies the API group and version in the form "group/version"

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.GroupVersionForDiscovery.Version
member.summary: version specifies the version in the form of "version". This is to save the clients the trouble of splitting the GroupVersion.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.LabelSelector
member.summary: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all objects. A null label selector matches no objects.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.LabelSelector.MatchExpressions
member.summary: matchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.LabelSelector.MatchLabels
member.summary: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.LabelSelectorRequirement
member.summary: A label selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that relates the key and values.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.LabelSelectorRequirement.Key
member.summary: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.LabelSelectorRequirement.Operator
member.summary: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.LabelSelectorRequirement.Values
member.summary: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ListMeta
member.summary: ListMeta describes metadata that synthetic resources must have, including lists and various status objects. A resource may have only one of {ObjectMeta, ListMeta}.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ListMeta.Continue
member.summary: continue may be set if the user set a limit on the number of items returned, and indicates that the server has more data available. The value is opaque and may be used to issue another request to the endpoint that served this list to retrieve the next set of available objects. Continuing a consistent list may not be possible if the server configuration has changed or more than a few minutes have passed. The resourceVersion field returned when using this continue value will be identical to the value in the first response, unless you have received this token from an error message.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ListMeta.RemainingItemCount
member.summary: remainingItemCount is the number of subsequent items in the list which are not included in this list response. If the list request contained label or field selectors, then the number of remaining items is unknown and the field will be left unset and omitted during serialization. If the list is complete (either because it is not chunking or because this is the last chunk), then there are no more remaining items and this field will be left unset and omitted during serialization. Servers older than v1.15 do not set this field. The intended use of the remainingItemCount is *estimating* the size of a collection. Clients should not rely on the remainingItemCount to be set or to be exact.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ListMeta.ResourceVersion
member.summary: String that identifies the server's internal version of this object that can be used by clients to determine when objects have changed. Value must be treated as opaque by clients and passed unmodified back to the server. Populated by the system. Read-only. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ListMeta.SelfLink
member.summary:
selfLink is a URL representing this object. Populated by the system. Read-only.
DEPRECATED Kubernetes will stop propagating this field in 1.20 release and the field is planned to be removed in 1.21 release.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ManagedFieldsEntry
member.summary: ManagedFieldsEntry is a workflow-id, a FieldSet and the group version of the resource that the fieldset applies to.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ManagedFieldsEntry.FieldsType
member.summary: FieldsType is the discriminator for the different fields format and version. There is currently only one possible value: "FieldsV1"

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ManagedFieldsEntry.FieldsV1
member.summary: FieldsV1 holds the first JSON version format as described in the "FieldsV1" type.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ManagedFieldsEntry.Manager
member.summary: Manager is an identifier of the workflow managing these fields.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ManagedFieldsEntry.Operation
member.summary: Operation is the type of operation which lead to this ManagedFieldsEntry being created. The only valid values for this field are 'Apply' and 'Update'.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ManagedFieldsEntry.Time
member.summary: Time is timestamp of when these fields were set. It should always be empty if Operation is 'Apply'

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta
member.summary: ObjectMeta is metadata that all persisted resources must have, which includes all objects users must create.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.Annotations
member.summary: Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.ClusterName
member.summary: The name of the cluster which the object belongs to. This is used to distinguish resources with same name and namespace in different clusters. This field is not set anywhere right now and apiserver is going to ignore it if set in create or update request.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.CreationTimestamp
member.summary:
CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations. Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.
Populated by the system. Read-only. Null for lists. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.DeletionGracePeriodSeconds
member.summary: Number of seconds allowed for this object to gracefully terminate before it will be removed from the system. Only set when deletionTimestamp is also set. May only be shortened. Read-only.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.DeletionTimestamp
member.summary:
DeletionTimestamp is RFC 3339 date and time at which this resource will be deleted. This field is set by the server when a graceful deletion is requested by the user, and is not directly settable by a client. The resource is expected to be deleted (no longer visible from resource lists, and not reachable by name) after the time in this field, once the finalizers list is empty. As long as the finalizers list contains items, deletion is blocked. Once the deletionTimestamp is set, this value may not be unset or be set further into the future, although it may be shortened or the resource may be deleted prior to this time. For example, a user may request that a pod is deleted in 30 seconds. The Kubelet will react by sending a graceful termination signal to the containers in the pod. After that 30 seconds, the Kubelet will send a hard termination signal (SIGKILL) to the container and after cleanup, remove the pod from the API. In the presence of network partitions, this object may still exist after this timestamp, until an administrator or automated process can determine the resource is fully terminated. If not set, graceful deletion of the object has not been requested.
Populated by the system when a graceful deletion is requested. Read-only. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.Finalizers
member.summary: Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries in this list can only be removed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.GenerateName
member.summary:
GenerateName is an optional prefix, used by the server, to generate a unique name ONLY IF the Name field has not been provided. If this field is used, the name returned to the client will be different than the name passed. This value will also be combined with a unique suffix. The provided value has the same validation rules as the Name field, and may be truncated by the length of the suffix required to make the value unique on the server.
If this field is specified and the generated name exists, the server will NOT return a 409 - instead, it will either return 201 Created or 500 with Reason ServerTimeout indicating a unique name could not be found in the time allotted, and the client should retry (optionally after the time indicated in the Retry-After header).
Applied only if Name is not specified. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#idempotency

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.Generation
member.summary: A sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state. Populated by the system. Read-only.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.Labels
member.summary: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.ManagedFields
member.summary: ManagedFields maps workflow-id and version to the set of fields that are managed by that workflow. This is mostly for internal housekeeping, and users typically shouldn't need to set or understand this field. A workflow can be the user's name, a controller's name, or the name of a specific apply path like "ci-cd". The set of fields is always in the version that the workflow used when modifying the object.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.Name
member.summary: Name must be unique within a namespace. Is required when creating resources, although some resources may allow a client to request the generation of an appropriate name automatically. Name is primarily intended for creation idempotence and configuration definition. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.Namespace
member.summary:
Namespace defines the space within each name must be unique. An empty namespace is equivalent to the "default" namespace, but "default" is the canonical representation. Not all objects are required to be scoped to a namespace - the value of this field for those objects will be empty.
Must be a DNS_LABEL. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/namespaces

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.OwnerReferences
member.summary: List of objects depended by this object. If ALL objects in the list have been deleted, this object will be garbage collected. If this object is managed by a controller, then an entry in this list will point to this controller, with the controller field set to true. There cannot be more than one managing controller.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.ResourceVersion
member.summary:
An opaque value that represents the internal version of this object that can be used by clients to determine when objects have changed. May be used for optimistic concurrency, change detection, and the watch operation on a resource or set of resources. Clients must treat these values as opaque and passed unmodified back to the server. They may only be valid for a particular resource or set of resources.
Populated by the system. Read-only. Value must be treated as opaque by clients and . More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.SelfLink
member.summary:
SelfLink is a URL representing this object. Populated by the system. Read-only.
DEPRECATED Kubernetes will stop propagating this field in 1.20 release and the field is planned to be removed in 1.21 release.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ObjectMeta.Uid
member.summary:
UID is the unique in time and space value for this object. It is typically generated by the server on successful creation of a resource and is not allowed to change on PUT operations.
Populated by the system. Read-only. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#uids

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.OwnerReference
member.summary: OwnerReference contains enough information to let you identify an owning object. An owning object must be in the same namespace as the dependent, or be cluster-scoped, so there is no namespace field.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.OwnerReference.BlockOwnerDeletion
member.summary: If true, AND if the owner has the "foregroundDeletion" finalizer, then the owner cannot be deleted from the key-value store until this reference is removed. Defaults to false. To set this field, a user needs "delete" permission of the owner, otherwise 422 (Unprocessable Entity) will be returned.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.OwnerReference.Controller
member.summary: If true, this reference points to the managing controller.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.OwnerReference.Name
member.summary: Name of the referent. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.OwnerReference.Uid
member.summary: UID of the referent. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#uids

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.Preconditions
member.summary: Preconditions must be fulfilled before an operation (update, delete, etc.) is carried out.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.Preconditions.ResourceVersion
member.summary: Specifies the target ResourceVersion

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.Preconditions.Uid
member.summary: Specifies the target UID.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ServerAddressByClientCIDR
member.summary: ServerAddressByClientCIDR helps the client to determine the server address that they should use, depending on the clientCIDR that they match.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ServerAddressByClientCIDR.ClientCIDR
member.summary: The CIDR with which clients can match their IP to figure out the server address that they should use.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.ServerAddressByClientCIDR.ServerAddress
member.summary: Address of this server, suitable for a client that matches the above CIDR. This can be a hostname, hostname:port, IP or IP:port.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.Status
member.summary: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.Status.Code
member.summary: Suggested HTTP return code for this status, 0 if not set.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.Status.Details
member.summary: Extended data associated with the reason. Each reason may define its own extended details. This field is optional and the data returned is not guaranteed to conform to any schema except that defined by the reason type.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.Status.Message
member.summary: A human-readable description of the status of this operation.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.Status.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.Status.Reason
member.summary: A machine-readable description of why this operation is in the "Failure" status. If this value is empty there is no information available. A Reason clarifies an HTTP status code but does not override it.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.Status.StatusValue
member.summary: Status of the operation. One of: "Success" or "Failure". More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#spec-and-status

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.StatusCause
member.summary: StatusCause provides more information about an api.Status failure, including cases when multiple errors are encountered.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.StatusCause.Field
member.summary:
The field of the resource that has caused this error, as named by its JSON serialization. May include dot and postfix notation for nested attributes. Arrays are zero-indexed. Fields may appear more than once in an array of causes due to fields having multiple errors. Optional.
Examples: "name" - the field "name" on the current resource "items[0].name" - the field "name" on the first array entry in "items"

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.StatusCause.Message
member.summary: A human-readable description of the cause of the error. This field may be presented as-is to a reader.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.StatusCause.Reason
member.summary: A machine-readable description of the cause of the error. If this value is empty there is no information available.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.StatusDetails
member.summary: StatusDetails is a set of additional properties that MAY be set by the server to provide additional information about a response. The Reason field of a Status object defines what attributes will be set. Clients must ignore fields that do not match the defined type of each attribute, and should assume that any attribute may be empty, invalid, or under defined.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.StatusDetails.Causes
member.summary: The Causes array includes more details associated with the StatusReason failure. Not all StatusReasons may provide detailed causes.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.StatusDetails.Group
member.summary: The group attribute of the resource associated with the status StatusReason.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.StatusDetails.Name
member.summary: The name attribute of the resource associated with the status StatusReason (when there is a single name which can be described).

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.StatusDetails.RetryAfterSeconds
member.summary: If specified, the time in seconds before the operation should be retried. Some errors may indicate the client must take an alternate action - for those errors this field may indicate how long to wait before taking the alternate action.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.StatusDetails.Uid
member.summary: UID of the resource. (when there is a single resource which can be described). More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#uids

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.WatchEvent
member.summary: Event represents a single event to a watched resource.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Meta.V1.WatchEvent.Object
member.summary: Object is: * If Type is Added or Modified: the new state of the object. * If Type is Deleted: the state of the object immediately before deletion. * If Type is Error: *Status is recommended; other types may make sense depending on context.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.IPBlock
member.summary: IPBlock describes a particular CIDR (Ex. "192.168.1.1/24") that is allowed to the pods matched by a NetworkPolicySpec's podSelector. The except entry describes CIDRs that should not be included within this rule.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.IPBlock.Cidr
member.summary: CIDR is a string representing the IP Block Valid examples are "192.168.1.1/24"

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.IPBlock.Except
member.summary: Except is a slice of CIDRs that should not be included within an IP Block Valid examples are "192.168.1.1/24" Except values will be rejected if they are outside the CIDR range

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicy
member.summary: NetworkPolicy describes what network traffic is allowed for a set of Pods

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicy.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicy.Spec
member.summary: Specification of the desired behavior for this NetworkPolicy.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyEgressRule
member.summary: NetworkPolicyEgressRule describes a particular set of traffic that is allowed out of pods matched by a NetworkPolicySpec's podSelector. The traffic must match both ports and to. This type is beta-level in 1.8

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyEgressRule.Ports
member.summary: List of destination ports for outgoing traffic. Each item in this list is combined using a logical OR. If this field is empty or missing, this rule matches all ports (traffic not restricted by port). If this field is present and contains at least one item, then this rule allows traffic only if the traffic matches at least one port in the list.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyEgressRule.To
member.summary: List of destinations for outgoing traffic of pods selected for this rule. Items in this list are combined using a logical OR operation. If this field is empty or missing, this rule matches all destinations (traffic not restricted by destination). If this field is present and contains at least one item, this rule allows traffic only if the traffic matches at least one item in the to list.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyIngressRule
member.summary: NetworkPolicyIngressRule describes a particular set of traffic that is allowed to the pods matched by a NetworkPolicySpec's podSelector. The traffic must match both ports and from.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyIngressRule.From
member.summary: List of sources which should be able to access the pods selected for this rule. Items in this list are combined using a logical OR operation. If this field is empty or missing, this rule matches all sources (traffic not restricted by source). If this field is present and contains at least one item, this rule allows traffic only if the traffic matches at least one item in the from list.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyIngressRule.Ports
member.summary: List of ports which should be made accessible on the pods selected for this rule. Each item in this list is combined using a logical OR. If this field is empty or missing, this rule matches all ports (traffic not restricted by port). If this field is present and contains at least one item, then this rule allows traffic only if the traffic matches at least one port in the list.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyList
member.summary: NetworkPolicyList is a list of NetworkPolicy objects.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyList.Items
member.summary: Items is a list of schema objects.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyPeer
member.summary: NetworkPolicyPeer describes a peer to allow traffic from. Only certain combinations of fields are allowed

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyPeer.IpBlock
member.summary: IPBlock defines policy on a particular IPBlock. If this field is set then neither of the other fields can be.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyPeer.NamespaceSelector
member.summary:
Selects Namespaces using cluster-scoped labels. This field follows standard label selector semantics; if present but empty, it selects all namespaces.
If PodSelector is also set, then the NetworkPolicyPeer as a whole selects the Pods matching PodSelector in the Namespaces selected by NamespaceSelector. Otherwise it selects all Pods in the Namespaces selected by NamespaceSelector.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyPeer.PodSelector
member.summary:
This is a label selector which selects Pods. This field follows standard label selector semantics; if present but empty, it selects all pods.
If NamespaceSelector is also set, then the NetworkPolicyPeer as a whole selects the Pods matching PodSelector in the Namespaces selected by NamespaceSelector. Otherwise it selects the Pods matching PodSelector in the policy's own Namespace.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyPort
member.summary: NetworkPolicyPort describes a port to allow traffic on

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyPort.Port
member.summary: The port on the given protocol. This can either be a numerical or named port on a pod. If this field is not provided, this matches all port names and numbers.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicyPort.Protocol
member.summary: The protocol (TCP, UDP, or SCTP) which traffic must match. If not specified, this field defaults to TCP.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicySpec
member.summary: NetworkPolicySpec provides the specification of a NetworkPolicy

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicySpec.Egress
member.summary: List of egress rules to be applied to the selected pods. Outgoing traffic is allowed if there are no NetworkPolicies selecting the pod (and cluster policy otherwise allows the traffic), OR if the traffic matches at least one egress rule across all of the NetworkPolicy objects whose podSelector matches the pod. If this field is empty then this NetworkPolicy limits all outgoing traffic (and serves solely to ensure that the pods it selects are isolated by default). This field is beta-level in 1.8

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicySpec.Ingress
member.summary: List of ingress rules to be applied to the selected pods. Traffic is allowed to a pod if there are no NetworkPolicies selecting the pod (and cluster policy otherwise allows the traffic), OR if the traffic source is the pod's local node, OR if the traffic matches at least one ingress rule across all of the NetworkPolicy objects whose podSelector matches the pod. If this field is empty then this NetworkPolicy does not allow any traffic (and serves solely to ensure that the pods it selects are isolated by default)

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicySpec.PodSelector
member.summary: Selects the pods to which this NetworkPolicy object applies. The array of ingress rules is applied to any pods selected by this field. Multiple network policies can select the same set of pods. In this case, the ingress rules for each are combined additively. This field is NOT optional and follows standard label selector semantics. An empty podSelector matches all pods in this namespace.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1.NetworkPolicySpec.PolicyTypes
member.summary: List of rule types that the NetworkPolicy relates to. Valid options are "Ingress", "Egress", or "Ingress,Egress". If this field is not specified, it will default based on the existence of Ingress or Egress rules; policies that contain an Egress section are assumed to affect Egress, and all policies (whether or not they contain an Ingress section) are assumed to affect Ingress. If you want to write an egress-only policy, you must explicitly specify policyTypes [ "Egress" ]. Likewise, if you want to write a policy that specifies that no egress is allowed, you must specify a policyTypes value that include "Egress" (since such a policy would not include an Egress section and would otherwise default to just [ "Ingress" ]). This field is beta-level in 1.8

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.HTTPIngressPath
member.summary: HTTPIngressPath associates a path regex with a backend. Incoming urls matching the path are forwarded to the backend.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.HTTPIngressPath.Backend
member.summary: Backend defines the referenced service endpoint to which the traffic will be forwarded to.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.HTTPIngressPath.Path
member.summary: Path is an extended POSIX regex as defined by IEEE Std 1003.1, (i.e this follows the egrep/unix syntax, not the perl syntax) matched against the path of an incoming request. Currently it can contain characters disallowed from the conventional "path" part of a URL as defined by RFC 3986. Paths must begin with a '/'. If unspecified, the path defaults to a catch all sending traffic to the backend.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.HTTPIngressRuleValue
member.summary: HTTPIngressRuleValue is a list of http selectors pointing to backends. In the example: http://<host>/<path>?<searchpart> -> backend where where parts of the url correspond to RFC 3986, this resource will be used to match against everything after the last '/' and before the first '?' or '#'.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.HTTPIngressRuleValue.Paths
member.summary: A collection of paths that map requests to backends.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.Ingress
member.summary: Ingress is a collection of rules that allow inbound connections to reach the endpoints defined by a backend. An Ingress can be configured to give services externally-reachable urls, load balance traffic, terminate SSL, offer name based virtual hosting etc.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.Ingress.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.Ingress.Spec
member.summary: Spec is the desired state of the Ingress. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#spec-and-status

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.Ingress.Status
member.summary: Status is the current state of the Ingress. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#spec-and-status

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressBackend
member.summary: IngressBackend describes all endpoints for a given service and port.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressBackend.ServiceName
member.summary: Specifies the name of the referenced service.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressBackend.ServicePort
member.summary: Specifies the port of the referenced service.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressList
member.summary: IngressList is a collection of Ingress.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressList.Items
member.summary: Items is the list of Ingress.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressRule
member.summary: IngressRule represents the rules mapping the paths under a specified host to the related backend services. Incoming requests are first evaluated for a host match, then routed to the backend associated with the matching IngressRuleValue.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressRule.Host
member.summary: Host is the fully qualified domain name of a network host, as defined by RFC 3986. Note the following deviations from the "host" part of the URI as defined in the RFC: 1. IPs are not allowed. Currently an IngressRuleValue can only apply to the IP in the Spec of the parent Ingress. 2. The `:` delimiter is not respected because ports are not allowed. Currently the port of an Ingress is implicitly :80 for http and :443 for https. Both these may change in the future. Incoming requests are matched against the host before the IngressRuleValue. If the host is unspecified, the Ingress routes all traffic based on the specified IngressRuleValue.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressSpec
member.summary: IngressSpec describes the Ingress the user wishes to exist.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressSpec.Backend
member.summary: A default backend capable of servicing requests that don't match any rule. At least one of 'backend' or 'rules' must be specified. This field is optional to allow the loadbalancer controller or defaulting logic to specify a global default.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressSpec.Rules
member.summary: A list of host rules used to configure the Ingress. If unspecified, or no rule matches, all traffic is sent to the default backend.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressSpec.Tls
member.summary: TLS configuration. Currently the Ingress only supports a single TLS port, 443. If multiple members of this list specify different hosts, they will be multiplexed on the same port according to the hostname specified through the SNI TLS extension, if the ingress controller fulfilling the ingress supports SNI.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressStatus
member.summary: IngressStatus describe the current state of the Ingress.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressStatus.LoadBalancer
member.summary: LoadBalancer contains the current status of the load-balancer.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressTLS
member.summary: IngressTLS describes the transport layer security associated with an Ingress.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressTLS.Hosts
member.summary: Hosts are a list of hosts included in the TLS certificate. The values in this list must match the name/s used in the tlsSecret. Defaults to the wildcard host setting for the loadbalancer controller fulfilling this Ingress, if left unspecified.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Networking.V1Beta1.IngressTLS.SecretName
member.summary: SecretName is the name of the secret used to terminate SSL traffic on 443. Field is left optional to allow SSL routing based on SNI hostname alone. If the SNI host in a listener conflicts with the "Host" header field used by an IngressRule, the SNI host is used for termination and value of the Host header is used for routing.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Alpha1.Overhead
member.summary: Overhead structure represents the resource overhead associated with running a pod.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Alpha1.Overhead.PodFixed
member.summary: PodFixed represents the fixed resource overhead associated with running a pod.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Alpha1.RuntimeClass
member.summary: RuntimeClass defines a class of container runtime supported in the cluster. The RuntimeClass is used to determine which container runtime is used to run all containers in a pod. RuntimeClasses are (currently) manually defined by a user or cluster provisioner, and referenced in the PodSpec. The Kubelet is responsible for resolving the RuntimeClassName reference before running the pod. For more details, see https://git.k8s.io/enhancements/keps/sig-node/runtime-class.md

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Alpha1.RuntimeClass.Metadata
member.summary: More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Alpha1.RuntimeClass.Spec
member.summary: Specification of the RuntimeClass More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#spec-and-status

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Alpha1.RuntimeClassList
member.summary: RuntimeClassList is a list of RuntimeClass objects.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Alpha1.RuntimeClassList.Items
member.summary: Items is a list of schema objects.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Alpha1.RuntimeClassList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Alpha1.RuntimeClassSpec
member.summary: RuntimeClassSpec is a specification of a RuntimeClass. It contains parameters that are required to describe the RuntimeClass to the Container Runtime Interface (CRI) implementation, as well as any other components that need to understand how the pod will be run. The RuntimeClassSpec is immutable.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Alpha1.RuntimeClassSpec.Overhead
member.summary: Overhead represents the resource overhead associated with running a pod for a given RuntimeClass. For more details, see https://git.k8s.io/enhancements/keps/sig-node/20190226-pod-overhead.md This field is alpha-level as of Kubernetes v1.15, and is only honored by servers that enable the PodOverhead feature.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Alpha1.RuntimeClassSpec.RuntimeHandler
member.summary: RuntimeHandler specifies the underlying runtime and configuration that the CRI implementation will use to handle pods of this class. The possible values are specific to the node & CRI configuration. It is assumed that all handlers are available on every node, and handlers of the same name are equivalent on every node. For example, a handler called "runc" might specify that the runc OCI runtime (using native Linux containers) will be used to run the containers in a pod. The RuntimeHandler must conform to the DNS Label (RFC 1123) requirements and is immutable.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Alpha1.RuntimeClassSpec.Scheduling
member.summary: Scheduling holds the scheduling constraints to ensure that pods running with this RuntimeClass are scheduled to nodes that support it. If scheduling is nil, this RuntimeClass is assumed to be supported by all nodes.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Alpha1.Scheduling
member.summary: Scheduling specifies the scheduling constraints for nodes supporting a RuntimeClass.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Alpha1.Scheduling.NodeSelector
member.summary: nodeSelector lists labels that must be present on nodes that support this RuntimeClass. Pods using this RuntimeClass can only be scheduled to a node matched by this selector. The RuntimeClass nodeSelector is merged with a pod's existing nodeSelector. Any conflicts will cause the pod to be rejected in admission.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Alpha1.Scheduling.Tolerations
member.summary: tolerations are appended (excluding duplicates) to pods running with this RuntimeClass during admission, effectively unioning the set of nodes tolerated by the pod and the RuntimeClass.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Beta1.Overhead
member.summary: Overhead structure represents the resource overhead associated with running a pod.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Beta1.Overhead.PodFixed
member.summary: PodFixed represents the fixed resource overhead associated with running a pod.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Beta1.RuntimeClass
member.summary: RuntimeClass defines a class of container runtime supported in the cluster. The RuntimeClass is used to determine which container runtime is used to run all containers in a pod. RuntimeClasses are (currently) manually defined by a user or cluster provisioner, and referenced in the PodSpec. The Kubelet is responsible for resolving the RuntimeClassName reference before running the pod. For more details, see https://git.k8s.io/enhancements/keps/sig-node/runtime-class.md

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Beta1.RuntimeClass.Handler
member.summary: Handler specifies the underlying runtime and configuration that the CRI implementation will use to handle pods of this class. The possible values are specific to the node & CRI configuration. It is assumed that all handlers are available on every node, and handlers of the same name are equivalent on every node. For example, a handler called "runc" might specify that the runc OCI runtime (using native Linux containers) will be used to run the containers in a pod. The Handler must conform to the DNS Label (RFC 1123) requirements, and is immutable.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Beta1.RuntimeClass.Metadata
member.summary: More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Beta1.RuntimeClass.Overhead
member.summary: Overhead represents the resource overhead associated with running a pod for a given RuntimeClass. For more details, see https://git.k8s.io/enhancements/keps/sig-node/20190226-pod-overhead.md This field is alpha-level as of Kubernetes v1.15, and is only honored by servers that enable the PodOverhead feature.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Beta1.RuntimeClass.Scheduling
member.summary: Scheduling holds the scheduling constraints to ensure that pods running with this RuntimeClass are scheduled to nodes that support it. If scheduling is nil, this RuntimeClass is assumed to be supported by all nodes.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Beta1.RuntimeClassList
member.summary: RuntimeClassList is a list of RuntimeClass objects.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Beta1.RuntimeClassList.Items
member.summary: Items is a list of schema objects.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Beta1.RuntimeClassList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Beta1.Scheduling
member.summary: Scheduling specifies the scheduling constraints for nodes supporting a RuntimeClass.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Beta1.Scheduling.NodeSelector
member.summary: nodeSelector lists labels that must be present on nodes that support this RuntimeClass. Pods using this RuntimeClass can only be scheduled to a node matched by this selector. The RuntimeClass nodeSelector is merged with a pod's existing nodeSelector. Any conflicts will cause the pod to be rejected in admission.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Node.V1Beta1.Scheduling.Tolerations
member.summary: tolerations are appended (excluding duplicates) to pods running with this RuntimeClass during admission, effectively unioning the set of nodes tolerated by the pod and the RuntimeClass.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Pkg.Version.Info
member.summary: Info contains versioning information. how we'll want to distribute that information.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.AllowedCSIDriver
member.summary: AllowedCSIDriver represents a single inline CSI Driver that is allowed to be used.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.AllowedCSIDriver.Name
member.summary: Name is the registered name of the CSI driver

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.AllowedFlexVolume
member.summary: AllowedFlexVolume represents a single Flexvolume that is allowed to be used.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.AllowedFlexVolume.Driver
member.summary: driver is the name of the Flexvolume driver.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.AllowedHostPath
member.summary: AllowedHostPath defines the host volume conditions that will be enabled by a policy for pods to use. It requires the path prefix to be defined.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.AllowedHostPath.PathPrefix
member.summary:
pathPrefix is the path prefix that the host volume must match. It does not support `*`. Trailing slashes are trimmed when validating the path prefix with a host path.
Examples: `/foo` would allow `/foo`, `/foo/` and `/foo/bar` `/foo` would not allow `/food` or `/etc/foo`

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.AllowedHostPath.ReadOnly
member.summary: when set to true, will allow host volumes matching the pathPrefix only if all volume mounts are readOnly.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.Eviction
member.summary: Eviction evicts a pod from its node subject to certain policies and safety constraints. This is a subresource of Pod. A request to cause such an eviction is created by POSTing to .../pods/<pod name>/evictions.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.Eviction.DeleteOptions
member.summary: DeleteOptions may be provided

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.Eviction.Metadata
member.summary: ObjectMeta describes the pod that is being evicted.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.FSGroupStrategyOptions
member.summary: FSGroupStrategyOptions defines the strategy type and options used to create the strategy.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.FSGroupStrategyOptions.Ranges
member.summary: ranges are the allowed ranges of fs groups. If you would like to force a single fs group then supply a single range with the same start and end. Required for MustRunAs.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.FSGroupStrategyOptions.Rule
member.summary: rule is the strategy that will dictate what FSGroup is used in the SecurityContext.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.HostPortRange
member.summary: HostPortRange defines a range of host ports that will be enabled by a policy for pods to use. It requires both the start and end to be defined.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.HostPortRange.Max
member.summary: max is the end of the range, inclusive.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.HostPortRange.Min
member.summary: min is the start of the range, inclusive.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.IDRange
member.summary: IDRange provides a min/max of an allowed range of IDs.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.IDRange.Max
member.summary: max is the end of the range, inclusive.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.IDRange.Min
member.summary: min is the start of the range, inclusive.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodDisruptionBudget
member.summary: PodDisruptionBudget is an object to define the max disruption that can be caused to a collection of pods

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodDisruptionBudget.Spec
member.summary: Specification of the desired behavior of the PodDisruptionBudget.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodDisruptionBudget.Status
member.summary: Most recently observed status of the PodDisruptionBudget.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodDisruptionBudgetList
member.summary: PodDisruptionBudgetList is a collection of PodDisruptionBudgets.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodDisruptionBudgetSpec
member.summary: PodDisruptionBudgetSpec is a description of a PodDisruptionBudget.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodDisruptionBudgetSpec.MaxUnavailable
member.summary: An eviction is allowed if at most "maxUnavailable" pods selected by "selector" are unavailable after the eviction, i.e. even in absence of the evicted pod. For example, one can prevent all voluntary evictions by specifying 0. This is a mutually exclusive setting with "minAvailable".

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodDisruptionBudgetSpec.MinAvailable
member.summary: An eviction is allowed if at least "minAvailable" pods selected by "selector" will still be available after the eviction, i.e. even in the absence of the evicted pod. So for example you can prevent all voluntary evictions by specifying "100%".

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodDisruptionBudgetSpec.Selector
member.summary: Label query over pods whose evictions are managed by the disruption budget.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodDisruptionBudgetStatus
member.summary: PodDisruptionBudgetStatus represents information about the status of a PodDisruptionBudget. Status may trail the actual state of a system.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodDisruptionBudgetStatus.CurrentHealthy
member.summary: current number of healthy pods

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodDisruptionBudgetStatus.DesiredHealthy
member.summary: minimum desired number of healthy pods

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodDisruptionBudgetStatus.DisruptedPods
member.summary: DisruptedPods contains information about pods whose eviction was processed by the API server eviction subresource handler but has not yet been observed by the PodDisruptionBudget controller. A pod will be in this map from the time when the API server processed the eviction request to the time when the pod is seen by PDB controller as having been marked for deletion (or after a timeout). The key in the map is the name of the pod and the value is the time when the API server processed the eviction request. If the deletion didn't occur and a pod is still there it will be removed from the list automatically by PodDisruptionBudget controller after some time. If everything goes smooth this map should be empty for the most of the time. Large number of entries in the map may indicate problems with pod deletions.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodDisruptionBudgetStatus.DisruptionsAllowed
member.summary: Number of pod disruptions that are currently allowed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodDisruptionBudgetStatus.ExpectedPods
member.summary: total number of pods counted by this disruption budget

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodDisruptionBudgetStatus.ObservedGeneration
member.summary: Most recent generation observed when updating this PDB status. PodDisruptionsAllowed and other status informatio is valid only if observedGeneration equals to PDB's object generation.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicy
member.summary: PodSecurityPolicy governs the ability to make requests that affect the Security Context that will be applied to a pod and container.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicy.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicy.Spec
member.summary: spec defines the policy enforced.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicyList
member.summary: PodSecurityPolicyList is a list of PodSecurityPolicy objects.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicyList.Items
member.summary: items is a list of schema objects.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicyList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard list metadata. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec
member.summary: PodSecurityPolicySpec defines the policy enforced.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.AllowPrivilegeEscalation
member.summary: allowPrivilegeEscalation determines if a pod can request to allow privilege escalation. If unspecified, defaults to true.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.AllowedCSIDrivers
member.summary: AllowedCSIDrivers is a whitelist of inline CSI drivers that must be explicitly set to be embedded within a pod spec. An empty value indicates that any CSI driver can be used for inline ephemeral volumes. This is an alpha field, and is only honored if the API server enables the CSIInlineVolume feature gate.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.AllowedCapabilities
member.summary: allowedCapabilities is a list of capabilities that can be requested to add to the container. Capabilities in this field may be added at the pod author's discretion. You must not list a capability in both allowedCapabilities and requiredDropCapabilities.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.AllowedFlexVolumes
member.summary: allowedFlexVolumes is a whitelist of allowed Flexvolumes. Empty or nil indicates that all Flexvolumes may be used. This parameter is effective only when the usage of the Flexvolumes is allowed in the "volumes" field.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.AllowedHostPaths
member.summary: allowedHostPaths is a white list of allowed host paths. Empty indicates that all host paths may be used.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.AllowedProcMountTypes
member.summary: AllowedProcMountTypes is a whitelist of allowed ProcMountTypes. Empty or nil indicates that only the DefaultProcMountType may be used. This requires the ProcMountType feature flag to be enabled.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.AllowedUnsafeSysctls
member.summary:
allowedUnsafeSysctls is a list of explicitly allowed unsafe sysctls, defaults to none. Each entry is either a plain sysctl name or ends in "*" in which case it is considered as a prefix of allowed sysctls. Single * means all unsafe sysctls are allowed. Kubelet has to whitelist all allowed unsafe sysctls explicitly to avoid rejection.
Examples: e.g. "foo/*" allows "foo/bar", "foo/baz", etc. e.g. "foo.*" allows "foo.bar", "foo.baz", etc.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.DefaultAddCapabilities
member.summary: defaultAddCapabilities is the default set of capabilities that will be added to the container unless the pod spec specifically drops the capability. You may not list a capability in both defaultAddCapabilities and requiredDropCapabilities. Capabilities added here are implicitly allowed, and need not be included in the allowedCapabilities list.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.DefaultAllowPrivilegeEscalation
member.summary: defaultAllowPrivilegeEscalation controls the default setting for whether a process can gain more privileges than its parent process.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.ForbiddenSysctls
member.summary:
forbiddenSysctls is a list of explicitly forbidden sysctls, defaults to none. Each entry is either a plain sysctl name or ends in "*" in which case it is considered as a prefix of forbidden sysctls. Single * means all sysctls are forbidden.
Examples: e.g. "foo/*" forbids "foo/bar", "foo/baz", etc. e.g. "foo.*" forbids "foo.bar", "foo.baz", etc.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.FsGroup
member.summary: fsGroup is the strategy that will dictate what fs group is used by the SecurityContext.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.HostIPC
member.summary: hostIPC determines if the policy allows the use of HostIPC in the pod spec.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.HostNetwork
member.summary: hostNetwork determines if the policy allows the use of HostNetwork in the pod spec.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.HostPID
member.summary: hostPID determines if the policy allows the use of HostPID in the pod spec.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.HostPorts
member.summary: hostPorts determines which host port ranges are allowed to be exposed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.Privileged
member.summary: privileged determines if a pod can request to be run as privileged.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.ReadOnlyRootFilesystem
member.summary: readOnlyRootFilesystem when set to true will force containers to run with a read only root file system. If the container specifically requests to run with a non-read only root file system the PSP should deny the pod. If set to false the container may run with a read only root file system if it wishes but it will not be forced to.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.RequiredDropCapabilities
member.summary: requiredDropCapabilities are the capabilities that will be dropped from the container. These are required to be dropped and cannot be added.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.RunAsGroup
member.summary: RunAsGroup is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RunAsGroup values that may be set. If this field is omitted, the pod's RunAsGroup can take any value. This field requires the RunAsGroup feature gate to be enabled.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.RunAsUser
member.summary: runAsUser is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RunAsUser values that may be set.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.RuntimeClass
member.summary: runtimeClass is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RuntimeClasses for a pod. If this field is omitted, the pod's runtimeClassName field is unrestricted. Enforcement of this field depends on the RuntimeClass feature gate being enabled.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.SeLinux
member.summary: seLinux is the strategy that will dictate the allowable labels that may be set.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.SupplementalGroups
member.summary: supplementalGroups is the strategy that will dictate what supplemental groups are used by the SecurityContext.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.PodSecurityPolicySpec.Volumes
member.summary: volumes is a white list of allowed volume plugins. Empty indicates that no volumes may be used. To allow all volumes you may use '*'.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.RunAsGroupStrategyOptions
member.summary: RunAsGroupStrategyOptions defines the strategy type and any options used to create the strategy.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.RunAsGroupStrategyOptions.Ranges
member.summary: ranges are the allowed ranges of gids that may be used. If you would like to force a single gid then supply a single range with the same start and end. Required for MustRunAs.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.RunAsGroupStrategyOptions.Rule
member.summary: rule is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RunAsGroup values that may be set.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.RunAsUserStrategyOptions
member.summary: RunAsUserStrategyOptions defines the strategy type and any options used to create the strategy.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.RunAsUserStrategyOptions.Ranges
member.summary: ranges are the allowed ranges of uids that may be used. If you would like to force a single uid then supply a single range with the same start and end. Required for MustRunAs.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.RunAsUserStrategyOptions.Rule
member.summary: rule is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RunAsUser values that may be set.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.RuntimeClassStrategyOptions
member.summary: RuntimeClassStrategyOptions define the strategy that will dictate the allowable RuntimeClasses for a pod.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.RuntimeClassStrategyOptions.AllowedRuntimeClassNames
member.summary: allowedRuntimeClassNames is a whitelist of RuntimeClass names that may be specified on a pod. A value of "*" means that any RuntimeClass name is allowed, and must be the only item in the list. An empty list requires the RuntimeClassName field to be unset.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.RuntimeClassStrategyOptions.DefaultRuntimeClassName
member.summary: defaultRuntimeClassName is the default RuntimeClassName to set on the pod. The default MUST be allowed by the allowedRuntimeClassNames list. A value of nil does not mutate the Pod.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.SELinuxStrategyOptions
member.summary: SELinuxStrategyOptions defines the strategy type and any options used to create the strategy.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.SELinuxStrategyOptions.Rule
member.summary: rule is the strategy that will dictate the allowable labels that may be set.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.SELinuxStrategyOptions.SeLinuxOptions
member.summary: seLinuxOptions required to run as; required for MustRunAs More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.SupplementalGroupsStrategyOptions
member.summary: SupplementalGroupsStrategyOptions defines the strategy type and options used to create the strategy.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.SupplementalGroupsStrategyOptions.Ranges
member.summary: ranges are the allowed ranges of supplemental groups. If you would like to force a single supplemental group then supply a single range with the same start and end. Required for MustRunAs.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Policy.V1Beta1.SupplementalGroupsStrategyOptions.Rule
member.summary: rule is the strategy that will dictate what supplemental groups is used in the SecurityContext.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.AggregationRule
member.summary: AggregationRule describes how to locate ClusterRoles to aggregate into the ClusterRole

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.AggregationRule.ClusterRoleSelectors
member.summary: ClusterRoleSelectors holds a list of selectors which will be used to find ClusterRoles and create the rules. If any of the selectors match, then the ClusterRole's permissions will be added

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.ClusterRole
member.summary: ClusterRole is a cluster level, logical grouping of PolicyRules that can be referenced as a unit by a RoleBinding or ClusterRoleBinding.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.ClusterRole.AggregationRule
member.summary: AggregationRule is an optional field that describes how to build the Rules for this ClusterRole. If AggregationRule is set, then the Rules are controller managed and direct changes to Rules will be stomped by the controller.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.ClusterRole.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.ClusterRole.Rules
member.summary: Rules holds all the PolicyRules for this ClusterRole

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.ClusterRoleBinding
member.summary: ClusterRoleBinding references a ClusterRole, but not contain it. It can reference a ClusterRole in the global namespace, and adds who information via Subject.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.ClusterRoleBinding.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.ClusterRoleBinding.RoleRef
member.summary: RoleRef can only reference a ClusterRole in the global namespace. If the RoleRef cannot be resolved, the Authorizer must return an error.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.ClusterRoleBinding.Subjects
member.summary: Subjects holds references to the objects the role applies to.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.ClusterRoleBindingList
member.summary: ClusterRoleBindingList is a collection of ClusterRoleBindings

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.ClusterRoleBindingList.Items
member.summary: Items is a list of ClusterRoleBindings

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.ClusterRoleBindingList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.ClusterRoleList
member.summary: ClusterRoleList is a collection of ClusterRoles

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.ClusterRoleList.Items
member.summary: Items is a list of ClusterRoles

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.ClusterRoleList.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.PolicyRule
member.summary: PolicyRule holds information that describes a policy rule, but does not contain information about who the rule applies to or which namespace the rule applies to.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.PolicyRule.ApiGroups
member.summary: APIGroups is the name of the APIGroup that contains the resources. If multiple API groups are specified, any action requested against one of the enumerated resources in any API group will be allowed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.PolicyRule.NonResourceURLs
member.summary: NonResourceURLs is a set of partial urls that a user should have access to. *s are allowed, but only as the full, final step in the path Since non-resource URLs are not namespaced, this field is only applicable for ClusterRoles referenced from a ClusterRoleBinding. Rules can either apply to API resources (such as "pods" or "secrets") or non-resource URL paths (such as "/api"), but not both.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.PolicyRule.ResourceNames
member.summary: ResourceNames is an optional white list of names that the rule applies to. An empty set means that everything is allowed.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.PolicyRule.Resources
member.summary: Resources is a list of resources this rule applies to. ResourceAll represents all resources.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.PolicyRule.Verbs
member.summary: Verbs is a list of Verbs that apply to ALL the ResourceKinds and AttributeRestrictions contained in this rule. VerbAll represents all kinds.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.Role
member.summary: Role is a namespaced, logical grouping of PolicyRules that can be referenced as a unit by a RoleBinding.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.Role.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.Role.Rules
member.summary: Rules holds all the PolicyRules for this Role

member.name: T:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.RoleBinding
member.summary: RoleBinding references a role, but does not contain it. It can reference a Role in the same namespace or a ClusterRole in the global namespace. It adds who information via Subjects and namespace information by which namespace it exists in. RoleBindings in a given namespace only have effect in that namespace.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.RoleBinding.Metadata
member.summary: Standard object's metadata.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.RoleBinding.RoleRef
member.summary: RoleRef can reference a Role in the current namespace or a ClusterRole in the global namespace. If the RoleRef cannot be resolved, the Authorizer must return an error.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.RoleBinding.Subjects
member.summary: Subjects holds references to the objects the role applies to.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Kubernetes.Types.Outputs.Rbac.V1.Subject.ApiGroup
member.summary: APIGroup holds the API group of the referenced subject. Defaults to "" for ServiceAccount subjects. Defaults to "rbac.authorization.k8s.io" for User and Group subjects.
